loans.name: Jubilee Bakyara Twimukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en: M. Flarina is the leader of Jubilee bakyara twimukye group in Ibanda. She is 35 years old and married with three children. Flarina has had a business dealing in goats for ten years; she buys and sells goats with the help of her husband. She is able to save 300,000/= monthly. She is also involved in the sale of produce and owns rentals. She needs a loan to be able to purchase more goats. She is very hard working and her dream is to see all her children attain the best education.

loans.use: Purchasing more goats for her business.

loans.name: Anabelle Dolores

texts.es:
Anabelle de 52 años, es una microempresaria que comenzó con pocos víveres y ahora tiene una tienda surtida. Tiene con su tienda 10 años ya que la ha sabido administrar bien y ahora la tiene surtida. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h30pm vendiendo víveres. Quiere continuar con su negocio y seguir teniendo ingresos para ayudar económicamente a su familia. Pero por ahora quiere el préstamo para medicinas y poder tener las fuerzas que siempre ha tenido. En el futuro quiere seguir incrementando su negocio
texts.en:
Anabelle, 52, is a micro businesswoman who started out with just a few food items; today she has a well stocked store.  She’s had her store for 10 years and she’s run it well; today it is well stocked.

She is open at present from 6am until 10:30pm selling foodstuffs.  She wants to stay in business and continue to have income to help her family economically.  For now she needs the loan for medicine in order to have the strength she’s had to date.  In the future she’d like to continue expanding the business.

loans.use: For medicine.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan K. is a married man with seven children; five are school-going children while two have graduated from school. He operates a local brew business made from palm tree sap, selling from home to his neighbors. 

He decided to join Yehu because of its accessibility for sustainable financial services. With the Kshs 40,000 he plans to purchase construction supplies for his house. 

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and establish another business to earn more profit to meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies for his house

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support six children. Jocelyn is a married woman and earns a living buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more rice to sell. Jocelyn has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to expand her business and support the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 33-year-old man, married and father of two. He lives in Tyre and works as a car mechanic. He opened his shop in 2000. He is considered an expert in his domain. His main concern is to provide his children and family with education and good living conditions.

This is his first loan with Al Majmoua and he needs one to buy a new engine for his van. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his van.

loans.name: Gloria Franceny

texts.es:
Hace 3 meses a Gloria  M. se le presentó la oportunidad de montar su propio negocio, una cafetería ubicada en un punto estratégico del municipio de Sonsón en el departamento de Antioquia donde hoy en día puede aplicar todos los  conocimientos obtenidos en otro lugar donde trabajó durante 9 años; a pesar de tener su propio negocio Gloria arrienda tanto el local como la silletería y los utensilios necesarios para llevar a cabo su actividad, lo que ocupa gran parte de sus ganancias.

Gloria quiere surtir su cafetería con gran variedad de productos, que puede comprar al por mayor, pero como su negocio apenas comienza y las ventas aun no generan suficientes utilidades necesita capital para poder comprar la mercancía. Su gran sueño es poder tener un local propio y dotado completamente para ser la dueña de su cafetería y así poderle asegurar bienestar económico a sus 2 hijos, quienes aun son muy pequeños.
texts.en:
Gloria M. was presented with the opportunity three months ago to start her own business, a cafeteria located in a strategic area of the town of Sonsón in the Department of Antioquia. Today she is able to apply all of the knowledge she obtained while working at another establishment for nine years. Despite owning her business, Gloria pays rent on her location as well as the dining sets and utensils needed to operate her establishment. These expenses consume a large part of her earnings.

Gloria wants to stock her cafeteria with a wide variety of products. She wants to buy in bulk, but since her business just started and her sales have not generated enough profit, she needs capital to buy this merchandise. Her greatest wish is to have a shop that is fully equipped and become the outright owner of her cafeteria. This will enable her to secure the financial welfare of her two children, who are still very young.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta C. is married and has two children. She is in the business of farming. She tills her own land where she grows rice crops. Violeta is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor. Violeta works hard to sustain her family especially her children’s education. She hopes they will finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 47 years old. She owns rental houses made of iron sheets.  She rents out the houses to earn a living.  Being a married lady with three children, she works hard in her business so as to help her husband with household expenses.  She hopes to own rooms to rent for business purposes.  Mary testifies that since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to run her business well because of the business knowledge she gained from the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya.  She needs 20,000 KES to build more rental houses.

loans.use: to build more rental houses.

loans.name: Sector Los Olivos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sector Los Olivos está formado por 6 mujeres y dos hombres, quienes trabajan en diferentes actividades para  mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Son personas trabajadoras y siempre ven lo positivo de la vida. Viven por el sector del Carmen de Guzho, lugar en donde la mayoría de su gente labora en la agricultura o cría de animales, algunos también tienen sus negocios propios y muchos salen a laborar en diferentes actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca. 

La Señora. Nancy  vive en la comunidad del Carmen de Guzho, tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 8, 7, 4, 2 años y su ultimo hijo de apenas 3 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es chofer y labora conduciendo maquinaria pesada, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Nancy labora en una guardería, actividad que la realiza por que le gustan los niños y este trabajo también le permite cuidar de sus hijos, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con esta actividad.

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados. 

Los niños de la foto son hijos de algunas de las socias.
texts.en:
The “Sector Los Olivos” (Olives Sector) Communal Bank is formed of 6 women and 2 men who work in different activities to better their own household economies. They are hard-working people and always look at the positives in life. They live in the Carmen de Guzho sector, where the majority of people work in agriculture and livestock raising. Some also have their own stores, while many go out to work in different activities in the city of Cuenca.

Nancy lives in the community of Carmen de Guzho, is 29 years old, married, and has 5 children, aged 8, 7, 4, 2, and a baby of 3 months. Her 2 eldest children attend a little primary school in the city. Nancy's husband is a chauffeur and works driving heavy machinery. By means of their jobs, they have managed to build their own house.

Nancy works in a children's nursery, an activity she does because she loves children. This work permits her to care for her own children. She works from Monday through Friday from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm.

This is Nancy's first loan from the communal bank and she was invited to join by her sister-in-law. The money will be used to buy chickens so she can begin chicken raising. Her goal is to finish her house, which still needs some work.

The children in the photo belong to some of the members.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 48-year-old businessman. He and his wife Lucy have five children aged between 30 and 12. He has been a blacksmith for the past 18 years with a monthly income of KES. 5,000 to support his family. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by KADET staff. He will use the loan to purchase more scrap metals for his business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. His hope is to have a better living standard.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metals

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La señora Nidia Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es docente en la escuela R. Darío de Diría, Masaya. Ella se ha desempeñado como maestra desde hace 20 años.
El crédito que solicito la señora Nidia es personal el cual utilizara para reparar su vivienda en especial el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nidia Elena is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is a schoolteacher in Masaya. She has been working as a teacher for the past twenty years.
Mrs. Nidia is requesting this personal loan in order to make repairs to her house, especially the roof of her house.

loans.use: to improve her house, especially the roof.

loans.name: No

texts.en: No is a farmer. Her husband is an animal seller. Their income is $15 per day. She has two children, 12 and 9 years old. Both of the children are studying. Every month she has to spend $35 on food, $10 on school fees, $5 on house rental fee, and $5 on electricity. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy cattle to sell. Before, her husband was only doing farming but the income was not good so he tried to find another career to do besides farming. Therefore, he started to buy and resell animals and he found he could make a good income. Her husband likes this career and will buy and resell more cattle if he has enough money to do it. She expects to send all of her children to study in the university when they grow up.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Katia Pamela

texts.es:
Katia tiene  21 años de edad, es una joven soltera sin carga familiar. Vive con su hermano, dedicado a la agricultura y su madre que trabaja en una fábrica de pota. Katia vive en el distrito de Bernal en Sechura. En una comunidad mediana en vías de desarrollo.

Katia se dedica a la producción y comercialización de harina y chicha de Jora (maíz) y pequeños platos de comida. Además,  vende víveres, tubérculos (papa, camote, yuca)  y carnes. Esta actividad la realiza en  su propio domicilio, desde hace 3 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su madre. El negocio de Katia tiene clientela fidelizada y es muy conocido en la zona.

Ella solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar maíz para la preparación de la harina y chicha de Jora, además de otros insumos para la preparación de sus platos de comida. Así mismo, desea renovar sus vajillas. Esto le permitirá seguir ofreciendo buenos productos y dar una mejor calidad de servicio, lo que le dará mayores ingresos para desarrollarse  íntegramente. 

Katia,  posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su negocio, muestra rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Katia is 21. She is a single young woman without a family burden. She lives with her brother, who works in agriculture, and her mother, who works in a saucepan factory. Katia lives in the district of Bernal in Sechura, in a medium-sized developing community.

Katia makes and sells flour and Chicha de Jora [a traditional corn-based liquor], and finger food. On top of this, she also sells groceries, tubers (potato, sweet potato, yucca) and meats. She does this in her own home, and has had this business for three years. Her mother helps her. Katia's business has a loyal customer base and is very well-known in the zone.

She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of corn for making flour and Chicha de Jora. It will also be used to purchase other tools for making her food. She also wants to refresh her dishware.  This will allow her to continue offering good products and a higher quality of service. This will mean better income for her overall development.

Katia has very good personal and work references. Her business demonstrates profitability.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for food, and dishes.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a resident and farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He has been in the farming business for the last 10 years producing and selling pineapples, tea and milk. He employs one farmhand. He is married with 5 children, two of whom are still in school.

Henry has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter (machine to cut corn or hay into small pieces) for his dairy farm. He says it will help him in providing better feed for the animals and improve their output which will go a long way in improving his family living standards. He is also focusing on building a dairy unit for his cows.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's interventions on behalf of farmers financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Tugirubukire A / Rbv Group

texts.fr:
Jean Pierre  est agriculteur de pomme de terre et il est membre du groupe Tugirubukire A. Il est né au Rwanda et a 31 ans. Il est marié et il a 2 enfants de 3 à 8 ans, dont aucun enfant  scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire(A2). 
C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter un champ, 500kgs des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre. 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d‘améliorer son activité actuelle d’agriculture de pommes de terre en achetant d’autre champs. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Pierre  voudrait être un grand distributeur  de pommes de terre dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et des frais médicaux, et bâtir une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre is a potato farmer, and he is a member of the group Tugirubukire A. He was born in Rwanda and is 31 years old. He is married and has two children, aged 3 to 8 years. None of the children is in school. He has six years of secondary education (A2). 

This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use it to buy a field and 500 kg of fertilizer and to pay for labor. 

His strategy for the growth of his business is to improve his current business farming potatoes by buying another field. In the next few years, Jean Pierre would like to be a big distributor of potatoes in his region. With the profits, he foresees covering his children's schooling and medical costs and building a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy a field and 500 kg of fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is married. Her husband is a motor mechanic and known as an expert in his field of work. People trust his repair services and come from different areas to get their motorcycle repaired. Jameela is the mother of five children. Her two elder children are in college and the others are studying in a local school. Jameela is very supportive and sews clothes for her neighborhood clients to afford the education expenses of her children. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is creating problems and doesn’t produce quality work. She is confident that after buying a new sewing machine, she will be able to complete her clients' orders on time and earn more profit.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Jameela.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: General Diaz Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre General Díaz se conformó con mucho esfuerzo de las miembros. Ellas se encuentran en el primer ciclo, todas trabajan en forma conjunta, solidaria y siempre dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y desarrollo. Se encuentran muy felices dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta para llegar a los objetivos que es el de trabajar para apoyar económicamente a sus familias.
Una de las miembros es la Señora Patricia, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, nos comenta que mediante su trabajo puede mejorar bastante su nivel de vida e ingresos económicos. Además de eso dice que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que actualmente pose además del ingreso de su marido que es empleado en un negocio, con el ingreso de su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que elabora, como ser carne, pollo, verduras y otros. Agradece el apoyo de la Fundación, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The General Diaz Women's Committee was established through much effort by its members. They are in their first loan cycle. They all work together in a mutually supportive way, always in an atmosphere of cooperation and development. They are very happy in the program. In addition to each one's independent work, they also come up with joint business activities in order to arrive at their goal of working to support their families financially. 

One of the members is Ms. Patricia, who devotes herself to selling prepared meals. She comments that she is able through her to work to improve her living standard considerably as well as her income. In addition she says that with this business her family's finances improved considerably, since currently they possess not only the income of her husband who is an employee of a business, but also the income from her business. 

She is seeking the loan for the purchase of the ingredients necessary for making the foods she prepares, such as meat, chicken, vegetables and other items. She appreciates the support of the Foundation as, having obtained the loan, it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina’s husband is involved in a livestock business. He has some buffaloes at his home that he uses for getting milk that he sells to his community clients for profits.
 
Zarina is very active lady. She not only performs her household duties but also provides full support to her husband in his business. She is the mother of three children. Two of them are studying by attending a local school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him increase the production of milk and also his profits.
 
He has been operating his business for the past eight years and Zarina is hopeful that an investment will help him increase his profits and his business assets.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La señora Justina es agricultora y también teje frazada y aguayos (son tejidos hechos de hilo y sirven para envolver, cargar, etc.), con estas actividades cubre los gastos. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba para mejorar sus cultivos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia Aroma; es casada y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que la cliente obtiene un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Justina is a farmer who also weaves blankets and “aguayos” (woven cloths that are used for wrapping and carrying items). These activities enable her to cover her expenses. The money from this loan will be used to cover the cost of a water pump so that she can improve her crops. Justina lives in her own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. She is married and has no children.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for improving her crops.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 30 years old. He is married and a father of three children. Edward is a dairy farmer; the business has been in operation for the last five years. This marks his third loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to purchase more cows for his business. The profits generated from the business will be directed towards the repayment of the loan and the gradual expansion of his business. Edward’s dream is to become a milk supplier in his region.

loans.use: purchase more cows

loans.name: Decision De Paulette Group

texts.fr:
Guerlyne  est le coordonnatrice de son groupe Decision

Elle n’est pas marié il a 5 enfants.

Guerlyne habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Elle a dirigé son business pendant les 16 dernières années.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du charbon.

Guerlyne espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de DECISION ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Guerlyne dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Guerlyne is the coordinator for the Decision group. She is not married but has five children. She lives in the town of Trou in the north of Haiti where electricity is rare and water very limited. She has been running her business for the past 16 years. 

She would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of charcoal. She is hoping that the loan will help her to expand her business.

The other members of the Decision group need a loan for businesses such as the sale of charcoal, rice and fish. 

Guerlyne says that her principal objective is to increase her business. Her dream is to buy a motorbike to transport her materials.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Benji

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Benji; el socio tiene 18 años de edad, el socio es soltero, el socio tiene un negocio de venta de ropa,el vende pantalones,polos,blusas y casacas,el vende en forma independiente entregando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al publico en general,el socio tambien sigue estudiando ingles,por medico de este negcoio el socio quiere salir adelante . El socio desea el crédito para comprar pantalones,polos y casacas al por mayor.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Benji is 18 years old and single.  He has a business selling clothes.  He sells pants (trousers), tops, blouses and jackets.  He makes his sales independently, delivering to different places such as institutions and the general public.  He also continues studying English.  Through this business, he would like to get ahead in life.  Benji would like this loan to buy pants, tops and jackets wholesale.  

Benji is grateful for the support that he is being given and pledges to make his repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops and jackets wholesale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 30 años, es un hombre ejemplar. Vive en compañía de Maribel, su esposa desde hace 4 años. Ambos tienen una hija, Yerali, a la que quieren con mucho amor y cariño en una casa alquilada en el caserío de Acolla. Para el bienestar de su familia, comenzó a trabajar en la ciudad de Huancavelica, donde es docente de educación secundaria, ahí obtiene un salario mensual de parte del estado peruano. Cada 15 días visita su casa, para cuidar de su esposa e hija, también para ver sus cultivos de papa y habas que siembra en terrenos alquilados y propios pero en menor cantidad. Además cuenta con animales como vacas de raza y varias ovejas; que enseba para luego venderlos a un mayor precio en la feria de la ciudad de Jauja que se realiza una vez por semana. Ahora planean ahorrar más dinero, pues quieren comprarse una casa propia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “mujeres luchadora” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo integran personas responsables y solidarias.
Pedro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de animales, entre ellos ovejas de raza “Junín”, para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 30, is a desirable model of a man. He lives with his wife Maribel, to whom he has been married for 4 years. They have a daughter called Yerali. They both love her deeply and care for her in a rented house in Acolla village. With his family welfare in mind, he took a job in Huancavelica City as a high school teacher. He receives a monthly wage from the Peruvian public sector. 
Every two weeks Pedro visits his house to take care of his wife and daughter, as well of his potato and fava bean plantations, which he has at rented plots, and also in some smaller plots of his own. Moreover, he has some animals such as cows and sheep, which he raises and then sales at a higher price at the Jauja city’s fair, organized once a week. He and his wife now plan to save more money because they want to buy a house. 
Pedro belongs to “Mujeres luchadoras” Community Bank and this is his third loan with our institution. He counts on your support to achieve his goals. Also, he promises to pay back on time because his community bank is made up of responsible and supportive members.
If Pedro gets this loan, he will invest in the purchase of livestock such as Junin sheep, which will help him stock his business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua is 55 years old, married and is a mother of six.  She runs a green grocery to earn a living.  She has been in this business for over twenty years.  She also has rental houses which earn her extra income.  

Wayua has been able to boost her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. Her desire is to open other outlets for her business in five years.

Wayua has requested a loan for 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cereals, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and oranges.

loans.use: buy cereals, onions, potatoes, tomatoes and oranges

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es: Rosa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en ropa nueva, pues este mes y el próximo son para ella los mejores meses en venta, por eso comprará pantalones, camisas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, pues considera que al tener el negocio surtido de nuevas prendas con estilos diferentes, sus ventas mejorarán al igual que sus ganancias. Ella está contenta con este servicio de crédito pues es accesible y le permite como comerciante mejora el negocio
texts.en: Rosa is applying for a new loan in order to invest it in new clothing since this month and the next are, for her, the best months for sales.  That’s why she will buy men’s and women’s  trousers, shirts, and underwear.   She believes that once the business is stocked with clothing of different styles her sales and her earnings will improve.  She is happy with this loan service since it permits her, as a businesswoman, to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's trousers, shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Gloria Rosmira

texts.es: La señora Gloria trabajó por varios años en una empresa, la cual hace poco fue liquidada y con este acontecimiento la señora Gloria quedo sin empleo, por esta razón, tomo clases de encuadernación y gracias a su hermana quien le consiguió clientes pudo iniciar su actividad desde su casa de encuadernación de libros, trabajos escritos y fotocopias. Con esta labor, puede generar los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de ella y sus dos hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad, con el ánimo de cumplir varios pedidos que tiene, la señora Gloria necesita de la compra de materia prima tal como argollado, pastas de protección para libros y moldes y una estantería para acomodar su trabajo. El sueño de la señora Gloria es tener su propio local y brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria worked for many years at a business, which closed not long ago. She has been unemployed since. She took bookbinding classes and started a business from home, offering book and manuscript binding and photocopying services. Her sister helps her get new customers. The income from this business is enough to support Gloria and her two children, ages 17 and 14. 

In order to complete several orders, Gloria needs supplies such as spiral binding, laminated covers and a bookshelf to organize her work. Gloria's dream is to have a separate store location for her business and to be able to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy bookbinding supplies and a bookshelf.

loans.name: Mary Eva

texts.en:
Mary Eva is a single parent. She lives at Nkrontrodo, near Elmina, with her 3 children. Mary sells ladies' dresses, chemicals for agriculture, and credit transfers for mobile phone.

As a single parent, Mary Eva uses her income for the general upkeep of her children. Mary will use her loan to purchase more ladies' dresses, chemicals, and unite transfers for sale. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ladie's dresses, chemicals for agriculture, and mobile phone credit transfers for sale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has 2 children, ranging in age from 5 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be kind, honest and God-fearing. She operates a school where she provides education. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a highly populated area and her primary customers are the resident's children. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of ingredients of food used to cook food for the children. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to construct more classes. Her business goal is to run a primary school with over eight hundred children within 5 years.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of the classes.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomè avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Agée de 44 ans, Essi est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route. Pour financer son achat, Essi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de gingembres en vue de mieux revendre puis de réaliser plus de bénéfice et pouvoir aider sa famille à subvenir à certains besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve.

loans.use: Acheter 05 sacs de gingembres.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Bekie is 27 years old and a mother of two. She sells her goods in front of the family house. Some of the items include canned foods, biscuits, confectionary and some stationary. This happens to be a family business and she is running it now. She took part in the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN in September, 2006. She needs the KIVA loan to be able to grow the business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purity would like to buy a water pump and vegetable seedlings, pesticides for effective farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add four bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Adolphus

texts.en: Mr. Adolphus I. is 46 years old and married with five (5) children. He is a farmer and has been in this business since 2003.  He needs the loan to expand his poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy more poultry for his farming business

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is asking for her third loan. She has sold gasoline and ice cream in the past, but now wants to invest in a small colmadito next year ( a colmadito is a local grocery store). She says it is very hard to make a good living in her community from gasoline or ice cream; there are very few people who have enough money to own a personal moto, and no buses ever pass through her community. Additionally, it is expensive to keep a freezer, and often costs more than her sales from ice cream can cover. Nevertheless, she has always managed her money carefully and made all of her payments on time. She supports six people in her house, including herself.

NOTE: This is a group loan. Lidia and her business represent the four other members of her group, who each will receive a share of this $750 loan to fund their respective businesses. As members of a solidarity group, Lidia and the other four micro-entrepreneurs have gone through Esperanza´s business training courses and have proven to be committed to their businesses to provide for their families. If a member of the group is unable to make a payment, the other members are responsible for making up the difference and helping the person to improve. This group-lending method creates a social support network within the community as well as an accountability system to ensure that not only are loans paid back on time, but that the loan capital is invested in developing their business and providing for the basic necessities of their families.

Lidia is very involved in her neighborhood and believes that the loans have helped her not only improve the livelihood of her family, but have also allowed her a little extra free time to integrate more with her community so that she can give back to those who need her help. Lidia is very grateful for the opportunities she has been given, is proud of what she has accomplished, and is very optimistic that she can continue improving her future with the help from the micro-loans she receives.

loans.use: Purchase gasoline, ice cream, and supplies to start a grocery store

loans.name: Gracinda João

texts.pt:
Gracinda João Z. is 36 years old, lives with her husband and is the mother of 3 children. She lives in the Laulane district in Maputo. She has a stand at her home where she sells a range of food products. She entered the program in May of 2007 with a loan of 6000 meticais. She will be in her 2nd loan cycle and will borrow the same amount to pay in 5 months. It would be premature to evaluate the nature and growth of the business with the time that she has been in the program.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Gracinda João Z. tem 36 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 3 filhos. Vive no bairro Laulane em Maputo. Tem uma barraca em sua casa onde vende diversos produtos de mercearia.Entrou para o programa em Maio de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai tomar om mesmo valor para pagar em 5 meses.É ainda prematuro avaliar o carácter e crescimento do negócio pelo tempo que está no programa.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí belongs to the Atenas Portillanas Communal Bank. She lives on 239 Jr. Antunez de Manolo Street in the Yarina Cocha district in Ucayali. She is 40-years-old and is the mother of 2 children who still depend on her. She is married, and her husband works at a wood company. His income isn't enough to cover their home's expenses, so that's why Noemí, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles, decided to invest in selling the typical food of Bolivia.

Currently, Noemí and her kids do their chores at home, although they still keep up with their school work. Then Naomí goes to the market to make her purchases and prepares her dishes. With this loan of 1,800 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a sack of rice, 10 liters of oil, a half a sack of noodles, two boxes of soft drinks, and will put 50 nuevos soles towards making ice and popsicles. Noemí is a devoted mother, and it's because of her children that through the support offered to her by Manuela Ramos, she will give her children a better life because they are her reason for living.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Noemí pertenece al Banco Comunal Atenas Portillanas, vive en el Jr. Antunez de Manolo 239 del distrito Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo es empleado de una empresa de madera, pero el ingreso que tienen no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Noemí, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la venta de comidas típicas.

Actualmente Noemí, conjuntamente con sus hijos, hacen las labores de la casa, pero sin descuidar la escuela. Luego se dirige al mercado para hacer sus compras y después se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas. Con el préstamo de S/. 1.800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un saco de arroz, diez litros de aceite, medio saco de fideos, dos cajas de gaseosas y destinará S/. 50 en la preparación de hielo y chupetes. Noemí, es una madre que se desvive por sus hijos, es por ellos que a través del apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos sale adelante con sus hijas que son su razón de ser.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, and soft drinks

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 27 years old and married with two children.  He repairs motorbikes in Dogolaia village, in Kabala town.  With the savings from the income, he received a loan from SMT and purchased a motorbike that provides transport services in the village. With the profit from the first motorbike and another loan from SMT, Ibrahim purchased another motorbike.  The bikes provide transport to and from Kabala town and other surrounding villages.  Ibrahim's enterprise has solved transportation problems in the community.  In order to continue serving the community, Ibrahim's requesting another loan to purchase another motorbike.

loans.use: Ibrahim has used creativity and innovation to create a business that serves the transportation needs of his community.  He seeks a loan to help him build that great idea into a sustainable business.

loans.name: Daim

texts.en:
Mrs. Daim S. L., 58, is married with 2 children. She is a vendor of grocery products and earns around $2.50 in profit a day. Her husband Mr. Wa Neang, 56, works as a farmer and makes on average about $1 in profit a day . They have two daughters both of whom work in Phnom Penh City.

It seems not enough for daily expenses with their present income, so they need some capital to expand their business. They want to use the money to buy more grocery products to sell to get more profit. To purchase more products, they are requesting a loan from KIVA of $700.

loans.use: Purchase more grocery products for re-sale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Two years ago, Tatyana, who is widowed, decided to start her own sales business to support her daughter and herself. She chose to sell items that she thought would be in good demand. Today her business is profitable and doing well. Tatyana sells a variety of household linens such as dish towels, bath towels, and bedding supplies. She has a sales kiosk at the “Kolos” market in the central Ukrainian city of Nikolaev. Tatyana is a wonderful business woman. She is honest, responsible, and kind, and she works hard to support herself and her daughter.

Tatyana has requested a loan to add to her working capital and help purchase some additional inventory to sell in her kiosk. With the warm springtime weather coming, many shoppers will be out looking to buy. This loan will help Tatyana obtain necessary inventory to meet customer demand and make a good profit.

loans.use: Increase working capital and purchase inventory

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina K. is a trader who sells sewing items. She is married and has three children. Business is booming and she wants to increase her stock to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Aadditional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Gladys Bakitte `s Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a leader of a group of 4 members, and the first from the left in the photo. She is a 58-year-old widow with 5 children. They are aged 38, 25, 29, 22 and 20 years. Two of them are in school. She is also looking after 10 grandchildren, some of whom are orphans. They range between the ages of 8 and 16 years. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She hires redundant chunks of land and employs young men to make bricks, which she later sells. She also employs someone who is in charge of buying bales of clothes. She later sells these clothes in the mobile markets in different locations on different days.

Some of her challenges include the high transport costs and rising prices of the bales, and having to look for a market away from home in order to sell her goods. There is an available market for the bricks because many people are putting up buildings in the surrounding areas.

Her achievements include managing and looking after her family single handedly, and she has acquired piped water. She plans to put up rooms for renting out on the redundant piece of her land. Gladys has successfully paid back more than 4 loans.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Sammuel

texts.en: Sammuel O. lives in Elmina, where he works as a television and radio repairman. Demand for his services is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji, the wife of I. A., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan where she owns a three-room brick house. She is the mother of four daughters, all enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Yasmeen baji is a seamstress who has successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a new one to buy a sewing machine to stitch more clothes.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Rashida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo; Allah Rakhi baji wants to expand her milk business; Safia baji wishes to expand her food business; Razia baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes D. sells foodstuffs such as plantains and tomatoes at the market. She is a single parent and her income is not sufficient for Agnes and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 24 years old and single, lives in a village in the Northern Bekaa. Ali owns a grocery shop where he also sells vegetables and fruit. Ali's enthusiasm and willpower have helped his business grow from day to day. Presently, he needs the amount of USD 1,200 to purchase goods and diversify his merchandise in order to make his business more solid and to expand it. This is the first time that Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Diversify the grocery store merchandise

loans.name: Asad

texts.en:
Asad A. is 68 years old, and a very hard working, enthusiastic man who is married and wishes to give the best support to his 3 sons. Because the small pension he received was not sufficient to cover the family's basic expenses, he decided to start his own business selling office supplies, beverages, snacks and candies. He made a wise decision when he rented a place near one of the local schools and now the majority of his clients are school children, teachers and sometimes parents. 
 
Asad tries to give his family as much money as possible in order to cover the expenses of schooling his grandchildren. His sons are married but it is still very hard to cover family needs and Asad`s business is an additional source of income.  

Today Asad wants to expand his business and to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of US$1200. He hopes you will choose to play an important role in his business' growth and in the life of his family, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es:
Doña Abelina tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, madre de 3 hijos que tienen familia, estudió el sexto grado de primaria y vive en el Jr. Loyola 417, distrito de J., provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de J.. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital para comprar material (bayeta y lana) para el negocio de bordadura. A los 30 años de edad empezó tejiendo para la artesanía “trenza de oro”, lugar donde trabajaba y exportaba al extranjero. No estudió porque sus padres la dejaron con una señora que la crió desde niña. Cuando se retiró de la artesanía inicio su propio negocio de confección de bordados de bayeta como cojines, manteles de mesa, cuadros, etc.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 100 metros de bayeta a  S/. 500 y 15 kg. de lana a S/. 525.00.

Su mayor deseo es seguir con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Abelina is 55 years old, married, mother of 3 children who have their own families. She completed 6th grade of primary schools and lives at Jr. Loyola 417, J. district, Chucuito province in the state of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank “Niño San Salvador” in J.. In the beginning, with a loan for S/.300, she increased her capital to buy material (cloth and wool) for her embroidery business. At 30 years old she began sewing for the artisan store “trenza de oro” (Braid of Gold), where she used to work and export to other countries. She didn’t study because her parents left her with a woman who raised her since she was a little girl. When she retired from the artisan store she began her own business making embroidered items such as pillows, table cloths, wall weavings, etc. With this loan for S/.1,700, which will be repais in 4 payments, she will buy 100 meters of cloth at S/.500 and 15 kilograms of wool at S/.525.00 Her greatest wish is to continue her business and improve the quality of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth and wool

loans.name: Grover Gerardo

texts.es: El Señor Grover A., se dedica a la fabricación de artesanías hechas de cola de rata en la populosa feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, Bolivia, artesanías que vende  de manera ambulante por toda la feria, los días jueves y domingo. Paralelamente el señor trabaja como bartender en un conocido café de la ciudad de La Paz. El préstamo será destinado para la adquisicion de una cafeteria y confiteria en la zona de ciudad de El Alto. El señor es soltero y trabaja arduamente con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida. Aspira a tener su cafetería propia. Es una persona muy responsable, y tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus padres y de quienes lo conocen.
texts.en:
Mr. Grover A. makes crafts made of ribbon at the popular 16th of July fair in the city of El Alto, Bolivia, crafts that he sells across the fair on Thursdays and Sundays. In addition, he works as a bartender in a known coffee place of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to acquire a cafeteria and confectionery in the city of El Alto. He is single and works hard with the purpose of improving his quality of life. He hopes to have his own cafeteria. He is a very responsible person, has good references from his parents and those who know him.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire a cafeteria

loans.name: Angele

texts.fr: Angele est une femme agée d'une trentaine d 'année  .Elle gere une épicerie qu' elle a mis en place a partir de fonds propres . Elle a soucrit à la caisse depuis trois (3).Pour renforcer son activité elle sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
Angele is approximately 30 years old. She runs a grocery store, a business she started out of her own money. She's been a member of UIMCEC for 3 years. She's seeking this loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her grocery store business

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru: азизова Сафармо жительница города яван . Проживает вместе со своим мужем и его родителями . Имеет одного ребенка. Занимается торговлей молока . Она имеет Двух коов , которые дают молоко . Получаемую продукцию она сдает оптом  на рынке. Кредит планирует использовать для того . чтобы закупить сено и другие виды корма . Это даст возможность получать качественное молоко и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safarmo A. lives in Yavan town. She has one child and lives with her husband and parents-in-law. Safarmo sells milk from her two dairy cows. She sells the milk wholesale at the local market. Safarmo would use the loan for the purchase of hay and other types of fodder. This would help improve the quality of the milk and attract more customers. Safarmo would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase hay

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a young mother to three children: Jocel, 5 years old; Mark Jay, 3 years old; and Joy, 1 year old. Their family is living in the village of Antagan, 1st Tumauini, Isabela. Maricel is married to Joel, a farmer. Their place is quite developed and there is sufficient supply of water for their rice fields coming from the Pinacanauan River.

Maricel is a vegetable vendor. She used to roam around the village selling her products, but her income is not enough to support the needs of their family. Because of this, she would like to borrow a loan of 5,000 pesos to expand her vending business. She is hoping that lenders will grant her request, for this will be of great help not only for her business but also to her family.

Maricel believes that hard work and endurance are the formulas in reaching for success. She also dreams to send all her children to school someday.

loans.use: Expand her vegetable sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renew the license of motorcycle with sidecar and buy some materials for its repair

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba B. is currently selling goods at her shop, and is requesting a loan to build another shop for selling goods. Araba is 25 years old and her husband is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profit she can earn from selling more goods in an additional shop, she hopes to be able to buy land and build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build another shop for selling goods

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo D. is a 35-year-old mother of five. Her husband Bartolome is a government contractual employee. Their income is not enough to support the needs of the family, especially the education of her three college students and two secondary students. 

She applied for this loan to buy assorted foods for her variety store. She hopes that through her loans in ASHI (Ahon  Sa Hirap, Inc.) she will be able to finance the education of her children to land a good job. She dreams of expanding her grocery store, more complete and accessible to her customers.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for variety store.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor Marcelo R. vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposa y sus dos hijas.
Como desea tener su propia casa está tramitando una vivienda por medio de Infonavit (crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la casa es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo. 
 El trabaja como guardia de seguridad, portal motivo solicita un préstamo para completar el crédito gubernamental, y así adquirir su casa. Desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcelo Rodriguez lives with his wife and two daughters in a house that someone lent him. He wishes to have his own home, so he is processing a house through Infonavit (a government loan). He could not afford the house with the loan that his income allows him to obtain.

He works as a security guard. He is requesting a loan to supplement the government loan and obtain his house. He wishes to secure some assets for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Difference for housing through Infonavit (Government loan)

loans.name: Tursunjon

texts.ru: Ширинбекова Турсунжон- женшина 39 лет. Замужем мать 2-х детей. Турсунжон занимается купли продажей скота. Имеет большой работы в сфере купли продажи скота.  Турсунжон третьей раз получает кредит у нас и ей очень нравятся наши условия. Муж Турсунжона находится в Российской Федерации на заработках и высылает своей семье деньги. У Турсунжона есть дойная корова, который приносит хороший прибыл семейному бюджету. Сын Турсунжона в этом году заканчивает школу Турсунжон   хочет чтобы его сын поступил в ВУЗ.
texts.en:
Tursunjon S. is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. She is involved in livestock sales. She has a lot of experience in the field of livestock sales. This is Tursunjon’s third loan, and she likes our lending terms. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and sends money to his family. Tursunjon owns a dairy cow that brings a good income to the family budget. Tursunjon’s son is graduating from school this year, and she wants him to get accepted to a university.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Floriselda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Floriselda F. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de cosméticos y venta de bebidas ofrecidas en su localidad.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada por un crédito que solicitó y espera que dicho crédito sea aprobado para así dar lugar al mejoramiento de su negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Floriselda F. makes a living selling cosmetics and beverages in her neighborhood in the city of Chinandega. She has now approached Kiva partner Ceprodel for a loan, and is waiting for this loan to be approved so that she can make improvements to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and beverages

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian D. is married and has 15 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Vivian sells smoked fish in Torkor near Kpando, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a fisherman who earns little for an income. Vivian uses all her income in looking after the large family. Vivian will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vivian plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.en:
R. Makhfirat is a girl that enjoys her work. She is in the animal breeding business. Thanks to this business, she can cover her family’s expenses and help her parents with household expenses. Makhfirat wishes to increase the number of animals she has in order to improve breeding. She needs 3000 Somoni, which she guarantees will be properly invested. She is hoping for your support. Helping this girl to achieve prosperity is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Loubelle

texts.en:
Loubelle A. is 26 years old and the mother of one child. She makes her living from the farm that she and her husband have tilled since they were married. They grow rice and from it they are able to earn income to provide for the family's growing needs.

The purpose for her loan of Php 13,000 is to buy fertilizers, chmicals and rice seeds. She and her husband have been working all day long on their farm to ensure that they can have an abundant harvest.

Actively participating in the CEVI program, she receives many benefits, such as loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, chemicals and rice seeds

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana B. is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Flaviana is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Flaviana owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap,  toothpaste etc., in the local community. Flaviana has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Flaviana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flaviana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Flaviana is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Flaviana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cedron Group

texts.es: El grupo CEDRON esta integrado por 3 personas que son familiares pero que viven en distintas zonas, la señora Emiliana es la cliente mas antigua, trabajaba con credito individual desD. el año 2006, ahora paso a integrar el grupo con sus hijas Reyna y Juana T. quienes eran integrantes del grupo el año 2008. Estas señoras viven en Coqueni y doña Emiliana en la Comunidad Uni (poblado muy alejado). Siempre trabajaron bien , sus pagos los realizaron en forma puntual.
texts.en:
The CEDRON group is maD. up of 3 people who are family members but live in different areas. Ms. Emiliana is the longest standing client and has worked with individual credit since 2006. She has gone on to form the group with her daughters Reyna and Juana T. who have been part of the group since 2008. These ladies live in Coqueni and Ms. Emiliana lives in the Uni Community (a very distant settlement). They have always worked well, and their payments were maD. in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising capital

loans.name: Anzetse

texts.en:
Anzetse is 56 years old,married and is blessed with four children.

His business is located in west market and he serves residents who live within west market.

Anzetse was introduced to KADET by another client.With the loan he is taking from KADET,he intends to buy more stock for his business which includes ingredients for juice preparation also and food stuff.In future he will like to diversify his products to include cereal and also educate his children.

”About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke “

loans.use: To add more stock which includes ingredients for drinks(juice )preparation.

loans.name: Jackqueline

texts.es:
Jackqueline tienen 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de granos como el maíz, la cebada, la arveja, las habas y la quinua, productos que ella misma cultiva en sus tierras. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace más de 3 años, por lo que todos los miércoles y los fines de semana comercializa sus granos al por mayor y menor. Por tal motivo, siempre está pendiente de los precios del mercado porque de eso dependen sus ganancias. De esta manera, Jackqueline ve los frutos de su trabajo y junto a su esposo, generan el desarrollo de su familia. Su deseo a futuro es poder producir los granos en gran escala y convertirse en una exitosa comerciante.
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy entusiasmada con el trabajo que realizará con su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar los granos que regularmente cultiva.
texts.en:
Jackqueline is 36 and lives with her husband and two children, who are 6 and 2. She sells grains such as corn, barley, peas, beans, and quinoa. She grows these products herself on her land. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Every Wednesday and on the weekends, she sells her grains both wholesale and retail. Because of this, she is always dependent on the market prices because her profits depend on them. In this way, Jackqueline sees the fruits of her labor, and, along with her husband, they generate the development of their family. Her hope for the future is to be able to produce grains on a large scale and to become a successful merchant. This is her first credit with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very enthusiastic about the work she will do with her communal bank. She will invest the money that she is requesting in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer to use on the grains that she usually grows.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana Patricia O. S. de 35 años tiene cuatro años de dedicarse al comerció de cerdo. Esta es una actividad común en la familia nicaragüense y una alternativa económica para ayudar a generar ingresos a la familia.

Ella cría, destaza y produce alimentos del cerdo como es el nacatamal, el frito, la moronga y el chicharro entre otros. Tiene dos años de trabajar con Adim en los cuales ha sentido que le ayudado mucho a solucionar su economía y a manejar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia O. S., who is 35 years old, has been raising and selling pigs for 4 years. This is a common activity for Nicaraguan families, and is an economic alternative that helps earn money for her family.

She raises and butchers pigs, and makes food like Nicaraguan tamales, fried pork, blood sausage, and pork rinds. She has been working with ADIM for two years, and she feels that they have helped her take care of her finances and manage her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married and is 34 years old. She sells planks at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo State, and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to be a distributor of planks in the future.

Victoria is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La señora ZOLIA ROSA C. L., tiene  59 años, vive en el distrito de la BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II.  Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores .
Zoila se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y este su primer crédito, ella requiere 300.00 nuevos soles y lo utilizará para comprar cosméticos como: cremas, labiales, talcos, rubores, delineadores, etc. en precio de oferta para así poder estar abastecida para las fiestas navideñas y obtener mayores ganancias. Ella sueña con alquilar un puesto en el mercado que esta cerca de su casa para poder vender ahí los productos con mayor frecuencia y facilidad.
texts.en:
Zolia Rosa Casteñada Ludeña is 59 years old. She lives in the Buenos Aires district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras II Communal Bank. She went to high school until the fifth year. She is married and has three adult children. Zoila sells cosmetics. This is her first loan. She needs 300 PEN to buy cosmetics like creams, lipsticks, powder, blush, and eye liners, etc. at the special price. That way she will be able to be stocked for the Christmas festivities and get greater earnings. Her dream is to rent a place in the market, which is close to her house. Then she would be able to sell her products there more frequently, and it will be easier.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics like creams, lipstick, powder, perfume, and cologne, etc.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael N. is a hard-working businesswoman. She is 36 years old and married. She has three children and looks after three dependents. 

Rachael has been running a retail shop for two years. She is using the loan to purchase more goods, such as sodas, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, soap, and sugar, her retail shop. Her business dream is to have all kinds of items as to meet customers’ demands. And more so, her personal dream is to bring up her children well and be able to educate them.

loans.use: To buy sodas, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, soap, and sugar for her store

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
La socia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. El nombre del banco es de origen de la lengua Quechua que traducido al español significa “Cerro de Oro”. Cusco antiguamente, fue la capital del Imperio Inca y una de las ciudades más importantes del Virreinato del Perú. Declarada Patrimonio de la Humanidad y capital arqueológica de América. 

Nuestra socia VANESA tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene una hija que se llama Camila que tiene un año. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su tienda de multiservicios que es librería, bazar, cabina de Internet y venta de productos de belleza. Ya son seis años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. Ella es la fiscal del banco comunal y hace ocho años es socia de Arariwa. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar regalos para vender en estas fiesta navideñas.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra ubicada a 45 km del Cusco siguiendo la carretera asfaltada a Puno, es un pequeño poblado con una hermosa laguna donde, según la leyenda, Huascar lanzó una enorme cadena de oro para evitar que los españoles se la llevaran.
texts.en:
Vanesa was born in Urcos, province of Quispicanchis, district of Cusco and she’s a member of the Community Bank “Qori Orcco” part of the Arariwa Association. The name of the bank is in the Quechua language and it means “Golden Hills”. Cusco was the capital city of the Inca Empire and one of the most important cities of the Peruvian Viceroyalty. It has been declared Patrimony of Humanity and the Archaeological Capital of the Americas. Vanesa is 26 years old. She’s married and has a 1-year-old daughter named Camila. She divides her time between her household activities and her minimarket where she has a stationary stand, a grocery shop, an Internet café and beauty items stand. She opened her business 6 years ago, and she’s been very successful thanks to her had work. She’s a working mother and an entrepreneur supporting her family. She’s the community bank's supervisor and she's been a member of Arariwa for eight years. She would like to use this loan to buy Christmas presents to resell during the holiday season. She’s very thankful for this opportunity and she promises to fulfill her payments according to schedule. The city of Urcos is located at 45 km (28 miles) from Cusco, following the asphalted road to Puno. It’s a small town with a beautiful lagoon, where, according to the legend Huascar threw a huge golden chain to prevent the Spanish settlers to take it away.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Christmas presents to resell during the holiday season

loans.name: Leonor Gioconda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Leonor, pertenecen al banco comunal “KUKILI”, el socio es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Nuestra socia tiene 34 años de edad es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 11, 5 años de edad, nuestra socia tiene 10 años trabajando con la asociación Arariwa en bancos comunales, ella es socia antigua, comenzó desde muy jovencita a trabajar con préstamo de este tipo y gracias a esto ella pudo independizarse y poner su propio mini taller de artesanía, ella elabora sus propios diseños en arcilla y los vende en la feria artesanal de san Andrés  ubicado a una cuadra de la plaza principal del Cusco, desde 1998.

Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus propios diseños.

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Our member Leonor belongs to the communal bank 'Kukili' and is from the city of Cusco. Our member is 34 years old, is married, and has 3 children - 13, 11 and 5 years old. For 10 years our member has been working with the Arariwa association in communal banks. She is an old member, and from a very young age began working with this type of loan. Thanks to this she was able to become independent and install her own artesanal mini-stand in 1998. She makes her own designs in clay and sells them in the artesanal market in San Andrés, located one block from the principal plaza in Cusco. Our member is seeking a loan to be able to purchase primary materials to make her own designs. Our member is very thankful and expresses her satisfaction with being able to continue to grow her own business. She promises to meet the total payment for her debt in the determined period.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase primary materials and merchandise for sale of artesanal goods

loans.name: Junie

texts.en:
Junie C. is from the village of Naawan Misamis Oriental. He is 49 years old. Junie is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Junie owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling sack bags in the local community. Junie has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Junie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Junie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esfuerzo Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Almendrita está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican a la comercialización de frutas y verduras. Ellas son de la comarca las Flores una zona rural de Masaya pero su centro de trabajo es en el mercado Mayoreo en Managua.

Maira del Socorro E. R. desde hace siete años inicio con la venta de frutas y verduras con la cual impulso a sus cinco hijos. Ella junto a su compañero de vida trabajan arduamente en dicho negocio actualmente desea invertir en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo y jocote que es la fruta que está en flota.

Patricia Centeno hace aproximadamente diez años inicio con el pequeño puesto de verduras el cual ha ido aumentado  y la señora Ángela del Socorro Hernández de 60 años la cual la mitad de su vida se ha dedicado a este comercio de compra de cosechas en Masaya la cual vende en Managua.
texts.en:
The group "El Amendrita" consists of three hard working women that dedicate themselves to the sale of fruits and vegetables. They are from the Las Flores region which is a rural zone of Masaya but their workplace is in the wholesale market in Managua. Maira del Socorro E. R. started her business of selling fruits and vegetables seven years ago with which she was able to raise her five children. Together with her life partner they work hard in their business. She currently wishes to invest in the purchase of tamarind and jocote (red mombin) harvests which are the fruits in season. Approximately ten years ago, Patricia Centeno started her small fruit stand which she has been expanding. Angela del Socorro is 60 years old and has spent half of her life dedicating herself to the business of purchasing harvests in Masaya which she sells in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and vegetable harvests that are in season.

loans.name: Taison Group

texts.en:
The Taison Group is made up of three entrepreneurs -- Cecilia S. Picado, Martha Ramona García, and Maribel del Rosario López. The coordinator of this group is Cecilia who has a small store stocked with basic products such as rice, black beans, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, onion, tomato, soap, matches, and more. She has two children, 15 and 23 years old.  

Martha sells soup, nacatamales (a traditional Nicaraguan dish), sausages, cold drinks, and more. Maribell started her business 25 years ago; she sells fruits, vegetables, and nacatamales on the street.

loans.use: to expand her inventory

loans.name: Mame Arame

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Arame S. habite à Bambilor. Elle est âgée de 35 ans et a adhéré à la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2009. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 7 et 10 ans. Elle évolue  dans le commerce et la vente de vêtements  qu’elle pratique  chez elle depuis 3 ans. Après l’immigration de son mari  en 2005 elle a préféré  choisir une activité génératrice  de revenu pour ne pas rester  inactive. Donc avec ses bénéfices elle parvient a satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour diversifier ses produits en achetant des appareils cellulaires de la Mauritanie et de l’arachide destines a la vente. Ainsi elle espère  accroitre ses profits  a travers cette nouvelle activité  qu’elle veut découvrir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Arame S. lives in Bambilor. She is 35 years old and has belonged to the U-IMCEC since December 2009. She is married and the mother of two children, ages seven and ten. She has been developing a business selling of clothes, which she has been doing from her home for three years. After her husband immigrated in 2005, she preferred to choose a money-making activity in order to stay active. Thus with her profits she is able to satisfy her personal needs. She is seeking a 300,000 frs loan in order to diversify her products by buying cellular phones from Mauritania and peanuts to sell. In this way she hopes to increase her profits through this new activity that she wants to try.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Unidos Por El Progreso 4 Group

texts.en:
