Vicente, 40, is a borrower who lives in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group, Unidos Por El Progreso (United for Progress), and his story is representative of those in his group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International, a Kiva partner.

Vicente lives with his wife and two children in a simple home in Hato Mayor, a small rural town in the agricultural east of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with) and inadequate access to health care, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Vicente runs a successful small business selling used clothing. With this loan, he will by “ropa de paca,” or packs of used clothing, which he will then organize and sell to those in his community.

This is Vicente’s second loan with Esperanza International. With continued profits, Vicente hopes to continue the growth of his business. He hopes that his additional income will continue helping him finish the construction of his house. A typical home is built in stages. As money becomes available, you add a room, a bathroom or other parts of the home. Vicente will build using cement blocks, a far superior material than traditional wood or sheet-metal siding. With your loan, Vicente will be well on his way to fulfilling this dream for his family’s home.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in 11 offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Vicente and the Unidos Por El Progreso group!

loans.use: Packs of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Kisiita Development Group Of Mubende

texts.en:
At the young age of 24 years, N. Moses is a fledgling produce sales business trend-setter whose example is bound to stand out as a benchmark for other youth in his home area of Kisiita in Mubende district. Many youths in his home area preoccupy themselves in self-destructive activities like drinking.

Moses has subsisted on a produce sales business for four years. With his hard work, he has managed to take firm root and, in a week, he apparently makes 50,000 shillings.

With his monthly savings, Moses has managed to diversify his small business. This has, however, not come easy as he has had to grapple with many adversities such as the unpredictable weather patterns which, for the most part, mean he has fewer supplies from farmers.

Moses’ dream is to build his own produce stalls and a store to keep his surplus goods. With this loan he hopes to implement this.

loans.use: To purchase more produce to sell

loans.name: Solinuu

texts.en:
Solinuu A. is 39 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, which is a hotel.  Solinuu has 1 year of experience in this business.  Solinuu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase new facilities in order for her to provide good services to tourists and other people.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 1000 talas or US $417 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Solinuu joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Solinuu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: purchase new facilities to facilitate her hotel business.

loans.name: Tacko Mbenda

texts.fr: Tacko Mbenda F. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est célibataire et mère d'une fille. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 28 mars 2008 et a reçu 04 fois de suite de crédit. Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels de l'oignon, des biscuits, du thé, du sucre, de la boisson en canette etc.. son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises. Son objectif est de d'assurer la prise en charge de sa fille, d'équiper sa maison et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Tacko Mbenda F., 46, is a single mother of one daughter. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (borrowing group) since March 28, 2008 and has received four consecutive loans. She has a shop where she sells various items such as onions, biscuits, tea, sugar, canned drinks, etc. Her new loan will allow her to bolster the inventory of her shop. Her goal is to support her daughter, outfit her house, and pay her personal expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little commercial enterprise

loans.name: Bwambara Women's Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
Very hardworking T. Jovia has been operating a produce sales business from Rushaya in Rukungiri for a period of thirteen years.

With nostalgia, this happily married mother of six children recalls how her business basked in high profits at its outset. Times have changed, however, as the business now is showing diminishing returns, earning her 120,000 Ugandan shillings monthly on average. This is in sharp contrast to the 250,000 shillings she says she was making at the start of her business.

There is always a story connected with people in western Uganda who, despite laboring under such tough times, find a way of educating their children. Jovia is no exceptional to this. What she is looking forward to now is the prospect of enhancing her business by buying more maize, beans, rice, millet, cassava, and other crops with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Maria Cleofe tiene 51 años, es natural de Ayacucho, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos de la cuales tres son independientes y uno todavía depende de ella. Su actividad económica principal de María Cleofe es vender comida en su propio restaurante que se llama “Tres Marias” que está ubicado en el barrio de Luis Vallejo Santoni del distrito de Santiago. (El distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco es uno de los sitios donde los pobladores son de bajos recursos pero se las ingenian para tener sus propios negocios). Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio. El trabajo comienza a las 5 de la mañana donde empieza a preparar la comida para las horas del desayuno, del almuerzo y de la cena. Termina su trabajo a las 9 de la noche todos los días. Ella actualmente tiene una cocinera y una empleada que le ayudan con el trabajo. Hay días en que la socia lleva comida a las obras de construcción. 

Maria Cleofe pertenece al banco comunal “Kantu” y requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. El sueño de la socia es abrir un restaurante cerca a la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Maria Cleofe is from Ayacucho. She is a 51 year old married woman with four children; three are living on their own and one is still dependent on her. Maria Cleofe’s main occupation is selling meals in her own restaurant which is called “Tres Marias”. It is located in the barrio of Luis Vallejo Santoni in the district of Santiago. (The district of Santiago in Cusco is one of the areas where the inhabitants manage to have their own businesses despite their low-income status). Maria Cleofe has been doing this type of work for 25 years. At 5:00 in the morning, she begins preparing the meals for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and finishes her work at 9:00 in the evening every day. Currently, she has a cook and an employee who help her with the work. Some days she delivers meals to construction sites. Maria Cleofe is a member of the “Kantu” communal bank and is requesting the loan to buy more supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. Her dream is to open a restaurant near the Plaza de Armas in Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Vitalia

texts.es: Vitalia,  de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos.Trabaja como enfermera durante 3 veces a la semana, y el resto de días se dedica a la venta de quesos y manjares. Como es oriunda de la sierra peruana, sus padres le proveen de estos comestibles y también de  alverjas y papas, de acuerdo a la temporada,  ella los comercializa  a sus vecinos y conocidos. Sus compradores frecuentes son las enfermeras y doctores del policlínico donde trabaja, y también algunas pacientes, quienes cada vez le hacen más pedidos,  jamás imaginó proveerse de su mercadería  cada 15 días, como lo realiza en la actualidad. Se siente muy feliz por el trabajo que desempeña; donde ya lleva 5 años. Para mas adelante tiene planeado cumplir con  su mayor anhelo, que es instalar una librería en su casa y también quiere construir su casa de material noble.Este es su doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy útil para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, además porque  no quiere perjudicar a sus compañeras de grupo, que la ayudaron en sus inicios.Vitalia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en el incremento de quesos, manjares y rosquitas al por mayor, para abastecerse bien y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Vitalia is a very hard-working 35 year old mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She works as a nurse 3 days a week, and works selling cheese and sweets the other days. As she is originally from the mountain range of Peru, her parents provide her with those food items, as well as peas and potatoes when they are in season. She sells them to her neighbors and acquaintances. Her customers are often the nurses and doctors at the clinic where she works, as well as some patients. Every time they request more products from her. She never imagined she would be able to provide for herself every 2 weeks selling these products as she does. She feels very happy with the work that she does, and she has been working there for 5 years. In the future she plans to fulfill her greatest desire--installing a bookstore in her house, and she also wants to build a house of sturdier material. This is her 12th loan with MFP and she knows that the loan will be very helpful in increasing her capital. She is committed to repaying the loan on time, especially because she does not want to cause harm to her group members who have helped her from the beginning. Vitalia plans to invest the loan money in buying cheese, sweets, and bread in bulk in order to stock her supplies and fill her customers' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for sale

loans.name: Levie

texts.en:
Levie E. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Levie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Levie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Levie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when he sells his raised pig.

In 2008, Levie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Levie is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Levie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Malama

texts.en:
Malama T. is 36 and married with five children (ages 1 - 16).  She owns a business planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Malama has two years of experience in this business.  Malama needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Malama joined SPBD.  This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Malama's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:
 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Ntirandekura

texts.en:
J. was born in 1978 and is single. J. lives with his parents and that means that he has to participate in supporting his family, providing for all the needs in his family. J. has been a businessman since 2004. J. owns a business selling phones in Kigali city. This business is profitable and organized but he is not able to satisfy his customers' needs.

J. is now requesting a Kiva loan for the purpose of expanding his business so that he can satisfy his customers which can help him to attract more of them. With this loan, J. will be able to sort out his problems through the profits.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señoras Pablina Mallorquín domiciliada en el  km 7 Barrio Murucuyá de   _C.D.E. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su Barrio.
El comité se Denomina” Espíritu Santo “  están en el octavo   Ciclo   con 19  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas poseen un ahorro, realizan incentivos para acontecimientos como cumpleaños de las integrantes, sorteos y  actividades diversas .
Una de las integrantes es la señora Cristina quien es artesana una señora muy activa y muy dedica a todas sus actividades.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad hace varios años y realiza artesanía de todo tipo así como bordados en zapatillas, forrados de termos, ao po´i y otros.
Sus productos son muy solicitados por la calidad que tienen, además ella fábrica para exportar a FRANCIA las artesanías que ella elabora y siente muy orgullosa por ello.
  Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus artesanías como telas, hilos, tintes para colorear, colas, y otros.
texts.en:
In order to form this group, Pablina Mallorquín, who lives in the 7th kilometer of the Murucuyá neighborhood of C.D.E, contacted her friends and neighbors to form the group in her neighborhood. The group is called “Espíritu Santo” (Holy Spirit). It is in its 8th cycle, and is made up of 19 members. This group is known it the neighborhood as being united and very responsible. They have savings that they use for activities such as birthday celebrations for the members, drawings, and different activities. Cristina is one of the members. She is an artisan and very active. She’s been doing this for several years and makes a variety of craft items, such as embroidered slippers, thermos covers, and other things. Her products are in high demand because of their quality and she also exports to France. She is very proud of that fact. She is asking for this loan to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, colored inks, glues, and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is a 41 years old and single, and supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, E-loader and food vending businesses. She lives in Purok Burgos, Brgy. 4, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, mobile phone credit electronic loading and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. 

Ma. Isabel is now borrowing PHP 16,000 so that she  could  purchase more merchandise to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Isabel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hija en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún , una zona caracterizada por poseer una geografía bastante accidentada debido a que se encuentra cerca de la sierra norte del país.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, el cría diversos animales en su domicilio alimentándolos de granos y forraje, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en una feria que toma lugar en el cercano distrito de Cayaltí una vez a la semana. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Humberto desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento para poder aumentar su nivel de ventas y de esa manera percibir mas ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar esta acción.

Humberto es una persona tranquila, responsable y muy trabajadora. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien respetable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Humberto is the father of a family, 43 years of age, who lives with his wife and daughter in the agricultural district of Oyotún, an area known for having a rather dramatic geography, as it is located in the northern mountains of the country. 

He is dedicated to the breeding and sale of smaller animals.  He raises diverse kinds of animals in his home, feeding them grain and fodder.  When they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale in the outdoor market that takes place in the nearby district of Cayaltí once a week. With the profits that he earns from this activity he takes charge of moving his family ahead. 

Humberto would like to grow his business with the purchase of more animals and feed in order to be able to increase his level of sales and in this manner obtain greater profits.  For this reason he has found it necessary to request his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa, a loan of 1000 new soles which will help him carry out this action.

Humberto is a peaceful, responsible and hard-working person. The people who know him consider him someone who is respectable and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy animals and food to grow his business

loans.name: Surriaya's Group

texts.en:
Surriaya (pictured with the book in her hands) is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan that is famous for its agricultural industry. She is a housewife, who stays at home. She explains that she is a very active a responsible lady, who takes her household responsibilities very seriously and manages them well. She is married to M., a retired government employee.

Surriaya and her husband have four sons and one daughter. Her three oldest sons are illiterate. They could not get an education due to their family's dire financial situation. As a result, those boys started working at a very early age: her oldest son has a clothing sales business; her next oldest son works in a factory and earns a monthly wage; and her third oldest son is a day laborer. Yet things are different now: her two youngest children are enrolled in a school and are receiving an education.

Surriaya is now seeking a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her oldest son’s business. With the loan proceeds, he would like to buy a wide variety of clothes in bulk. The variety of clothes enables him to sell clothes to many customers and to thereby generate good profits. He has been operating this business for the last 10 years, and Surriaya is very confident that her son will be able to expand his business with the help of this loan. Notably, she is a regular client of Asasah, and this would be her third loan through Asasah. With respect to her prior loans, she responsibly paid her installments and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To expand inventory by purchasing a variety of clothes in bulk

loans.name: Dechmaa

texts.en: Dechmaa D. is a 61-year-old single mother with four children. Three of her children live on their own. She and her daughter and granddaughter live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter works as a teacher in the school and her granddaughter attends a secondary school. Dechmaa operates a dairy products business in the local community. She started her business in 1996 operating a small shop where she sold a variety of foodstuffs and dairy products. After she closed her shop, she decorated an extra room of apartment where she started to operate her dairy trading business. Over the years, she has built a stable operation and has made much progress with her business. Dechmaa says, "All I want is to provide good education for my grandchild." Her daughter purchased a grocery store and she will open a stall to sell her dairy products in order to increase her working capital. That is why she is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products

loans.name: Hilda Marcelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Hilda Z. es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive en la comunidad de Cashapata que  pertenece a la parroquia de Zhidmad, en esta parroquia se puede encontrar la paz de la naturaleza debido a que se encuentra rodeada de vegetación natural, su gente en su mayoría se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Doña Hilda tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo ha terminado de estudiar el colegio, su segunda hija está en quinto curso y su ultimo hijo estudia en la escuela.

La Señora Hilda se dedica a la venta de ganado en su misma comunidad, actividad que la realiza hace varios años, todo el día se dedica al cuidado de los mismos y su esposo después del trabajo también le ayuda al cuidado de los animales, se encuentra tranquila ya que en el negocio le va muy bien.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 5 años y ahora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para el pasto de sus animales. Su meta es  llegar tener un negocio de cerdos.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilda Z. is a member of the Banco Comunal 14 de Agosto (14th August Communal Bank). She lives in the community of Cashapata, located in the parish of Zhidmad. In this parrish one feels in peace with nature, thanks to the natural vegetation that surrounds it, and its inhabitants engage mainly in breeding animals and in agriculture.

Doña Hilda is 39 years old, she is married and has 3 children aged 18, 15 and 5. Her eldest son has completed his school studies, her daughter is attending the last year of high school and the youngest son attends primary school.

Hilda engages in selling livestock in her own community, an activity she has been engaging in for many years. She spends all day taking care of the animals, and also her husband helps her breeding the animals once his job is over. She is serene as the activity is going very well.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years, and she is going to use her new loan to buy manure to feed her animals. Her goal is to breed pigs.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice N. is a 29-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: school supplies vending, rags vending, and a general store business. She lives in Cordova, Brgy. San Miguel, Lapu-lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her school supplies, rags vending, and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP30,000.  

Janice is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Janice aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn P. is from the village of Hubangon, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 23 years old. Jenelyn is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jenelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snacks in the local community. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jenelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jenelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Gerelmaa is 29 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her eldest two children attend a local secondary school and the youngest son stays at home.  She rents a stall at the market where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been running this business since 2005. She has used her earnings to provide for her children and to pay their living expenses. 

Her husband Altanshagai, 27 years old, helps her business with his microbus by transporting her products to the market. In the future she is planning to increase her working capital and to give her children a good education and morals. 

She is applying for a loan for 900,000 MNT to purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices to resell to her many customers.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is a single woman with one son who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills. 

She has operated M-pesa (mobile banking services) for the past year, operating wholesale and retail. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Phylis faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She hopes to become a Safaricom dealer in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a cash float for mobile banking services( M-pesa) and scratch cards for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her business.

loans.use: To purchase a cash float for mobile banking services ( M-pesa) and scratch cards for sale

loans.name: María Lucia

texts.es: María Lucia A. A. de reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de  San Salvador, y así mismo vive junto a sus dos hijos. A Sus 55 años de edad María posee una tapiciría, en donde se dedica a arreglar muebles y así mismo a hacer forros para estos mismo, María tiene 10 años de contar con este negocio, gracias al cual pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera, quien siempre tuvo que trabajar el dobre por salir adelante y en el cual su hijo menor le ayuda en la actualidad. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de material para la reparación de muebles tales como: madera, pegamento, telas, hilos y otros más. Así de esta menera María espera mejorar su negocio y así mismo vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en: María Lucia A. A. lives in the town of Soyapango, located in the departament of San Salvador. She lives with her two children. At 55 years old, María owns an upholstery business. She fixes furniture and also makes upholstery.  María has had this business for 10 years, and thanks to it was able to get her children ahead. She is a single mother who always had to work twice as hard to get ahead. Her younger son helps her in this activity now. María is asking for a loan to have the money she needs to invest in buying materials to repair furniture, such as: wood, glue, fabric, thread, and more. In this way, María hopes to improve her business and live better with her family.

loans.use: To buy wood, glue, fabric and more.

loans.name: Launh

texts.en:
Launh T., age 34, is a resident of Kompong Cham, a province of Cambodia. Launh T. earns a living by producing and selling clay stoves. She and her husband work together to produce stoves to offer for sale. She also receives orders from middlemen, who then need to wait one or two weeks for their order. For additional income, she also works in construction as a temp. 

Launh T. needs to make necessary repairs to her as yet unfinished house. She is asking for a loan in order to make repairs and to complete work on her house construction. 

She and her husband have four children. All four of the children are students and also assist with their parents' business when they are free from studying.

loans.use: To make repairs to her house and to finish its construction

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a married man with one child who is too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

He has operated a second-hand clothes business for the past two months, selling in a shop and from door-to-door.  In addition, he also operates a chips shop. Enock faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business.  He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase a bundle of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma (nicknamed Fely) M. is a 47-year old married woman with one child. Fely is engaged in farming. 

She and her husband, who is also a farmer, till their land together. They plant and harvest rice crops. Part of the harvest is used for family consumption and the rest is sold to their community.

Fely needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which she will use to supply her farm. Fely hopes to create a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia is a 30-year-old married woman with 3 children, the oldest 10 years old. Virgilia is a farmer who has been growing rice for 5 years. She usually earns about 4,000 PHP from farming. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Virgilia hopes for her business to grow and for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 69 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cria animales como gallinas, cuyes y chanchos y luego los vende al público en general a los que tienen restaurant y preparan caldo de gallina, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos, cuyes y chanchos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina, 69, is a member of the “San Isidro de Yanahuara” communal bank located in Urubamba District which belongs to Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She is a widow and has 7 children.  She alternates her daily chores with a livestock raising business; she raises animals like chickens, guinea pigs and pigs that she later sells to the general public and to restaurant owners who make chicken soup.  She wants to improve the business of raising animals and is asking for a loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs and pigs at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and pigs at wholesale.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 43 years old, married, with five children aged 23 to 13, living in Karuguuza, Uganda. He is the sole breadwinner for the family and his desire is to have a self-sustaining family. For 21 years he has been running a butchery business and with the  income generated he has been able to buy land and build a house. He faces a challenge of high prices and hopes to start refrigerating meat in future. Vincent intends to use the loan to buy cows to sell as meat.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell their meat.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has four children. He lives with eight family members. Three of the family members work. 

Hisham has had a bakery since 2000. Here he makes all kinds of bread and pastries. He has more than 10 years experience and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $2700 for tiling the walls of his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to tile the walls of his shop.

loans.name: 02.04.04 - Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan works in agriculture growing food. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Loan is 45 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a nine-member group, the 02.04.04 - Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Loan hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Katiusca Roxana

texts.es:
Katiusca Roxana tiene 35 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Katiusca se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos, además le gustaría invertir un poco en la comprar de pollos para criar y vender.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es que siempre tengan salud y vida para seguir trabajando.

Le gusta realizar los trabajos de la casa como limpiar, lavar, además le gusta mucho tener amigos y festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Katiusca Roxana is 35 years old, married and living with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and is located in Cachely Grande which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Katiusca is a farmer, especially of corn, rice and beans.  She does her purchases in the “Hermanos Olivos” supermarket every month and her sales take place in the local farmers market.

She requested the loan to buy seed and manure for her crops.  She’d also like to invest a bit in the purchase of chickens to raise and sell.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are crop illnesses.  

Her dream is that they continue healthy and alive to continue working.  She likes doing housework like cleaning and washing.  She also likes having friends very much and to celebrate the local festivals.

loans.use: to buy seed and manure for her crops and also to invest some in the purchase of chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Matilde Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora MatilD. llegó a la ciudad hace 6 años procedentes D. Aracataca, municipio del departamento del Magdalena donD. se dedicaba al negocio D. restaurante, D. ahí su vasta experiencia en la preparación D. alimentos;  la señora MatilD. es viuda y vive en casa D. una hija que resiD. en Aracataca y quien tiene a cargo su restaurante en esa población, mientras la señora MatilD. tiene un negocio D. comidas rápidas, donD. venD. perros calientes, hamburguesas, fritos y chichas, actividad que desarrolla en horas D. la mañana en el barrio los robles del municipio D. Soledad, en el departamento del Atlántico  en un  local arrendado y en la tarD. funciona en Malambo otro municipio D. este mismo departamento.  
El negocio D. la señora MatilD. presenta poco capital D. trabajo,  ya que sus ventas en general son D. contado y maneja pocos inventarios D. materias primas e insumos, pero sus  compras las  realiza a diario en graneros.  Su meta es incrementar su capital D. trabajo para comprar  en mayor cantidad y ganar descuentos por volumen, que finalmente incrementarán su rentabilidad. Esta es la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará  materias primas como arroz, azúcar, saborizantes, salchichas, salsas, azúcar, pan/perro, pan/hamburguesa, verduras, carnes y aceites, compra  que le permitirá también,  disminuir los costos  D. transporte.
texts.en:
MatilD. arrived in this city six years ago from Aracataca, a town in Magdalena department where she worked in the restaurant business.  That is where she gained her vast experience in preparing food.  MatilD. is a widow and lives in the home of one of daughters in Aracataca.  Her daughter runs a restaurant in that town.  MatilD. has a fast food business where she sells hot dogs, burgers, fries and 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  She carries out her business in the mornings in the Los Robles neighborhood, in the town of Soledad, in Atlántico department.  She works in rented premises.  In the afternoons, she works in Malambo, another town in the same department.

MatilD.'s business has little working capital since her sales are generally carried out in cash and she has little inventory of raw materials and supplies.  She makes her purchases daily in grocery stores.  MatilD.'s goal is to increase her working capital so that she can buy her products in greater quantities and gain discounts for buying in bulk.  This will increase her profitability.  For this reason, she is applying for this Kiva loan which is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials such as rice, sugar, flavorings, sausages, sauces, sugar, bread (hot dogs), bread (burgers) vegetables, meat and oils.  This purchase will also enable her to reduce her transport costs.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, flavorings, sausages, sauces, sugar, bread (hot dogs), bread (burgers), vegetables, meat and oil

loans.name: Kilesi

texts.en:
Kilesi is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years.

He has applied for his first loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

He dreams of prospering in farming and being able to provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and to acquire more animals

loans.name: Mayra Del Rosario

texts.es: Mayra del Rosario: de 25 años de edad ella se dedica a la crianza de animales como pollos y cerdos, desde hace ya barios años,ella mos comenta que es una actividad que le gustan mucho los animales, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales,para crianza y para que cuando ya esta buenos para venderlos los vende, para sacarles su ganacia, el sueño de ella es que sus hijos tengan un futuro de muchas oportunidades,y que sean unos profecionales.
texts.en: Mayra del Rosario, 25, has been raising animals such as chickens and pigs for several years.  She enjoys her work because she likes animals very much and is requesting a loan to buy more to raise and sell for profit.  Her dream is to give her children an education so they will have a better opportunity to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy farm animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start selling wedding dresses as a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and treatment for pests.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Шухрат умный и добрый человек. Он женат, любящий и ответственный отец 4 детей. Он начал свой бизнес 12 лет назад с куплей продажей автозапчастей. Теперь его жена занимается этим, а он открыл свой новый бизнес. Шухрат открыл мастерскую для того чтобы он мог там обслужит диагностики и ремонта автомобилей. Шухрат хочет получить стабильный доход от данного бизнеса и расширить его. Шухрат  запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки нового оборудования для диагностики автомобиля. Шухрат хочет заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Shuhrat is a smart and kind person.  He is married and is a loving and responsible father of four children.  He started his business twelve years ago with the sales of auto parts.  Currently, his wife has taken over that business, and he opened a new business. Shuhrat opened his repair shop in order to provide automotive diagnostic and repair services.  Shuhrat wants to receive a stable income from this business and to expand it.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 in order to purchase new automotive diagnostic equipment.  Shuhrat wants to thanks you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase diagnostic equipment

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past nine years, Sulaiman has been working hard to manage his brick making business which sells bricks. and he also has a small retail shop that sells sugar, etc..

To help expand his business, Sulaiman has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy firewood for the bricks and will help Sulaiman to generate greater profits and pay medical and school fees and expenses. Sulaiman hopes that in the future he will be able to start up a wholesale shop. 

Sulaiman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaiman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy firewood for bricks.

loans.name: Enma Cristina

texts.es:
Doña Enma tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la Colonia Bella Vista en el municipio de Juticalpa, es una persona muy trabajadora y  desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de abarrotería. 

Doña Enma tiene una pequeña pulpería que funciona en su domicilio, con un horario de atención de 6:00 am 8:00 pm.  Inicio simplemente con una venta de refrescos pero las personas que iban a comprarle siempre le preguntaban por productos de la canasta básica así que solicito un préstamo en FAMA e hizo las gestiones necesarias para instalar la pulpería que ahora tiene. Su principal ventaja es que es una persona muy conocida en la colonia y por eso sus vecinos prefieren realizar sus compras en su pulpería. 

El préstamo que Doña Enma solicita lo necesita para surtir su pulperia con la compra de arroz, frijoles, azucar, manteca, pastas, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, lacteos, churros, galletas, confites, entre otros productos de la canasta basica.

Su meta es tener un mercadito y que este le permita obtener mayores ganancias para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio hasta verlos graduarse en la universidad y también desea que su de vida mejore.
texts.en:
Enma is 43 years old, she is married and she has six children. She lives with her family in Bella Vista, a village of the municipality of Juticalpa. She is a very hard working person and she has been engaged in selling groceries for a few years.

Enma runs a small corner shop in her house, working from 6 am to 8 pm. She started with a simple soft drink sales, but as the people who came buying at her stall where asking for basic daily products as well, she decided to ask FAMA for a loan, ad she took the necessary steps to set the corner shop she now owns. Her main advantage is being a well-known person in her village, and for this reason her neighbors prefer to buy their products in her corner shop.

The loan Enma is requesting will be used to buy general merchandise in order to supply her shop with rice, beans, sugar, butter, pasta, soft drinks, meat, sausage, dairy products, fritters, cookies, and sweets, among other basic products.

She aims at running a business that, by generating more earnings will help her keep on supporting her children with their studies, up to see them graduating at university; she also wants her life to improve.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, butter, pasta, soft drinks, and meat.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La señora Sofia es agricultora y también vende jugos de frutas los fines de semana en la localidad de Patacamaya. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba para mejorar sus cultivos de papa y quinua. Vive en casa de sus padres  ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia Aroma; es soltera y no tiene  hijos. Es la primera vez que Sofia obtiene un crédito a través de Kiva e IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sra. Sofia is a farmer and also sells fruit juices on the weekends in the town of Patacamaya. The money from this loan will cover the cost of a water pump so that she can improve her potato and quinoa crops. Sofia lives at her parents’ house in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. She is single and has no children.

This is the first time Sofia has obtained a loan through Kiva and IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to improve her crops.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Она домохозяйка. Но дома она просто так не сидит, у неё свой бизнес. На протяжении пяти лет она занимается откормом скота. Она откармливает крупный и малый рогатый скот. Ей помогает её муж. Вместе они получают хорошие доходы. Следует запастись кормом, но для этого нужны средства. Она хочет получить займ и закупить корм и крупный рогатый скот. Она надеется на вашу поддержку в получении займа.
texts.en: Nargis is married and has one child.  She is a homemaker, but does not just stay home.  She has her own business.  Nargis has been involved in fattening up livestock for five years.  She fattens up cattle and small livestock.  Her husband helps her with this business.  Together, they make a good living.  Nargis needs to stock up on fodder, but needs funds for this.  She wants to obtain this loan and buy fodder and livestock.  She hopes to receive your support in obtaining this loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock and fodder

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 22 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 6 y 4  años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela y la menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatillas y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende útiles escolares y helados, ella sale tres días a la semana a vender sus productos aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su local, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante  bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatillas ya que se acercan las fiestas y  en esta temporada se vende bastante de estos productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "20 de Abril" communal bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi canton in Portoviejo province, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicafts, which are recognized at the national and international level. This is the home of the famous toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats).

This is where we met Rosa, who is 22, and married. She and her husband have two children, ages six and four. The eldest goes to primary school, and the youngest is in nursery school. Her husband is a construction worker.

She is a housewife, who in order to earn her own income, sells clothing, footwear, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories).  In addition, she has a small shop in her home where she sells school supplies and ice cream.

She goes out three days a week to sell her products, although she carries out most of her sales at her shop. She sells her products on credit, and collects every weekend. She has been doing this for five years, and it's going quite well.  

This loan is to buy clothing and footwear, as the holidays are approaching, and in this season you sell quite a lot of these products. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to continue increasing her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino de 40 años de edad, casado con Senayda de 38 años de edad, con quien tiene 5 hijos. Juntos habitan en el distrito de Pichari, donde tienen su propia casa. Faustino es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 25 años. En un inicio trabajaba como peon en la parcela de sus vecinos, ahí aprendió a cultivar diversos productos como el cacao, café, plátano, piña y otros. Al cabo de un tiempo y luego de casarse, se independizó y esto gracias al apoyo de su querido padre, quien le cedió una parcela de terreno agrícola para plantar cacao, dandole toda la dedicación. Ahora son sus mejores patrones para poder sacar las mejores semillas y en rendimiento de producción  son las mejores plantas en la zona. Cuenta que de una hectárea de cultivo de cacao tiene un rendimiento anual de 2,000 kilos por el que él está contento con esta labor que realiza. En un futuro próximo desea expandir sus cultivos, de esta manera obtendrá más ingresos. Este será su primer crédito por lo que él esta comprometido en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos comprará fertilizantes para aplicar a sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
40-year-old Faustino is married to 38-year-old Senayda, with whom he has 5 children.  They live together in Pichari district where they own their own home.  Faustino has been working in farming for 25 years.  At first he worked as a laborer on his neighbors' plot of land.  There he learned to grow different crops such as cacao, coffee, bananas, pineapples, etc.  After a while, and after getting married, he started working for himself thanks to the support of his beloved father who gave him a plot of farmland where he could grow cacao.  He gives this his full commitment.  Now he has the best seeds and, in terms of production yield, his are the best plants in the area.  He says that from a hectare of cacao plantings, he has an annual yield of 2,000 kilos and so he is happy with the work that he does.  In the near future, he would like to expand his crops and thereby make more income.

This will be Faustino's first loan and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He will use his 1,500 soles to buy fertilizers to spread on his cacao plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora en 1993 inicio su pequeño negocio con la venta de chiverías poco a poco fue aumentándola hasta tener una pulpería bien surtida. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, carne, comida para perro…etc. ya que desea tener una miscelánea.
texts.en:
María Lourdes is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman. In 1993 she began her small business selling dairy products. Little by little she increased her sales until she had her own well-stocked grocery store.

She will invest her loan in buying basic grains, meat, dog food, etc.as she wishes to have a variety of things to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, especially basic grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Clément

texts.fr: Clément est âgé de 31 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Aïchatou. Le couple a quatorze enfants dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants en charge. Clément n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Clément mène comme activité depuis trente ans environs, la culture des légumineuses (tomates, piment et gombo) et du maïs qu’il vend dans une ville du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette  activité, Clément fait la pêche. Clément s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Clément sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’accroître le niveau de son activité. Les quatre premiers crédits reçus antérieurement par Clément ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Clément is 31 years old and married to a trader called Aïchatou. The couple have 14 children, some of whom attend school. They are raising 2 other children, as well as their own. The couple share the household expenses.

Clément does not have a formal education. In order to be able to meet his, and his family's, needs, he has grown vegetables (e.g. tomatoes, pepper and gumbo) and corn, for around 30 years. He sells his produce in his local town in Benin. He also fishes.

Clément gets his supplies in his local area and is requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé so that he can invest in and strengthen his business, and better satisfy customer demand. He would like to increase his level of business activity. His 4 previous loans have all been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy crop-growing products (for peppers, tomatoes, gumbo and corn)

loans.name: Omar Genaro

texts.es: El señor Omar tiene como actividad el comercio de artefactos de segunda mano, realiza esta actividad desde hace tres años, el compra un artefacto en donde ve una buena oferta, de amigos, vecinos y de quien este interesado en vender sea televisores, refrigeradores, computadoras, bicicletas, etc. En general cualquier cosa que tenga un valor de reventa, ofrece sus productos mediante tarjetas que distribuye en su taxi a sus mismos clientes y hace la  compra y las entregas sus días libres que son martes viernes y domingo con su  vehículo, cabe señalar que trabaja arduamente para llevar un sustento a su familia, solicita el crédito para la compra de artefactos de segunda mano, El vive junto a sus hijas en su domicilio que esta en anticrético, su esposa reside en Ávila , España hace ya 7 años. Cabe recalcar que su esposa manda remesas cada mes con lo que ayuda a la economía del hogar de don Omar.
texts.en: Señor Omar has a business selling second hand articles which he has been running for the last 3 years, purchasing an item when he sees a good deal from friends, neighbours and whoever is interested in selling whether it be televisions, fridges, computors, bicycles, etc. In general, he buys anything that has a good resale value. He sells his products by cards he distributes in his taxi to his customers. He buys and delivers on his days off which are Tuesdays, Fridays and Sundays with his taxi. It is noteworthy that he works hard to take care of his family. He is asking for the loan to buy second hand goods. He lives with his daughters in his home in Anticrético. His wife has lived in Avila, Spain for the last 7 years. It should be noted that his wife sends remittances every month to help with Don Omar's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy second hand articles.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en: Etienne is married with seven children. He is 45 years old. All of his children attend school. He sells spare parts for bicycles. He has been running this business for the period of one and a half years selling the bicycle spare parts but in addition for the time he started the business of both motorcycle and bicycles is now about five years. He requested the loan to add more spare parts to sell. He plans to use the profits to expand his business building. In the future, he wishes to sell more spare parts.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 26 años. Es una mujer soltera y cuida a Yameli de 10 años y a Yoselin de 7, sus hijos a quienes quiere como a nadie. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini, provincia de Chanchamayo. Yameli y Yoselin significan el motor para su emprendimiento. Yolanda se dedica a los negocios. Desde que se separó del padre de sus hijas, instaló una tienda en su casa. Ahí expende comestibles como: dulces, gaseosas, cervezas, chupetes, helados, frutas, etc. “Es rentable el negocio, especialmente los fines de semana”, menciona.
Antes no podía ser una mujer independiente, por falta de capital para iniciar una actividad, pero gracias a al apoyo de sus familiares ahora puede estar segura que camina hacia el desarrollo.
Más adelante quisiera consolidar su establecimiento como una bodega de abarrotes, donde no falten productos para satisfacción de sus clientes. Sería la primera vez que Yolanda recibiría un crédito de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Se siente contenta de formar parte de “Los Caciques de Menkoremón”, su banco comunal, por que confía que sus resultados serán favorables para su crecimiento.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 26, is single and cares for Yameli, 10, and Yoselin, 7, her children who she loves like no one else.  They live together in their house located in the indigenous community of Pucharini in Chanchamayo Province.  Yameli and Yoselin are the motivating force behind her enterprise.  

Yolanda is a merchant.  Since she separated from the father of her daughters, she opened a store at home.  She sells foodstuffs like candy, soft-drinks, beer, lollipops, ice-cream, fruit, etc.  “The business is profitable, especially on weekends,” she mentions.

Before, she wasn’t able to be an independent woman for lack of capital to start a business but thanks to support from family members she’s now sure that she’s on her way to success.  Later on, she’d like to consolidate her business into a grocery store where no products will be lacking to meet customer demand.  

This will be the first time Yolanda receives an MFP loan and she commits to be punctual with her installment payments.  She feels happy to be part of the “Los Caciques de Menkoremón” communal bank because she’s confident that results will be favorable for her growth.  She will invest the money in the purchase of groceries and basic need items to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Akwouvi

texts.fr: Mariée, Akwouvi est une femme résidant deux enfants à charge. Akwouvi est âgée de 25 ans et habite à Adidogomé où elle vend des chaussures. Akwouvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant dans les quartiers environnant et à domicile. Akwouvi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de chaussures pour femmes en vue de mieux revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.

loans.use: Acheter 10 douzaines de chaussures pour femmes.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif I. is a big landowner from Razgrad. He tills over 2 000 decares land. Arif grows 1200 decares wheat and 800 decares corn and sunflower. All production is being sold on market. He has all necessary technical equipment for his farming business and now needs $ 1200 to make repairs on one of his harvester machines.

loans.use: To make repairs on one of his harvester machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rosemary Njeri would like to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Señora Lorenza has had her grocery business since four years ago. “I have my business in my home but I have very little merchandise. I want to buy more merchandise to increase my sales since that it is the sustenance of my family. I request a loan of $1,000 dollars for business inventory.”

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Lorenza tiene su negocio de abarrotes desde hace 4 años." Mi negocio lo tengo en mi casa pero tengo muy poca mercancía y quiero comprar mas mercancía, para aumentar mis ventas ya que es el sustento de mi familia. Solicito un prestamos de $1,000.00 dlls. Para inventario en el negocio".

loans.use: To buy goods for her in-home grocery store

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia sells clothes that she buys at the border with Guatemala, in a place called Mesilla, because they're less expensive there; she then sells them in a shop that she borrows or, sometimes, from her house. She is 40 years old and married with four children. She wants to use the loan to get her own shop so that she can display her products there. She belongs to the Francelia 3 group along with dona Martha Navarro Diaz (grocery store) and dona Guadalupe Navarro Diaz (grocery store). They'll combine the loan and buy merchandise at wholesale that they'll then divide up to stock their stores.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

ALICIA se dedica a la venta de ropa que compra en la frontera con Guatemala en un lugar llamado Mesilla ya que ahí es más económica, posteriormente lo vende en un local que le prestan y a veces en su casa. Ella tiene 40 años, casada, cuatro hijos. Con el préstamo quiere conseguir su propio local y exponer ahí sus productos. Pertenece al grupo Francelia 3 junto con doña Martha Navarro Díaz (tienda de abarrotes) y doña Guadalupe Navarrro Díaz (tienda de abarrotes). Ambas juntaran su préstamo y compraran mercadería al por mayor y luego se la repartirán para abastecer sus tiendas.

loans.use: Clothing sales.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Pajchani, when translated in Spanish, means “claridad” or clarity and transparency when translated into English. Pajchani is the name of the association to which Elisa Y., mother of 4 school children, belongs. Elisa works in the sale of office and school supplies made from plastic materials such as book covers, folders, laminates, and others products. This is how she makes a living and has been doing so for 12 years. In the beginning, she bought these products and resold them at the door of the Internal Revenue Office. Over time and with a lot of hard work, Elisa was able to purchase the necessary machinery in order to manufacture these products and transfer her place of work to the offices of Identifications of the National Police. Elisa requires this money in order to purchase raw materials and get her business ready in time for the school season in January of next year when she makes her biggest sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Pajchani, traducido al castellano quiere decir claridad, transparencia, es el nombre de la asociación a la que pertenece Elisa Y., madre de 4 niños, todos aún en edad escolar. Elisa se dedica a trabajar con plásticos, forros, folders, carpetas, plastificaciones y otros, son los trabajos que realiza y con el cual subsiste, generando sus propios recursos. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este oficio, en un inicio, ella compraba estos productos y revendía en la puerta de las oficinas de Impuestos Internos. Con el tiempo y con mucho trabajo, Elisa logra la compra de la maquinaria necesaria para la fabricación de este producto y traslada su lugar de trabajo a las oficinas de Identificaciones de la Policía Nacional. Elisa precisa de capital con el fin de abastecerse de materia prima y preparar su negocio para el mes de enero del próximo año, mes en el que se inicia la temporada escolar y representa alta venta.

loans.use: Elisa requires this money in order to purchase raw materials and get her business ready in time for the school season in January of next year, when she makes her biggest sales.

loans.name: Runke

texts.en: Mrs. Runke A. is married with 4 children. She is 40 years old, and hails from Mushin, Lagos State. She sells drinks, groundnut oil and eggs. She has been in business since 1995 and needs the loan amount of $800 to buy more drinks, groundnut oil, and eggs for sale. She explains that this will help her serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, groundnut oil and eggs for sale

loans.name: Yovana Mirian

texts.es:
Mrs. Yovana is member of the communal bank, Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado (Entrepreneuring Women of the Market) in Huaraz. She works selling beef and prepared burger patties. Her business is located in the central market of Huaraz, Ancash department.

With this loan for S/. 300.00 (US$ 125 approx.), which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy meat wholesale to sell retail.

She is 23 years old, living in common-law marriage, and has a little boy who is 2 and a half years old. Her husband works in the mine as a laborer, and in his days off he helps out in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mercado” de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de carne roja (carne de res) y hamburguesa preparadas, su negocio esta ubicado en el Mercado central de Huaraz, del Departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará carne por gancho (media res/al por mayor) para luego vender al por menor.

Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo pequeño de dos años y medio, su esposo trabaja en la mina como obrero y en sus días libres la apoya en el negocio.

loans.use: Buying beef wholesale (Compra de carne de res al por mayor.)

loans.name: Lilliam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lilliam lives in Sabana Grande, where many people work in retail. Lilliam is 35 years old, married, with a six-year-old son who attends school. Lilliam and her husband sell fish and seafood such as ray/skate fish fillets, mojarra and pargo, amongst others. These are caught in the waters off some of Nicaragua’s beaches such as Masachapa and el Puerto de Corinto. Some of the produce is sold in their home, and some is sold in markets or on the streets. Lilliam needs this loan due to the current situation in Nicaragua - produce is becoming more expensive and she needs to buy fish and seafood in order to continue rotating her stock and generating a family income.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Doña Lilliam habita en la comarca de Sabana Grande, lugar donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican al comercio. Doña Lilliam tiene 35 años, es casada, con un niño de 6 años que asiste a la escuela. Doña Lilliam y su esposo se dedican a la venta de pescados y mariscos como filete de raya, mojarra, pargo, entre otros. Los productos lo adquieren de las costas de algunas playas de Nicaragua como son Masachapa y el Puerto de Corinto, una parte del producto lo venden en su casa, y otra parte se dedican a ofrecerlos en los mercados o venderlos ambulante. Necesita el préstamos ya que debido a la situación por la que pasa el país, el producto se está volviendo más caro, y requiere comprar los pescados y mariscos para seguir rotando su inventario y generando ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: To purchase seafood for her business

loans.name: Nkokonjeru B2 B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jassy K.. She is currently in the business of poultry keeping and is requesting a loan to build a brooder. Jassy is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 21 to 25. Each week, Jassy makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy poultry feed. Jassy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to add to the poultry business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jassy is joined in her small group by Florence Z., Rosette N., Josephine N., and Teo B.. Florence Z. has a business in clothing sales and wants to expand the business. Rosette N. is currently operating a business in clothing sales as well and wants a loan to add capital. Josephine N. operates a beauty salon business and wants to purchase a hair dryer. Teo B. is currently operating a piggery business and is requesting a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: To add to poultry business

loans.name: Marcelina's Group

texts.es:
Patrocinia, Jackeline, and Marcelina have belonged to the Ayni II communal bank for 14, 6, and 14 years, respectively.

Patrocinia is married, is 40-years-old, and has 5 children. Patrocinia sells meat in the Jesús Nazareno market. She travles to the markets where she buys animals and later sells them for a profit. She also sells salchipollo at the entrance of her house at night.

On the other hand, Jackeline is married, is 24-years-old, and has one daughter. She sells clothing and cosmetics by catalog on credit, products that she offers to friends and family.

Marcelina is married, is 70-years-old, and has 6 children. Marcelina has a grocery store in her home. She makes popsicles and ice cream and sells them in her home.

Patrocinia, Jackeline, and Marcelina need loans of 1500 soles, 450 soles, and 600 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of pigs, cattle, chickens, beer, and soft drinks.

The dreams of Patrocinia, Jackeline, and Marcelina are to have the necessary machinery to process meat, to have a clothing store, and to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Patrocinia, Jackeline y Marcelina pertenecen al Banco Comunal Ayni II hace 14, 6, 14 años respectivamente.

Patrocinia es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Patrocinia vende carne en el mercado Jesús Nazareno, Patrocinia viaja a las ferias en donde compra animales y posteriormente ella los beneficia. Además, por las noches vende salchipollo en la puerta de su casa.

Por otro lado Jackeline es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija, Jackeline vende ropa y cosméticos por catálogo a crédito, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares.

Mientras que Marcelina es casada, tiene 70 años y 6 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. Además Marcelina hace chupetes y helados que vende en su casa.

Patrocinia, Jackeline y Marcelina necesitan préstamos de 1500 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado porcino, vacuno, polos, cerveza y gaseosas.

Los sueños de Patrocinia, Jackeline y Marcelina son tener maquinaria necesaria para procesar la carne, una tienda de ropa y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Patrocinia, Jackeline, and Marcelina need loans of 1500 soles, 450 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of pigs, cattle, chicken, beer, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara O.is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She earns income selling medical drugs. By now, Clara has acquired many years of experience - she has been running her business since 1994. Currently, Clara needs a loan of $1,200 which she will use to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of drugs for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Operating a grocery shop for the past eight years, Ama Y. is a 38-year-old mother of five children. She sells many grocery items such as evaporated milk, soaps, rice, sugar, biscuits, canned foods and drinks, etc. Her focus is to expand the shop and she wants to use the loan to increase her stock of these items, which are commonly demanded by her neighbors. Ama enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard for the betterment of her children’s futures. She belongs to the community group called Holy Trinity. In this group, members guarantee each other's reliability to access loans and they provide peer pressure to encourage loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of rice, sugar, soaps, canned goods, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: La Alianza, Group 4

texts.en:
Ysabel "Maritza" S. is in her fourth loan cycle with her Esperanza International Bank of Hope, La Alianza ("The Alliance"). She used her first loan to open her women's underwear store, "Interiores Peniña." Maritza tried to open her store before her loan, but the business failed because she was unable to keep the store stocked with the variety and selection her customers wanted. Now, just two years later, Interiores Peniña is always full of merchandise--and customers!
