Before she joined her Bank of Hope, Maritza was dependent on her husband to send her money for necessities. As a result of her business's success, Maritza is now able to easily provide everything her family needs, from home furnishings to school supplies for her grandchildren.

Many budding entrepreneurs in this Quisqueya community have been inspired by the success of Interiores Peniña, and have joined Esperanza as a result. Maritza's home (which adjoins her shop) serves as the center for Bank of Hope collection meetings, and her loan officer, Damaris, often uses story to inspire her other borrowers.

loans.use: Interiores Peniña (women's underwear store)

loans.name: Thi Ngo

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo, 42 years old, has 2 schooling children. Joined the TYM Fund in 2002, she used the first loan to invest in rearing pigs. Currently, besides raising livestock and farming, she has a small store selling drinks. With the stable income from farming, livestock and business, she is able to send her children to school and purchase more home products. This time, she would like to borrow 14,000,000VND (850USD) to expand her business and further improve her family's economy. Her monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 200USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ngọ năm nay 42 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002, vòng vốn đầu chị đã sử dụng để chăn nuôi lợn. Đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi và trồng trọt chị còn có một cửa hàng nhỏ kinh doanh đồ uống giải khát. Với thu nhập ổn định từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và kinh doanh chị đã đầu tư cho các con ăn học đầy đủ và mua sắm thêm các trang thiết bị trong gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 14.000.000đ để đầu tư mở rộng kinh doanh, chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình . Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising livestock and investing in drink store

loans.name: Mohammad Karim

texts.en:
M. Karim is married and has the sole responsibility for his family’s financial wellbeing.  He started his footwear business six years ago after leaving the military, and now wishes to expand it in order to become more profitable. He therefore is requesting a loan in order to enlarge his shop and expand his stock.

He is happy with this process whereby small loans to people in poor countries are possible.   Karim is sure that these loans can change the lives of many people and hopes to continue his partnership with Kiva and AFSG in Kabul so that eventually he can have one or two more shops.

He would like to thank the Kiva lenders who make this possible.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop and expand his stock

loans.name: Chanthol's  Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol S. (the first from the left with her group members) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group, there are six families including her own. The entire group members are living along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Chanthol S. and her husband, Mr. Ty Bauy, were married in 1984 and have eight children; three daughters and five sons. Three of her children are employed full-time. Chanthol and her husband have been growing vegetable for twenty five years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing vegetables.

2-Mr. Son S. (he is not in the picture), 55, and his wife, Mrs. Lainim Um (shown in the picture in the middle), 53, were married in 1972 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. Son has been a motor taxi driver for five years and he alS. has another business is rent music instrument to villagers. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase electric materials for his music instruments business.

3-Mrs. Thach M., 53, is a widow with three children; one son and two daughters. One of her children studies at the University in Phnom Penh. Thach has been in the business of selling meal for twenty years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase spoons and plates for her restaurant business.

4-Mrs. Sarum P., 30, and her husband, Mr. Sam-Oeun Dam, 38, were married in 1990 and have one son and two daughters. Sarum has been growing vegetables for five years. Her husband has been a garment factory worker for five years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing vegetables.

5-Mr. Choeun K. (not in the picture), 38, and his wife, Mrs. Rany Um (shown in the picture from the right), 25, were married in 2001 and have one son and two daughters. Choeun has been growing vegetables for two years. His wife sells grocery items. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing vegetables.

6-Mrs. Maly C., 38, is a widow with three children; one son and two daughters. One of her children studies at the University in Phnom Penh and other two children study in local school. Maly has been a tailor for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to add to her own money to pay school fees for her son study in University.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and buy agricultural materials

loans.name: Badeya (Fraternité Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq (5) femmes du groupe Badeya (4 mariées et 1 célibataire) ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Mancourani I de Sikasso (troisième région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté.  Elles mènent leurs activités d’’achat et de  vente de poissons fumés, de fruits, de bazins, de parfums, du magnokisèni (plantes exotique très prisées en Afrique de l’Ouest). d’encens,
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 5ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 100 mètres de bazin blanc, 4 cartons de poissons fumés, 3 chargements d’orange, 10 bouteilles de parfum et l’eau de cologne, 10kg de Guéni (encens naturel), 10kg de graine de magnokisèni, 5 boîtes de teinture de couleurs différentes. Les graines de guéni et magnokisèni seront mélangées avec des parfums et l’eau de cologne pendant un certains temps afin de donner à l’encens une bonne odeur. Quant aux bazins blancs, il seront teints avec différentes colories par des teinturières de metier. 
Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) pour le bazin et à Mopti pour le poisson fumé. Les marchandises sont vendues en détail, au comptant au marché de Sikasso à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes. Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce nouveau prêt, un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans leurs activités respectives.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Badeya (of whom four are married and one is unmarried) average 40 years of age and three children. They live in traditional extended families in the Mancourani I district of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) and know one another through ties of community and kinship. Their work includes buying and selling smoked fish, fruit, damask, perfumes, incense, and magnokisèni (highly prized exotic plants in West Africa).

In order to satisfy their burgeoning customer base, this group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which it is on its fifth solidarity loan (group loan). All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, the group intends to buy: 100 meters of white damask, 4 boxes of smoked fish, 3 loads of oranges, 10 bottles of perfume and eau de cologne, 10 kg of guéni (natural incense), 10 kg of magnokisèni seeds, and 5 cans of dyes of different colors. The guéni and magnokisèni seeds will be mixed with perfumes and eau de cologne for a certain amount of time to provide a nice fragrance to the incense. As for the the white damask, these will be tinted with different colors using dyes of the trade.

They get their supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali) for the damask and in Mopti for the smoked fish. The goods are sold retail and in cash at the Sikasso marketplace to customers composed of women and men.

With this new loan, the group members each envision realizing an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to cover the loan interest, to provide for their families, and to invest the rest in their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
La Señora Celsa G. tiene su puesto de venta de ropas hace aproximadamente 8 años, en uno de los mercados más grandes y concurridos de Asunción.
Su marido tiene un puesto de venta al lado de ella y se dedica a la venta de artículos de electrónica. El matrimonio tiene 3 hijos, son menores de edad. Gracias al sacrificio diario de ambos, la familia goza de casa y comodidades para vivir. Son una pareja muy feliz y cuentan que tienen que abrir todos los días sin importar cansancio ni inclemencias del tiempo. Ellos siguen luchando juntos por dar la mejor educación a sus hijos.

La señora Celsa solicita el crédito para poder ampliar la variedad de mercaderías del puesto los cuales son cotidianamente demandadas en esta temporada. Estas prendas más vendidas son vestidos, camisas, faldas, ropa interior, bermudas y shorts.
texts.en:
Celsa G. has had a clothing stand for about 8 years, located in one of the biggest and most popular markets of Asuncion.

Her husband has a stand alongside hers and he sells electronics products. Their marriage produced 3 children, all are still minors. Given the great sacrifices made by them both every day the family enjoys a home and the comforts of living. They are a very happy couple, and they know that they have to work their stands every day, even through even they are tired or through inclement weather. They continue struggling to provide the best education for their children.

Celsa requests a loan to be able to increase the selection of merchandise of her stand, which is a daily requirement during this time of year. The merchandise most sold are dresses, shirts, skirts, undergarments, bermuda shorts and short pants.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for the summer season.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo es soltero, tiene 19 años, monto su negocio de venta de calzados con el apoyo de sus padres, pues, toda la familia es comercian también. El trabaja a medio tiempo en una casa de cambios. Su padre es quien atiende su negocio en ese horario.

 Prácticamente es  una empresa  familiar porque sus padres dedican la mayor parte de su tiempo a la comercialización de los productos y él hace los controles de stock y de las ventas.

Rodrigo es un joven comerciante y necesita de los créditos para hacer crecer su negocio y así  aumentar sus ingresos. En estas fiestas de fin de año se registran un alza considerable en las ventas, por lo que el desea aumentar su stock de mercaderías para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rodrigo, 19, is single. He started a retail footwear business with help from his parents so everyone in the family is a merchant now. Rodrigo also works part-time in a currency exchange office and his father operates the footwear business while he's working at the currency exchange. It's really a family business because Rodrigo's parents spend most of their time working at the business while he manages the inventory and sales. Rodrigo is a young businessman and needs loans to grow and increase his income. Sales increase considerably around the year-end holidays so he wants to add to his inventory in order to meet demand from his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida B. is 46 years old with six children. She is married to a fisherman who works in tandem for fish selling. Zenaida and her husband manage their fishing business which started from a small sailboat. She also has floaters to help guard their fish cages. As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories so there would be no chance of low or zero catch. Zenaida personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.

She became a member of Paglaum MPC, and Zenaida has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years now. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 15,000 for the purchase of new nets and to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from their daily sales. She wishes to see their children have stable jobs.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment needed for fishing

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina manages a typical village store business in Barangay Paragu, Tumauini, Isabela. Agriculture is the main livelihood of the residents and their main crops are corn and tobacco. She 42-years-old and is married to Ismael and they are happy though they do not have a child.

She has been in the vending business for four years. Her store opens at 6AM and closes at 8PM. To minimize transportation expenses, Martina asks her neighbors do the marketing for her in buying the necessary merchandise for her store and she is thankful that they are so kind to her. She wants to improve her business and is requesting a loan of $100 (PHP 4,000.00) that she can use to finance her store. Martina hopes that with the loan, her business will prosper to support her family.

loans.use: Financial Assistance for store improvement

loans.name: Majengo "a" Street Group

texts.en:
Sophia has been selling cosmetic items in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for two years. She is a member of the Majengo "A" Street Group loan (group code 2001).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $300. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cosmetics item for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Sophia is 27 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 and 6. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Prisca, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of seasonal goods

loans.name: Nor Agha Group

texts.en:
Nor Agha is the group leader of Nor Agha group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to take a loan for their own business. The total of their group loan is 30000 Afs. 

Nor Agha wants to take a loan for his business, a general store, because he wants to strengthen and enlarge his business. Marwaryd and Gull maky want to take a loan for their business of tailoring because they want to buy three new machines for their business. Malank wants to take a loan for his business, a coffee shop, to make his shop larger.

They are all happy about the process of taking out loans and want to say that it can support the entrepreneur a lot.

loans.use: To make their businesses larger

loans.name: Patricia Janeth

texts.es: Patricia Janeth R. V. reside en San Juan Opico junto a sus tres hijos todos menores de edad, su esposo reside en Los Estado Unidos y este le envía dinero mensualmente. Patricia posee un comedor en el mercado de San Juan Opico. Ella desea obtener un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más granos básicos y poder guardar una amplia provisión de manera que no tenga que comprarlos por algún tiempo, todo esto con el fin de poder obtener más ganancias, ya que su esposo le ayuda con $100 dólares mensuales lo cual es muy poco para todos los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijo, es por ello que Patricia anhela mejorar las ganancias de su negocio esperando mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Patricia Janeth R. V. lives in San Juan Opico with her three dependent children. Her husband lives in the United States and sends her money every month. Patricia has a cafeteria in the San Juan Opico market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more staple grains so that she can have a good supply on hand and not need to buy them for a while. This will help her increase her income, as her husband sends only $100 a month which is not enough to cover the cost of her children's education and other household expenses. Patricia dreams of increasing the earnings from her business so that she can improve her family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Юнусова Мехринисо занимается животноводством, более 5 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Возраст 35 лет. Проживает она в районе Турсунзаде. Муж находится в России, на заработках. Мехринисо с сыном продолжает деятельность мужа. Она просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить бычка, для откармливания. А в дальнешем продать.
texts.en:
Mehriniso Y. has been doing cattle farming for over five years. She is 35 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Tursunzade. Her husband works in Russia while she and her son continue the business her husband started. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase a bull calf which she plans to sell at a profit later.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, él trabaja como personal de seguridad en una empresa privada. Ella es una mujer con deseos de superación, es por eso que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce diferentes lugares, porque visita a sus clientes de casa en casa, y entre más se relaciona, más clientes va captando. Rosa considera que su negocio es rentable porque sus clientes son responsables en el momento del pago, debido a la buena atención y jovialidad que ella expresa. Además procura tener productos en stock para no sólo vender por pedido, sino también de manera inmediata y al contado. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros y compañeras son muy alegres, además de muy responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza y ampliará algunas habitaciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old. She lives with the father of her 2 children. He works as a security guard in a private company. She is a woman that dreams of success. For this reason, she has worked for 6 years in the catalog sales of beauty products from a nationally well-known brand. She likes getting to know different places, visiting her customers from house-to-house. The more customers she meets, the more she receives. Rosa thinks that her business is successful because her customers are responsible with their payments, thanks to the good attention and cheer that she expresses. Furthermore, she has some products in stock and doesn’t only sell through orders, but also through immediate sales. This is her third loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that her co-members are very happy and also responsible with their payments. With the money that she requests, she will buy more beauty products and expand some rooms in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandies and remodel her home

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene hijos mayores e independientes.  Ella tiene estudios de primaria completa, y vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, comprará abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, harina, fideos, etc.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo y las facilidades de pago que les da Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the communal bank “Nueva Generación 2000”, which is located in the district of Llave, the province of El Collao, and in the the department of Puno. She is 58 years old, married, and has children that are independent and out of the house. She lives in the neighborhood Santa Bárbara. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 7 years. Her first loan was for $100 (300.00 Soles), which she invested in her business of buying and selling groceries. At this moment she needs a loan of $200 (600.00 Soles) to invest in her business. She will use the money to buy grocery items like rice, sugar, milk, pasta, flour, etc. Felicitas' greatest wish is to continue working. She likes the way the organization Manuela Ramos is run and how they make making payments easy.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell like rice, sugar, milk, pasta, flour, etc.

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en: Abosede is 42 years old, married and has three children. She sells sarongs and laces. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell.

loans.name: Fozia Shahri Group

texts.en:
Fozia baji, wife of S., has resided in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, for the past twenty years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband works in a factory on monthly wage. Fozia baji is seated on the right in the photo.

Fozia baji is a very talented lady and she has a dream of making a tailoring center in the community where people approach her to have clothes sewn. Presently, she has a sewing machine but she wants to buy another sewing machine to make her dream come true.

This loan group consists of two additional people:

Rubina baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Javzandulam J. is 31 years old and lives with her 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All three of her children, two sons and a daughter, currently attend universities. 

Javzandulam sells sausage and meat products from a stall at Narantuul, Ulaanbaatar's largest outdoor market. Javzandulam started her business in 2001 and has since found much success. She currently runs the business with the help of her children, who have provided much support since their father passed away. Javzandulam is a very hard-working and responsible businesswoman and hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the profits from her business, she has been able to build a new house for her family and pay for her children's education. Her dream is for her  3 children to become highly educated people. She is requesting a 1,750,000 tugrug loan to purchase supplies and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and expand her business

loans.name: Trinidad Aleyda

texts.es:
"La Sra. Trinidad Aleida C., tiene como actividad la atención en su  salón de peluquería para damas el cual esta ubicado en la zona de Sopocachi,cerca de nuestras oficinas, es una cliente nueva, actualmente vive en casa de sus padres junto a su pequeño hijo, siendo ella la que genera ingresos para su familia.
El destino de dicho crédito será para la compra de nuevo instrumento de peluquería y para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ."

loans.use: Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de instrumentos de peluqueria y arreglo de su vivienda.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia S. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 38 years old. Letecia is married and has 1 young child. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling bananas in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used for full payment of her refrigerator. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to have their own appliances to use for the benefit of the family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: will be used for full payment of her refrigerator

loans.name: Nantabulirwa A Namusago Sylvia Group

texts.en:
N. Sylvia is thirty-six years old and is a single mother blessed with three children who are schooling. She also has two dependents (her parents).

Sylvia has been operating a pub, selling drinks such as beer, soda, wine, etc., for five years. She is using the loan to purchase more drinks to meet her customers’ different tastes. She wishes to stock more and boost her business.

Sylvia is a very active woman. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her pub

loans.name: Flor De Sacuanjoche Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Sacuanjoche está conformado por María Danelia T. quien desde el 2003 tiene una tienda de ropa en su casa, Maritza Sánchez C. hace diez años comenzó con  su pequeña venta la cual ha ido creciendo con el tiempo y Mayra R. G. desde de hace tres años tiene un pequeño taller de zapatería.

Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios y esperan en un futuro ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Group “Flor de Sacuanjoche” consists of María Danelia T. who has been operating a clothing store from home since 2003; Maritza Sánchez C. who began a small sales operation 10 years ago and has grown over time; and Mayra R. G. who has been managing a small shoe store for 3 years.

They will invest their loan in their respective businesses and hope to expand in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Mosbah

texts.en:
Mosbah has worked as a taxi driver since 1977 servicing the neighboring villages. Thanks to his business income, he was able to raise his four children.

Today, Mosbah is asking for a loan of $600 to repair his car after being in bad circumstances.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 41 años, vive junto a su pareja y padre de sus 6 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia.
Siempre sonriente, se le ve cruzar su pueblo, juntamente con su esposo camino a sus chacras. Ellos tienen cultivos de café y plátanos y ambos trabajan arduamente, ya que Anita tiene el dominio de trabajar artesanalmente con mucha agilidad en cada uno de estos cultivos, puesto que lo realiza desde su infancia. A ella no le parece nada cansado, es más disfruta realizarlo y cuando comercializa sus productos se llena de mucha alegría, pues con ese dinero compra los comestibles y vestimentas para sus hijos. 
Ahora que sus hijos han crecido, empezaran a trabajar junto a sus padres en sus chacras de café, para repartir las ganancias y de ese modo ellos poco a poco adquieran sus propios terrenos.

Este es el tercer crédito de Ana con MFP y durante este tiempo como clienta ha cumplido tanto en sus pagos, como en su cargo de tesorera de su banco comunal, al que aprecia mucho.
 El dinero que ahora solicita lo  piensa utilizar en la compra de plantitas de café y fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of their six children. They have their own home. Always smiling, Ana travels with her husband across town to get to their farm. They work hard to maintain their coffee and banana crops. Ana utilizes traditional methods, inspecting each of her crops by hand with great agility. She has been doing this type of work since childhood. Ana does not appear to be tired of her job; she enjoys it most during harvest season when she can bring her products to market. At that time, she generates income to buy groceries and clothing for her children. Now that her children are older, she has started helping her parents with their coffee crops. She hopes to share some of her earnings with them so they can gradually acquire their own land.

This is Ana’s third loan with MFP. During her time as a client, she has completed all of her payments. She also deserves much appreciation for her service as the Communal Bank treasurer. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase coffee seedlings and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & coffee seedlings

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. is thirty-two years old and a resident of Kyotera Town Council, Rakai District. She is single and blessed with three children. She owns a clothing business in Kyotera along Bukooba Main Road opposite the Kyotera Mosque. Her business is only two years old. She is using the loan to purchase more baby clothes to sell in her shop. She hopes are to expand her clothing business, especially the baby clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes for her shop

loans.name: Leonardo Manzanares Orozco

texts.es:
El Señor Leonardo M. O., Labora como  vigilante en la Universidad Autónoma de Nicaragua (UNAN), el tiene cinco hijos a su cargo, tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines, para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarle mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leonardo M. O., works as a security guard at the Universidad Autónoma de Nicaragua (UNAN). He's a husband and father of five children and three of them are currently going to school. He started working with CEPRODEL two years ago. During this period, he’s received three loans to make home improvements. He’s an outstanding client. He will use this loan to buy construction material, such as zinc and steel, to remodel his house’s roof to make it safer for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Joel Alberto

texts.es: El joven Joel Alberto M. es un muchacho joven de edad pero muy responsable y con una gran visión de salir adelante, el vive con su mama quien labora para una empresa  restaurantera como cocinera y el trabaja en el mismo lugar como mesero y además tiene establecido un negocio de abarrotes desde hace 2 años donde lo trabaja el por las mañanas y por la tarde esta encargada una hermana. El esta tramitando este crédito para la ampliación del local del negocio ya que desea invertir en más mercancía pero falta mas espacio.
texts.en:
Joel Alberto M. is young in age but very responsible and with great vision to get ahead in life. He lives with his mtoher, who works as a cook in a restaurant; he works in the same restaurant as a waiter. In addition, he has had a grocery store for the last two years where he works during the mornings; his sister looks after the store in the afternoons. He is negotiating funding to enlarge the store because he'd like to stock more products but lacks space to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his business's locale.

loans.name: Zarb Ali Group

texts.en:
This pictured group's name is 'Zarb A.' group, and it is made up of two members. They would like to receive a group loan of 20000 Afghani.

Abdull Hakim, 35, is the group leader. He is married with 7 children. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, and he has a metal-working shop in the same area as his house. With this loan he wants to enlarge his shop and buy some tools for his metal working. He is the only one who has to manage to support the household and the family members.

The second member of 'Zarb A.' group is Shafiqa who wants to use her loan to purchase a new sewing machine and cloth for her tailoring business. They are both happy that their businesses can progress because of this loan process of Kiva's.

loans.use: to buy necessary things for their businesses

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
El Señor José David Pavón López, labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene un   hijo a su cargo y este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado once  créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido once créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra dos ventanas con su marco para el frente se su casa de habitación ya que esta solo contaban con las verjas.

Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

José David dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. José David Pavón López works as a janitor in the Eastern Market in Managua. He has one school-aged son under his care and is married. He has received eleven loans throuh CEPRODEL in the past eight years. In this time he invested eleven loans in the improvement of their home, thanks to the loans provided by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy two windows with frames for the front of his house since it now only has bars. He is doing this with the goal of providing greater security and quality of life for his children. José David said that the loans provided to him have been for home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Yenny María

texts.es:
Yenny María García Barreto tiene un taller de modistería y produce mochilas en crochet en el municipio de San Jacinto-departamento de Bolívar, población de artesanos y agricultores, donde los vecinos son muy solidarios. Está casada y tiene un hijo de diez años; su esposo es enfermero   titulado por el SENA y ha trabajado en hospitales, aunque en estos momentos  no ejerce su profesión y se dedica al servicio de mototaxi con su propia moto. Yenny solicita un crédito de $1.500.000 que lo invertirá en la compra de telas para hacer uniformes escolares y aprovechar  la entrada a los colegios; también piensa usar el crédito para hacer mantenimientos necesarios a sus máquinas y para comprar hilo para la elaboración de mochilas.
A pesar de sus 29 años, Yenny tiene este taller desde los 17 años: inicialmente trabajaba con una amiga con la cual aprendió su oficio, luego realizó cursos de modistería y se capacitó en el SENA en bordado a mano. Se vinculó a la Fundación en el 2008 y desde entonces ha ampliado el negocio y en la actualidad  tiene otra máquina y presta un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su forma de trabajar ha mejorado durante esta temporada y se siente muy agradecida de los créditos otorgados por la Fundación, aunque todavía hay momentos difíciles: en temporadas de ventas disminuidas cuando los ingresos familiares bajan, le toca trabajar en un taller de modistería donde la pagan por producción; o cuando en una ocasión se accidentó su esposo y los gastos del hogar los tuvo que asumir ella con las utilidades de su negocio. Yenny y su esposo aún no tienen casa propia, pero sí tienen un lote, el cual compraron con sus ahorros y una de sus  metas es tener una casa de su propiedad con local incluído para adecuar allí su taller. Es más, sueña con aumentar las ventas, estudiar el diseño de moda y tener otro hijo.
texts.en:
Yenny Maria G. Barreto runs a textile shop where she makes crochet backpacks in the city of San Jacinto, Bolivar, a population full of artisans and farmers where neighbors are very unified. She is married with a 10 year old son; her husband is a SENA nurse and has worked in hospitals; however, currently he is not working in the medical field and is running a moto-taxi service with his own vehicle. Yenny is requesting a loan of $800 which she will invest in the purchase of cloth to make school uniforms and take advantage of kids entering school; she will also use it to perform maintenance on her sewing machines and to buy thread to make her backpacks. In spite of being only 29 years old, Yenny has worked in her shop since she was 17. Initially she worked with a friend who taught her the job, but later she took sewing classes and trained in the SENA how to embroider. She enrolled in the Foundation in 2008 and has grown her business; she has another sewing machine and offers great customer service. Her work has improved and she is very grateful for the loans she has received from the Foundation. Even though she still has difficult moments when sales drop and her family income drops, luckily she works in a shop where she is paid by her own production. Additionally, once when her husband was in an accident and she had to assume all household expenses, she was able to do it through her business. Yenny and her husband don't own their home but they do own a piece of land which they purchased with their savings. One of their goals is to build their own home and place her workshop in it. She also dreams of increasing her sales, studying fashion and having another child.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread for embroidery on backpacks, cloth for school uniforms, and machine maintenance

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa S. lives in Tengheh town in Freetown with her husband and 4 children. She has 2 dependents.  She has obtained 4 previous loans from LAPO,SL. Hawa S. is a very devoted business woman and hard working.
With her previous loan she purchased more rice, oil, flower, sugar, onions, groundnuts, and salt for sale. She testifies that "the profit from the loans has been a great help for me I use it to educate my children and build a house”.
She would indeed be grateful to kiva lenders because she envisages that with this larger loan her aspirations will come through.

With this loan of Le 1,500,000, Hawa S. will expand her business by purchasing oil, rice, flower, sugar and salt. This will enable her dream fulfill of having a large retail shop in Freetown.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, flower, sugar, onoins, groundnuts and salt

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es: Don Orlando de Jesús R. Hernández, vive en San Ramón  una comunidad que queda a 20 km de Condega, el tiene una propiedad donde se dedica a las actividades de trabajo de campo como es la agricultura y la ganadería como pequeño productor. Este cliente utilizara el crédito para la compra de 3 terneros para desarrollarlos y después venderlos, con esto él quiere una vez que estos terneros adquieran un mayor peso después venderlos y tener otro ingreso ya que el solo tiene ingresos en épocas de invierno provenientes de la cosecha de granos básicos, este cliente inicio su actividad de trabajo sembrando únicamente granos básicos frijol y maíz con la venta de estos granos el comenzó comprando un torete para desarrollo y una vez este adquirió un mayor peso la vendió a un mejor precio del que lo adquirió. Don Orlando se dedica a esta actividad de trabajo agropecuario cultiva granos básicos frijol y maíz en épocas de invierno y en tiempo de verano el compra y vende ganado para tener otro ingreso. Este cliente  todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo agrícola y ahora a este rubro o sector ganadero como pequeño productor. Con este crédito el espera tener una forma de trabajo todo el año y ala ves tener otra alternativa que le genere ingresos en épocas de verano donde él no tiene ingresos provenientes de la cosecha, Don Orlando con estos financiamientos ha venido mejorando  su actividad de trabajo, esto le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos que le permiten sufragar los gastos de su familia y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando de Jesús R. Hernández lives in San Ramón, a community located 20 kilometers from Condega. He has a property where he does field work like farming. He also raises some livestock. He will use the loan to buy three calves to raise and later sell. Once the calves have gained weight, he sells them to get another income. His only income comes in the winter season from the harvest of basic grains. He started this work activity by only planting beans and corn. When he sold these grains he bought a small bull to raise. Once it gained weight, he sold it for a higher price than he had paid for it. Orlando works by cultivating beans and corn in the winter time. In the summer, he buys livestock to sell for another income. He has always worked in farming. He now also works as a small producer of livestock. He hopes that with this loan he will have a way to work year round. At the same time, he will have an alternative way to generate income in the summer. That is when he does not have income from the harvest. Orlando has been improving his work with the loans. The loan has allowed him to improve his income. It also allows him to pay family expenses and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy three calves

loans.name: Nyabugando Tukwatanise, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
T. Africana is a reserved 40-year-old married father of three children. He has been operating his butchery business from Nyabugando Trading Centre in Ntungamo district for over fifteen years. He buys cows and goats which he slaughters and gets meat ready for selling.

Africana’s business has grown to the extent that he has been able to educate all three of his children. He reveals he makes, in a month, close to 200,000 shillings. He also makes some additional income through selling firewood. His future plans are to expand his business by opening up another branch.

loans.use: To buy good quality animals for beef

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Belen.
Carmen es soltera, tiene 36 años y 5 hijos, Carmen vende comida de manera ambulatoria en el camal de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de platos, ollas.
Carmen sueña con tener una casa propia y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Belen community bank. Carmen is single, 36 and has 5 children. She sells food as a street vendor at the city slaughterhouse. She does this activity every day. Carmen needs a loan of 1,500 soles to invest in the purchase of dishes and pots. Carmen dreams of having her own house and for her children to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dishes and pots.

loans.name: Success To One Group

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Success to One. Beatrice is 49 years old and married. She has two children, ages 7 and 12. She did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For 24 years, Beatrice has been selling frozen meat on a table at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She renders good service to her customers, which keeps them returning. However, she faces problems with insufficient funds to do business.

Beatrice started her business with funds she got from her friends in her community. She plans to use her 6,000-LRD portion of this 30,000-LRD group loan to buy more frozen meat in order to increase her market size. Her goal is to build a shop for the betterment of her family

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Beatrice is holding the sign. And Hannah is inset at the lower left because her face was obscured in the original group photo, therefore her photo from her loan application form  had to be taken.

loans.use: To buy more frozen meat in order to increase her market size

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Hok M. is a 38-year-old married woman and mother. She works sewing clothes for the garment industry and gets a salary of US$120 a month, providing her income to manage her family’s daily expenses. She is married with two young children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is Mr. Eum Nhor, age 31, and he works in the construction sector.

This is the second loan Hok M. has requested. She always faces difficulty with traveling needs because she doesn’t own a vehicle. Therefore, she is taking out this loan to buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her family's transportation needs

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El socio Nicanor, tiene 67 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la carpintería. Su negocio está ubicado en Luis Vallejo Santoni en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. El requiere el préstamo para comprar más madera. El pertenece al banco comunal “Kantu” de la Asociación Arariwa y está varios años prestándose créditos de la Asociación, él se considera una persona responsable y desea continuar participando en el banco comunal porque le gusta ahorrar.   

Nicanor se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nicanor is 67 years old, married, and has two children. His main business activity is carpentry. He has a business located in Luis Vallejo Santoni in the district of Santiago, province of Cusco. Nicanor needs a loan to buy more wood. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu” and has received loans from Asociación Arariwa for several years. Nicanor is considered to be a responsible person and hopes to continue participating in his Communal Bank because he enjoys saving.

Nicanor is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided, so he promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Yencala Leon, un area rural que pertenece al distrito de Lambayeque se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y venta de cerdos y aves. El cría los animales para luego sacrificarlos y vender su carne entre los vecinos de la zona. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para su comunidad ya que provee de carne a sus vecinos que no pueden ir hasta el mercado para adquirirla porque la zona en donde viven se encuentra alejada del centro de la ciudad.

Andrés ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva, su primer préstamo fue utilizado en la compra de más animales con los cuales pudo ampliar sus ventas, actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor manera, por ello ha solicitado nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Andrés sigue trabajando para brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida, en la zona. sus vecinos y conocidos le siguen teniendo mucha estima y le consideran alguien confiable
texts.en:
Andres, 30, is single and lives with his parents in Yencala Leon, a rural area that is part of the Lambayeque district some 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has operated a business raising and selling pigs and poultry for six years. He raises the animals, slaughters them and sells the meat to local people. The business is important to the community because it supplies meat to locals who would otherwise have to go to a market in the town which lies well away from the community. Andres has worked with Kiva before. He used his first loan to buy more animals so that he could increase his sales. He now wants to expand the business further by buying a balanced feed that will ensure his animals develop in the best way. He is applying for a 2,000-soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the business. Andres continues to work to provide his parents with a better quality of life. His neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high regard and consider him to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for pig and poultry business.

loans.name: Tuvshinbayar

texts.en:
Tuvshinbayar D. is 36 years old and lives with his parents and siblings in the Huvsgul province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His family lost all their cattle stock in a snow disaster in 2000 and Tuvshinbayar purchased a car with all his family capital in order to operate a transportation business. 

His business is very important to him and his family as the main source of family income. The continued growth of his business enabled him to purchase a plot of land, where the family lives now, and helped him to improve their quality of life. 

Tuvshinbayar works hard and is an energetic, modest and easy-going person. He says, “I hope to operate the business stable so that I can continue to provide for my brother's education.”

He is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase car-repairing materials.

loans.use: To purchase car-repairing materials

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna V. is from the village of Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Erna is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erna has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erna is requesting a new loan of 38000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Erna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gilla

texts.en: Gilla B. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Rizal, Brgy. Poblacion, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Her husband Ignacio B., who is 50 years old, works as a maintenance man to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 22 and 23 years old. Gilla joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gilla has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she could continue to save up for the future of her children and to buy more goods for her general store. Gilla B. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Manuel; el tiene 57 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio trabaja como docente en el colegio llamado Inca Garcilaso de la Vega, también se dedica a la venta de libros educativos que vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes colegios de la ciudad del Cusco, el socio quiere tener una librería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar libros al por mayor.  

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Manuel is a member of the Communal Bank “Qorimankacha”, which is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 57 years old, married, and has two children. Manuel is a teacher at the Inca Garcilasco de la Vega School and also sells educational books as an independent dealer to different schools in the city of Cusco. He also manages a bookstore, so he is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of books.

Manuel is grateful to everyone who made this dream possible, so he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase books

loans.name: Noel Nestor

texts.fr:
Jeune monsieur de 48 ans, marie et pere de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 21 ans,il commence ce commerce en 2002 quand il perd son travail lors de la faillite de lusine ou il travaillait.

Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente, ses clients sont les entrepreneurs, les fonctionnaires qui sont entrain de construire des maisons.
En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours
Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer en achetant des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des sanitaires,des robinets, des ^pointes de toute taille..
A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise au Cameroun, Nigeria et Dubai 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
This young gentleman, aged 48, is married and a father with four children, whose are from 5 to 21 years old. He started this business in 2002 when he lost his job, as the factory in which he worked had failed. To alleviate the situation and to support his family, he embarked on a hardware business. He has several sales strategies. His customer base includes entrepreneurs and civil servants who are building houses. On average, he has sales of about 5,000 to 50,000 francs a day. With the loan that he plans on receiving, he is going to stock up by buying electrical switches, fuses, sanitary items, faucets, and nails of any size. In the future, he is thinking of selling in bulk. And with his savings, he thinks he will save a lot of money, open a big store, and go buy merchandise in Cameroon, Nigeria, and Dubai. A very serious man, he is also thinking about sending his children to major schools for their training.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying equipment and supplies for electricity, construction, plumbing, sanitation

loans.name: Teofila's Group

texts.en:
Teofila G. is from the village of Dapacan Alto Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Teofila is the leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the other person's loan if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Daffodils.

Teofila is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Teofila owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as noodles, sugar, canneds goods, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Teofila has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teofila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Teofila's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help its Field Partners continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zeenat's Group

texts.en:
Zeenat has been living with her family in Jaranwala, Pakistan for the last 14 years. Jaranwala city is located in Punjab province and is famous for its agricultural industry.  She is married to M. A. and has 5 sons. Her husband has a business selling popcorn. He operates his business from a four-wheeled cart and sells popcorn by going to different areas of the city.

All of her sons remain uneducated because Zeenat and her husband don't have the financial resources which allow them to send their kids to school and bear their education expenses. Her eldest son started working at an early age. He learned the art of sewing from Zeenat and now he runs a tailoring shop in the market and offers his tailoring services to his customers.

Zeenat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new popcorn making machine which will make better quality popcorn and earn him more income.  She is hopeful that her husband will have good experiences in his job and get good benefits from his business after this loan investment.

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In this photo, the lady who holds the book (an Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Zeenat.

loans.use: To buy a popcorn making machine for popcorn selling business

loans.name: Linda Atieno

texts.en:
Linda Atieno O. has been in the salon business and at the same time sells cosmetics [beauty products] to her customers, who have much confidence in her work. The business has lasted for four years and she earns a profit margin of 7,000 Kshs per month. The business location is at Huruma estate in the Nairobi capital city.  Most of her customers live in the area.

She learned about KADET LTD through a friend and she is applying for her first loan of 15,000 KSH to purchase more beauty products worth 10,000 KSH and a hair dryer worth 5,000 KSH.  The anticipated profit will be used to open another outlet in the surrounding area.

Linda hopes to grow her business and run more stable salons and to sell better beauty products in Huruma. She is a single woman who was separated from her husband and she is 30 years old.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products and buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Delia Rosario

texts.es:
Delia de 38 años, tiene una pequeña papelería, Vive con su esposo y su hija en una zona  caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Escogió tener una papelería porque le gusta la actividad de atender a clientes y obtener un beneficio. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar diversa papelería e incremento su papelería. En la actualidad tiene trabaja de lunes a domingo vendiendo cuadernos a $ 1.00, plumas, lápices, papelería, perfumes, juguetes etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, papelería y ropa para su papelería. En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y comprar un camión para distribuir la papelería.
texts.en:
38-year-old Delia has a small stationary store. She lives with her husband and her daughter in an area called suburb of Guayaquil that is characterized by the fact that the majority of the inhabitants are merchants.

She chose to have a paper store because she likes attending to customers and making a profit. Little by little, with effort, she was able to buy diverse stationary and increase the size of her business. Currently, she works from Monday to Sunday selling notebooks for $1.00, pens, pencils, stationary, perfume, toys etc.

With the loan, she wants to buy notebooks, pens, stationary and clothing for her paper store. In the future, she wants to continue this business and to buy a truck to distribute the stationary.

loans.use: To buy accesories and stationary

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom C. is 47 years old and her husband, Mr. Sophal Pheng, is 51 years old.  They have been married since 1979 and have seven children:  two sons and five daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, three are in school, one is a garment factory worker, and one is a motorbike repairman. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mr. Sophal Pheng is a mechanic. 

The main source of income is from her daughter and husband’s salaries. Sreymom stays at home and does housework. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle for children to ride to school

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana M. is 46 years old.  He is from the Sanjwero area in Homa-bay county. He is married to Doneta and they have three children between the ages of 5 and 14.

Johana has a business selling livestock, especially goats and cows. He has been in this business for the past ten years and has managed to create a huge clientele through the years. Johanna is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more goats to sell during the upcoming festive month of December. His monthly income is Kshs 30,000.

His desire is to sell cattle not only in Homa-bay but in the entire Nyanza region.

loans.use: Buy goats to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Mrs. Simon T. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Nhel, live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1979 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. 

Simon is a rice farmer. Her husband is a truck driver; he purchases and hauls dirt to sell to villagers for leveling their house foundations. Simon is asking for a loan of $500 to expand her husband's business of purchasing and hauling dirt to sell for leveling house foundations.

loans.use: To expand business of selling dirt for leveling house foundations

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
52-year-old Roseminda is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 2 children. She plants and harvests rice crops for a living. She also has a small pineapple farm. She sells her harvest to the market. Aside from that, she also raises ducks and turkeys. Roseminda works hard to provide her family better living conditions.

Roseminda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roseminda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Roseminda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Melania es una pequeña comerciante, madre de dos hijas, iniciando con la costura para apoyar a su familia, siendo su esposo albañil.
Con ahorros de la costura y apoyo económico de su esposo logra invertir en ropa nueva y cosmético lo que viene a mejorar  con los financiamientos que comienza hacer en Afodenic, siendo su once avo crédito. En donde le ha permitido tener mejores utilidades, captación de clientes,  así como las mejoras a su vivienda.
Hoy desea hacer dos cuartos ya que su casa es pequeña, lo que espera dar a sus hijos mejor comodidad de espacio.  Teniendo material comprado como hierro para las vigas, bloques y que comprara más para comenzar a construir.
texts.en:
Melania is a small businesswoman and the mother of two daughters. She started a sewing business in order to help her husband who works as a mason. With the savings from her sewing business and financial support from her husband, Melania was able to invest in new clothing and cosmetics. She approached AFODENIC to obtain financing for making improvements and now she is on her eleventh loan. The loans have enabled her to improve her earnings, attract more customers, as well as make improvements to her home.

Today she wants to add two rooms to her small house in hopes of providing her children with a more comfortable space. She has already bought iron beams and blocks, but she needs to buy more materials to begin the construction.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to build two rooms for her children

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad P. is from Mayor's Village, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and is now a widow. She is blessed with two children. Trinidad is presently engaged in buying and selling ready-to-wear items and cosmetics. She has been engaged in this business for two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month.
In 2008, Trinidad joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,800 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and to save for future use, especially for future business expansion.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Tudela-Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Mr. Ban Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ban is a village bank leader who has been selected by the twelve people who make up a village bank loan.   Each person will use his/her portion for different purposes to improve their family's standard of living. 

Ban and his wife are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land, where they grow both rice and vegetables to sell.  Besides farming, he is a chef.   He wants to start a new business, but his savings are not enough to support his family.   Ban is asking for a loan to add to his savings to buy a cow. He has children who are married who live on their own.  He has a grandchild living with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rosemelia

texts.en: Rosemelia is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: trucking for hire, pig fattening and chainsaw businesses. She lives in Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 40,000. Rosemelia is borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can purchase spare parts to maintain her truck in good running condition.  This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosemelia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her truck

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old, married, and has five children, the oldest of whom is 11 years old. Jessica's husband is a seaweed farmer and also works as a carpenter.
Jessica is a seaweed farmer. She has been in this kind of business for five years. She works hard to support her family. Jessica plans to use her loan to purchase straw, rope and other materials for seaweed farming. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase straw, rope and other materials for seaweed farming

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 32 años, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, es una mujer muy rabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Julián de 35 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor bienestar. El cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca es la actividad que realiza diariamente Ana, junto con la ayuda de su pareja, quien le ha enseñado todo sobre esta actividad. Ambos han logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas; lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy cotizados en los mercados de la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, desde la chacra hasta los secaderos; el secado de los productos es la última etapa que realiza Ana antes de llevar ha comercializarlos. Ana solicita el crédito para renovar la madera vieja de su vivienda por madera nueva. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras y poder sembrar más productos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que el crédito le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo. Se siente muy contenta con la creación del banco comunal en su pueblo, por lo cual participará en los futuros créditos que la institución le facilitará. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará madera aserrada para cercar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old and originally from the city of Santa Rosa. She is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house alongside her partner Julian, aged 35, and their 3 dear children, to whom she wants to provide a greater quality of life. Every day she works in the cultivation of cocoa, coffee and coca leaves  with the help of her partner, who has taught her everything about this activity. Jointly they have managed to achieve very productive lands, which means that their crops are high quality and sought-after in the markets of the city of San Francisco, where she gets the best prices for her products.  

What she likes the most about her job is looking after her crops and she does so with great care. She has been doing it for 10 years and she thinks that the most difficult thing is to transport her products from the farm to the dryers; drying the products is the last stage Ana takes prior to selling them. 

Ana is requesting the loan to replace the old wood surrounding her home for new wood. In future she would like to buy more land and plant more produce. This is her first loan with MFP and she says that the loan will help greatly with her work. She is very happy with the creation of community bank in her village, and she plans to participate in future loans granted by the institution. With the 1,000 soles requested she will buy wood panels to enclose the walls of her house.

loans.use: to buy wood to enclose the walls of her home.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 68 years old and married with 8 children.

Rosita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Rosita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling nipa (palm leaves).

Rosita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling home products such as cutlery and plates. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Halima faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding it in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase additional cutlery and plates for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of the loan products.

loans.use: To purchase cutlery and plates for resale.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 46 and married with five children. The oldest is 17. Her husband works as a farmer. Analiza is also a farmer. She and her husband till a plot of land in San Jose, Agusan del sur. They have been growing rice for 9 years. Analiza has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes to be able to have her children finish schooling.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gerogina Guadalupe

texts.es: Georgina se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de tricitaxi. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo y humildad. Inicio este medio de vida gracias por su esposo ya que juntos han pasado muchos momentos difíciles. Todos los días tiene que realizar las tareas del hogar y esperar a la persona que se encarga de realizar este trabajo todos los días. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, frenos, tapizar asientos y comprar lona y otros productos para proteger a sus clientes del sol.
texts.en: Georgina offers a cycle rickshaw service.  She has owned this business for three years, with a lot of hard work and humility.  She started out in this line of work thanks to her husband.  Together they have been through a lot of difficult times.  Every day, Georgina has to carry out her household chores and wait for the person who is in charge of carrying out this work every day.  Georgina is requesting a loan to buy tires and brakes.  She will also have the seats of her vehicle upholstered and buy a canopy and other products to protect her customers from the sun.

loans.use: to buy tires, brakes and a canopy, and to upholster the seats of her vehicle

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria  es una mujer de 49 años muy emprendedora que vive en la Playa muy cerca al mar , con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 6 y 17 años . Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, refrescos y bebidas, además aprovecha su clientela para ofrecer otros productos como calzado y ropa. Su experiencia de negocio la inició en el año 1992 vendiendo almuerzos en el municipio de Salgar frente al mar y también algunas mercancías en pequeñas cantidades, posteriormente como se mudó a la Playa donde ahora vive con su cónyuge  y  debió trasladar su negocio a este sitio, allí ha logrado fortalecerlo y está tan entusiasmada que hace todos sus esfuerzos por hacerlo crecer, pero necesita un capital de trabajo adicional para lograrlo.  Sus clientes la buscan porque maneja una buena sazón en la preparación de sus comidas, En su negocio la ayuda su esposo y tiene una  empleada que la ayuda en la cocina. Sus principales clientes son los cobradores, conductores de buses, y mucha gente que pasa por ese lugar y tienen negocios con la comunidad. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará cervezas en mayor volumen e insumos para la preparación de sus almuerzos, asi como también invertirá en mercancías solicitadas por sus clientes como calzado y bolsos. Su mayor sueño es lograr una educación de calidad para sus hijos, hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda y aumentar su bienestar familiar. Mientras esto ocurre, Maria se esmera para lograrlo trabajando persistentemente con una rentabilidad no menor del  44, 8% que planea aumentar gradualmente con el apoyo de capital de trabajo como el que le hace la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.
