texts.en: Maria is a 49-year old woman who is highly enterprising and she lives in La Playa, very close to the ocean, together with her common-law partner and their two children, aged 6, and 17. She sells prepared foods, soft drinks, and alcoholic drinks. She also offers her clientele other products such as shoes and clothing. Her business experience started in 1992 with the sale of lunch foods in the municipality of Salgar, on the ocean's coast, and some other merchandise. Later she moved to La Playa, where she still lives today with her common-law partner, and she relocated her business to this location. There she has managed to strengthen it and she is so keen that all of her efforts are invested towards its development. But she needs working capital to achieve her goal. Her clients seek her out for the delicious recipes she uses in preparing her foods. Her husband helps her with the business and she has an employee who helps in the kitchen. Her primary clients are the fare collectors and bus drivers and the many passers-by that travel to this community with many businesses. Her Kiva loan is the first loan which she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it she will purchase been in larger quantities and ingredients to prepare her lunch foods. She will also invest in merchandise requested by her clients, such as shoes and hand bags. Her greatest dreams are to provide her children with a quality education, to make improvement to her home, and to improve the wellbeing of her family. While this happens, Maria strives to achieve her goal by working persistently to earn a profit of no less than 44.8%. She plans to gradually increase it by acquiring capital funds, such as the one granted by Fundacion Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase beer in larger quantities and ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 36 years old and married to a businessman. They have two children, aged 1 and 6 years old, to whom they hope to provide education to the university level.

Everlyne owns a clothing business at a busy market in Kakamega. She plans to buy a sewing machine so that she can make clothes to resell to the local people. Everlyne hopes to expand her business to a boutique in the future. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
La señora Luz, de 43 años de edad, es originaria de Larreynaga una comarca ubicada en Malpaisillo municipio de León  pero desde hace 20 años vive en la ciudad de León, esta casada, es madre de tres hijos, de oficio comerciante, ella es dueña de una pulpería. Ella inicio en este negocio hace 20 años con un pequeño capital que su esposo le dio, ella recuerda que tan solo tenia una mesa y poco productos que vender pero gracias a sus esfuerzos y deseos de salir adelante su negocio fue prosperando poco a poco . Hoy en día ella tiene 5 vitrinas,5 estantes de madera, venta ropa y mercadería en general, su esposo la sigue apoyando pues el aporta con salario que gana como trabajador en la alcaldía municipal ,su hijo menos la ayuda atender el negocio después de clases.
Requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite productos de consumo diario e invertir en compra de mercadería de ropa para mujer, varón y niños. Ella dice que al surtir su negocio con más productos podrá atraer nuevos clientes y hacer crecer su negocio. En sus planes futuros ella quiere compra unos estantes de aluminio, un freezer, maniquíes con la ganancia ir mejorando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz, 43, is originally from Larreynaga, a county in Malpaisillo, in the municipality of León.  For 20 years she has lived in the city of León.  She is married, the mother of three children and is the owner of a grocery store.  She started up her business 20 years ago with a little capital that her husband gave her.  She remembers that she only had a table and a few products to sell but thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, business gradually became prosperous.  She now has five display cases and five wooden shelves.  She sells clothing and general items.  Her husband continues to give his support by contributing the salary her earns as an employee of the town hall.  Her youngest son helps out with the business after school.

She needs the loan to buy basic food items such as rice, beans, sugar, oil and other daily consumption items.  She also wants to buy women's, men's and children's clothing.  By adding more stock she will be able to attract more customers and increase business.  In the future she would like to add aluminum shelving, a freezer, and mannequins.  With her earnings she plans to carry out home improvements little by litte.

loans.use: To buy basic foods such as rice, beans, sugar, and oil; and merchandise such as women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 20-year-old single man who rents hookas, which are also known as sheesha or waterpipes. They are a single-or multi-stemmed, often glass-based instruments for smoking, in which the smoke is cooled and filtered by passing through water. It comes with special flavors and it's becoming very popular among people in the Middle East. 

Khodor started his business in 2006, and it's improving a lot. He sends the hookas by delivery to homes or businesses as requested. 

His shop is small but is good enough to handle all the preparations for deliveries. 

Khodor is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase the number of hookas he owns, which will increase his income. 

Kkhodor used to work as a car mechanic--he used to be an employee--but he insisted on making his own business with less capital requirements. He's smart about what he's doing and hopes to improve his business more and more, and to get a larger shop to start expecting clients to visit his cafe.

loans.use: To buy more hookas in order to increase his income

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen  de cincuenta y cinco años de edad, habita en su casa con su esposo Roberto de 48 años de edad y su hija de 17 años la cual se encuentra estudiando. Carmen posee una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia, la cual ha logrado mantener activa gracias a su trabajo y dedicación en la misma. Para ella lo más importante son sus clientes razón por la cual siempre trata de atenderlos con una sonrisa y con mucha  amabilidad.  Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer en donde muchas personas la visiten y siempre encuentren lo que buscan es decir poder satisfacer a una mayor demanda. Todo esto con el fin de aumentar su nivel de ventas y de ingresos para poder dar a su familia una realidad diferente. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el objetivo de invertir en la compra de más artículos de tienda como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, detergente, pan dulce, etc. que le permitan lograr su sueño. Tiene plena confianza que logrará buenos resultados que le permitirán accesar a la calidad de vida que ella desea.
texts.en: Carmen, 55, lives with her husband Roberto, 48, and her 17 year old daughter who is in school. Carmen has a small store in her home, which has stayed open thanks to her work and dedication. For her the customers come first, which is why she always tries to take care of them with a smile and a friendly attitude. Her dream is to see her business flourish to where she has a lot of customers and they always find what they are looking for. She would like to be able to satisfy a larger demand in order to increase her sales and income so that she can give her family a different reality. This has motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of items for her store like oil, rice, beans, sugar, snacks, detergent, sweet rolls, etc that will help her achieve her dream. She has full confidence that she will get good results that will allow her to reach the quality of life that she wants.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, sugar, snacks, detergent, sweet rolls, etc.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Boniface is 59 years old.  He is married to Emily and they have four children.  He runs a retail shop.  He has been loaned KES 80,000.  This is his sixth loan from KADET LTD.  He plans to use it to buy more stock of cooking fat, flour, eggs, etc.  He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.  He hopes to expand his business to a wholesale shop

loans.use: buy more cooking fat, flour, eggs

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de ropa y medicina, vive con su esposo y un hijo, sus padres también dependen de ella, estos negocios le ayudan para cubrir de las ganancias las necesidades del hogar.
Ella invertirá un préstamo en blusas, ropa interior, ropa de niños y además comprar medicamentos como antibióticos, analgésicos, vitaminas para fortalecer el negocio, ella vende todos los días en lugares aledaños.
La aspiración de María es tener sus negocios bien fortalecidos, ganar muchos clientes, para comercializar y tener ganancias para la alimentación del hogar.
texts.en:
María sells clothes and medicine.  She lives with her husband and her child.  Her parents are also dependent upon her.  The income from these businesses helps her to cover the household necessities.

She will use the loan to buy blouses, underwear, and children’s clothes.  She will also buy medicine like antibiotics, analgesics, and vitamins in order to strengthen her business.  She sells every day in surrounding areas.

María’s goal is to increase her businesses and to gain a lot of customers.  She wants this in order to sell and have income to feed her household.

loans.use: to buy underwear and children's clothes.

loans.name: Na'eema

texts.en: Na'eema is a 49-year-old woman (Na'eema is a conservative woman, so her son, Ashraf, is in the photograph). She is married and has four sons and one daughter. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary, and two of her sons are municipality employees with decent salaries. Na'eema has a store for selling agriculture tools and supplies. She wants to purchase more of these tools and supplies to sell, to increase her income and share with her family to cover their living expenses. Na'eema hasn't enough money to pay, so she needs to take out a loan from FATEN. When Na'eema gets the loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for a large number of farm tools and supplies. This will increase her income and offer better living conditions for her family. About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing agriculture tools and supplies.

loans.name: Monika

texts.ru:
Моника решила воспользоваться кредитом, так как решила закупить больше товара за один раз.
Она приобрела женские спортивные костюмы, штаны на осень и зиму, кофточки теплые, женскую обувь на осень, а также 2 свадебных платья (под заказ).
Благодаря прошлому кредиту у Моники выросло количество товара, однако слишком много осталась у нее  летней одежды, которую продавать сейчас она уже не может. Таким образом часть прибыли осталась в товаре до следующего сезона.
Моника надеется, что этот зимний сезон будет лучше, чем летний, что она сможет получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en: Monika decided to take out a loan because she decided to purchase more merchandise at once. She bought women's sports suites and pants for the autumn and winter, as well as cardigans, women's shoes for the fall and two wedding gowns (custom ordered). Thanks to the previous loan Monika's inventory has grown, but a lot of the merchandise from the summer is still left which she cannot sell right now. This way partial profit is locked in the merchandise until the next season. Monika hopes that this winter season will be better than the summer one and she will be able to get additional profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase warm clothing for resale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
She is a woman with courage and the mother of five children. Leticia is 56 years of age and already a widow. Her husband died two years ago, but Leticia did not lose her hopes to live happy. Her children are her inspiration to move on and continue to live.

With the help of her children, at her age, Leticia can still manage her rice farming business well. She dreams of having her own savings. She doesn’t want to rely only on her children, because someday her children will be having their own families. 

Leticia’s earnings from each crop was not enough to sustain the needs of her farm for the next crop. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP27,000 to buy farm supplies like rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that she will use in rice farming. The loan will be a big help toward enabling her to provide the farm supplies she needs. She wishes to gain a higher income to obtain her desires.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like rice seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that will be used in rice farming.

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Khoeun is 44 years old with five children. She is a farmer, and she also raises ducks and chickens. Sometimes, she works as a construction worker with her children for additional income. Her youngest child is still in school. Khoeun has been a farmer for 20 years. This is her first loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to use for rice cultivation and harvest and also to buy feed for her ducks and chickens. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and to feed her ducks and chickens to be healthy and fat to earn more income to feed her family. She hopes to build some savings and also to keep her youngest kid in school.

loans.use: To cultivate and harvest rice paddies and also to buy feed for ducks and chickens.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Honduras! Le presento Cristobal. El señor Cristobal tiene 30 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Monte Verde en el departamento Cortes.  Lleva 5 años de casado con su esposa Ericka, la cual es ama de casa y cuida a sus dos hijos de 3 años y 6 meses de edad. Cristobal gana el único fuente de ingresos de la familia. 

Don Cristobal se dedica a la pesca. Por los últimos 15 años Cristobal ha pescado en el lago Yojoa. Pesca el lunes, martes y miércoles de las 6 de la mañana a las 5 de la tarde. Cristobal vende su pescado a comerciantes que tienen puestos de pescado junto al lago. El lago es muy pintoresco y está rodeado por montañas. En la orilla del lago hay muchos restaurantes donde venden pescado frito. Se dice que es el pescado más rico de Honduras. 

Solicitó un crédito anterior con ODEF de L5000 y ahora cuenta con un poco más equipo y mobiliario para la pesca. Cristobal ha solicitado este crédito de L10,000 para reparar su lancha y comprar equipo. Espera generar más ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares. En el futuro, Cristobal desea poner un puesto para la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Greetings from Honduras! This is Cristobal. He is 30 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Monte Verde in the Department of Cortes. He has been married for five years to his wife Ericka, who is a homemaker and takes care of their two children (ages 3 and 6 months). Cristobal is the only breadwinner in the family.

Don Cristobal is a fisherman. For the past 15 years, he has been fishing on Lake Yojoa. He goes fishing on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays from 6am to 5pm. Cristobal sells his fish to merchants who have vending posts next to the lake. The lake is very picturesque and surrounded by mountains. On the shore of the lake, there are many restaurants that serve fried fish. The fish from this lake is known for being the most flavorful in Honduras.

Cristobal requested 5000 HNL in his previous loan from ODEF. Now he wants to acquire a little more equipment and amenities for his fishing business. Cristobal is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that he can repair his boat and purchase equipment. He hopes to generate more income so that he can cover the family expenses. In the future, Cristobal wants to open a stand where he can sell food.

loans.use: to repair his boat and to buy equipment.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de diciembre es de la ciudad de Lambaré, está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de un barrio muy humilde de esa ciudad. Ellas son muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras, ya que prefieren trabajar de sol a sol para darle lo mejor a sus familias en vez de hacer cosas malas, de las que tengan que avergonzarse.
Emilda es una de esas mujeres admirables, ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de leche desde hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Comenta que gracias a la buena calidad de su producto ahora ya es conocida por todo el barrio. Ella desea salir adelante y seguir ayudando a su familia, es por ello de su sacrificio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche en cantidad, con lo cual podrá surtirse para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Realmente esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que le da la fundación y kiva.
texts.en:
The Group, The 8th of December, is from the city Lambaré. It is composed of 17 women, all of them friends and neighbors of a humble neighborhood of that city. They make sacrifices and are very hardworking as they prefer to work from dawn until dusk in order to provide the best for their families instead of doing bad things that they would have to be ashamed of. 
Emilda is one of these admirable women. She says that she sells milk for a living. Since she has been doing this for some time, she has a well formed clientele. She says that thanks to the good quality of her product, she is now known by everyone in the neighborhood. She wants to move forward and continue helping her family, the reason for her sacrifice.
She is requesting a loan to buy milk in bulk, with which she will be able to stock up in order to meet the demands of her clients. She is truly very thankful for this opportunity that the foundation and Kiva is giving her.

loans.use: To buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 53-year-old farmer. He has been farming since 2001. He does mixed farming. He mainly rears dairy cows and grows maize, beans and vegetables. The climate of his area has favored his business. He also has grown his business, because he has been trained on business management skills.

He hopes to add cows to his farm for more milk production.  He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seedlings and animal feed.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread and dyes.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz   tiene 32 años es soltera, vive con los hijos  de 17, 11 y 7 años. Vive en el Recinto San Temistocles en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Maria Luz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Maria Luz is 32 years old, single, and lives with her children (ages 17, 11, and 7) in the neighborhood of San Temistocles in the canton of Ventanas.

The Communal Bank “Narcisa de Jesus” is located in the neighborhood of San Temistocles, which is in the canton of Ventanas. This group consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Maria Luz is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for three years. She buys her supplies in Ventanas and sells her products at the market in the same place. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice. This will be a great help with increasing her income for the consumer needs of her family and for investment. Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house.

In her free time, Maria Luz enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 26 años. Convive con Henry con quién tiene 5 hijos de 7, 6, 4, 2 años y un pequeño de 2 meses de nacido. Ella y su familia viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo, en el distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Doris es una mujer experta en la siembra de café. En su parcela y media de terrenos de cultivo solo siembra los granos tan solicitados y comprados en su zona. 
Ella y Henry se dedican ala campo y destinan su tiempo en labores de la casa, del campo y la atención de sus hijos.  Doris ya está restablecida de su último parto y con la valentía y fuerza que la caracteriza cogió las herramientas de trabajo para cuidar su café.
“La cosecha es buena en mayo y junio por que el precio del café sube hasta 14 soles la lata, a veces vendemos por sacos de 60 o 70 kilos”, comenta. Añadiendo que no siempre los compradores suben hasta su localidad para adquirir su producto. Muchas veces tiene que invertir en el traslado de su cosecha hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki.
Ella espera que su familia se desarrolle en todos los ámbitos. Para ello seguirá trabajando para darles a sus hijos la calidad de vida necesaria para que vivan cómodos y no les falte nada. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Doris obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo”, del que se muestra esperanzada.
Con el dinero podrá pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus tierras. La maleza y la mala yerba abundan en sus sembríos por eso, tiene que limpiarlo constantemente. Pagará 30 soles al día por operario.
texts.en:
Doris is 26. She lives with Henry and their five children ages 7, 6, 4, 2, and 2 months. They live in their own home in the native community of San Pablo, in the Pichanaki district, Chanchamayo province. Doris is an expert in coffee growing. On her land, she only sows the crops that are most in demand in the area.
She and Henry divide their time between the fields, housework, and taking care of their children. Doris has already recovered from her last birth, and the courage and strength that so define her have allowed her to keep working, caring for their coffee plantations.
"The harvest is good in May and June because the price of coffee goes up to 14 Soles per unit, and we sometimes sell it by the bag, 60 or 70 kilos," she says. She adds that the buyers do not always go to her community to buy her products. She often has to invest in transporting her harvest to the city of Pichanaki.
She hopes that her family does well in everything. In order to ensure this, she will keep working in order to give her children the necessary quality of life so that they can live comfortably without any lack. This will be Doris' first loan with MFP, and she is excited about it. She is now part of the “Los Norionkis de Alto San Pablo” communal bank, and she has high hopes for it.
With this money, she will be able to pay the labourers whom she will hire to clear their lands. The undergrowth and weeds are abundant, so she has to clear her land constantly. She will pay 30 Soles per day per labourer.

loans.use: to hire labourers.

loans.name: Madona Group

texts.en:
Halima is in her late 30s and is a widow with three children. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from 8am to 10pm and is able to make a good monthly profit.
This will be Halima’s second loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to increase her food stock and has paid back the loan successfully. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more stocks of food. Halima’s dream is to build her own house one day.
Halima will share this loan with her loan group, "Madona", which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of food.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income he earned from subsistence farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted out once he purchases a water pump.

Godfrey is applying for a loan of 11,526 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and he looks forward to establishing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is divorced and has five children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Abena is a successful businesswoman. She sells secondhand clothing in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). As the sole breadwinner in the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. Abena will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of secondhand clothing, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. Abena will use the new profits from her expanded business to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of secondhand clothing to improve overall sales.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 37 years old married and blessed with two children Robinson and Charity.He has been into shop business for six years and earns a monthly income of KES. 15,000.

This is his second loan with Vision Fund Kenya,he intends to pay school fees for his children as he anticipates to expand his business from the expanded business profits.He hopes and dreams of a better future and a happy family.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is the owner of the Rasco Hotel, a renowned hotel within the hospitality industry in Madina, Accra.  Raphael therefore contacted KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION and willingly participated in the TEACH lending program. The hotel lacks an internal communication system which would allow clients to send and receive messages while staying there.  Raphael is planning to install a PABX system in the hotel to address this problem.

loans.use: PABX (Internal Communication)for the Hotel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice wants to buy eight more steers

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. is a 38-year-old mother of 4 children who are attending school and lives with her husband in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She sells fruit at a market and usually makes an average of around $20/day in revenue, while her husband works at a private company as a driver. To increase her inventory and fulfill her clients' needs, Chea S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more fruit to run in her stand. In the future, this couple hopes to have enough money to purchase a car, which they think they  can use to buy and sell rice crops everywhere in the city.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for her inventory

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Mrs. Bola I. is 52 years old and married with 5 children.  She lives in an urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells clothing and needs money to buy more clothes. She has been in this business since 2002

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for sale

loans.name: I Gusti Ketut Sumant

texts.id:
Raising pigs are not only women's business. Many men are also in this occupation. Like is done by Gusti Ketut Sumantri, who since married to Ni Komang Sunistri has been in the pig farming business. Difficulties in finding work forced Sumantri who only finished 9th grade to create his own field of employment. His choice to be pig farmer came from his minimum capital of only Rp500,000 (about US$55). Initially his profit was minimal, only Rp75,000 (about $8)/month from his 2 piogs. This does not stop his hope to expand the business. From his wife support and requirements as head of household who has to raise 2 children, who now go to Grade school, Sumantri is encouranged to add his raised animals. With a loan of Rp 1,500,000 (about $165) from Dinari Sumantri now raise 4 piglets, and 1 mother pig. His profit increased. Because besides raising piglets, Sumantri could sell feedstock to people nearby. In 6 months Sumantri could sell Rp5,000,000 (about $550), with a profit of Rp3,500,000 (about $385)/6 months or Rp550,000 (about $60)/month. From this he supports his daily family needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Memelihara babi bukan saja dilakukan oleh para wanita saja . Tidak sedikit kaum laki-laki juga menekuni usaha ini. Seperti apa yang dilakukan oleh I Gusti Ketut Sumantri yang sejak menikahi Ni Komang Sunistri telah menekuni beternak babi . Sulitnya mencari pekerjaan membuat Sumantri yang hanya lulusan SMP ini , bertekad untuk menciptakan lapangan kerja sendiri. Beternak babi menjadi pilihannya karena dengan pertimbangan biaya yang di miliki sangat minim yaitu Rp 500.000.- Awalnya keuntungan yang di dapat oleh Sumantri sangatlah tipis hanya Rp. 75.000 .- / bulan dari 2 ekor ternak peliharaanya. Tapi hal itu tak memupus harapannya untuk mengembangkan usahanya itu. Dengan dorongan dari istri dan juga tuntutan sebagai kepala keluarga yang harus menanggung 2 orang anaknya yang sekarang sudah duduk di bangku sekolah dasar, Sumantri bertambah semangat untuk menambah ternak peliharaanya . Dengan pinjaman modal dari Dinari Rp 1.500.000.- Sumantri kini memelihara 4 ekor ternak babi penggemukan dan telah mempunyai 1 ekor induk babi. Keuntungan yang di peroleh Sumantri pun kini berlipat ganda . Karena disamping memelihara penggemukan, Sumantri juga telah bisa menyediakan bibit untuk warga disekitarnya. Dalam enam bulan hasil produksi Sumantri sekarang mencapai Rp 5 .000.000.- dengan ke untungan bersih Rp. 3.500.000.- 6 bln atau Rp. 550.000.- / bulan . Dari hasil itulah Sumantri memenuhi semua kebutuhan sehari- hari keluarganya .

loans.use:
To buy feedstock and mother pig

Membeli bibit babi dan induk

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Mrs. Remi J. is 36 years old, married with 4 children and hails from Mushin, Lagos State.  She sells foodstuff and flour.  She has been in business since the year 2001 and is now requesting a loan of $800 to buy more food items and flour to sell.  She has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff & flour

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Mrs. Esther belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Virtuosas” (“Virtuous Women”) and lives in the Calleria district. She is 41 years old, is separated, and has 4 children. Two of her children now live independently, and two still depend greatly on her. Although her children help her out in their free time, she was still not able to make ends meet. With the first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, Esther decided to invest in the purchase and sale of vegetables at retail.

Currently, Esther has a location in market #2 where she sells her products. She rises at dawn to go purchase her products and arrive at her post early to take care of her customers. In the afternoons, she rests and takes care of her family.

With the loan of 1,500 soles, to be repaid over a six month period, she will buy goods such as potatoes, onions, tomatoes, lemons, peppers, carrots, garlic, etc. She is considering opening a store in her house.

Esther feels very good that her business grows, and her income as well. She is glad to be able to contribute toward supporting those most dear to her, and thanks Manuela Ramos for all the support she has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, vive en el Jr. Francia Mz 9 Lt1 del Asentamiento Humano Martha Chavez II del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años de edad, es separada, tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes y dos aún depende mucho de ella, además sus hijos en los ratos libres ayudan mucho a su mamá, pero aún así el ingreso que tiene no alcanza, por ese motivo es que Esther, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la compra y venta de verduras al por menor. Actualmente Esther, tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado Nº 2 donde vende sus productos. Se levanta de madrugada para ir a comprar sus productos y estar temprano en su puesto para atender a sus clientas. En las tardes descansa y atiende a su familia. Con el préstamo de S/. 1.500, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un saco de papa, un saco de cebolla, una caja de tomate, una caja de limón, zapallo, pepino, zanahoria, ajos, etc. Esta pensando poner una bodega en su casa. Esther, se siente muy bien que su negocio crece, su economía también. Se siente muy contenta porque puede ayudar a sus seres más queridos, y da las gracias a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado hasta ahora.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (potato, onion, tomato, lemon, pumpkin, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise for her little cosmetics business

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang S. is 47, and the mother of seven children. She and her husband live in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia, where they work together on the family plot of farmland. They grown rice and a variety of fresh vegetables which they sell on the open-air market, earning a total of $4 in profits each day.

Three of Leang’s children are employed at a garment factory. Leang would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other necessary items to support her business and continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: To  purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticide, and gasoline to supply her blooming cultivation.

loans.name: Anne Melissa

texts.es:
Anne Melissa belongs to the Comunal Bank Las Ucayalinas, located on Avenue Tupac Amaru 170, in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 27 years old, mother of two children, married, and her husband is a motocar driver. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the purchase and sale of soft drinks. Currently her business has grown, as has her income, and now she sells a variety of brands of soft drinks wholesale. She works every day and at the same time she does the domestic labor and takes care of her children. With this loan of 1,200 soles, which will be repaid over 4 months, she will invest in 10 cases of soft drinks, gelatin, ice, and sweets. Anne Melissa is very happy with the progress that she’s made, and now has more self-confidence. She is certain that she will keep working with her communal bank for the good of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Anne Melissa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Ucayalinas, ubicado en la Av. Tupac Amaru 170, del Distrito de Manantay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 27 años es madre de 2 hijos, es casada, su esposo es motocarrista.Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidide invertir en la compra y venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido al igual que sus ingresos, ahora vende gaseosas al por mayor de diferentes marcas, atiende todos los días y paralelo se dedica a las labores domesticas de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de 10 cajas de gaseosas, gelatina, hielo, golosinas. Anne Melissa se siente muy feliz con los logros que ha alcanzado, ahora tiene mas confianza en si misma, y tiene la certeza de seguir trabajando con su banco comunal para el bien de su grupo.

loans.use: Purchase 10 cases of soft drinks, gelatin, ice, etcl.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old and is married with 3 children. Her children are 20, 17 and 15 years old. Rose is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2003. She works from 6am to 7pm at her business each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Noumovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Noumovi K. is 33 years old, married, and the father of two children. In order to earn money to meet the needs of his two children, he is a retailer of electrical products and spare parts in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this third loan from FECECAV, he hopes to strengthen his business with the purchase of new electrical products and spare parts in order to meet the constant demand of his customers and to participate in the development of his community.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Noumovi K. est âgé de 33 ans marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses 2 enfants, il achète et revend le produits d’électricité et les pièces détachées à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, il espère renforcer sa boutique dans l’achat de nouveaux produits d’électricité et de pièces détachées afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse de la population et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: Purchase of new electrical products and spare parts

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 31 years old. She is married and has two children. For the past eight years, she has owned and operated a beauty salon. Elizabeth is a very skillful and talented hair dresser who adds beauty and value to the hair of her many customers and that is her secret. She believes in efficient and effective service; therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomades, shampoos, activators and other products to avoid shortages and poor service. She is a member of the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to access loans and to provide peer pressure, as support and encouragement, to repay loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products such as weavons, pomades, shampoos, activators etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements - change of roof

loans.name: Rahabu

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is twenty-five-year-old Rahabu from Dar es Salaam, who is married and has a toddler. She also takes care of a sixteen-year-old relative who is an orphan. Rahabu owns and, with the help of an employee, runs a small store from which she sells essential grocery items. The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge.

A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

This is Rahabu’s second loan with SELFINA; she has already successfully paid off a loan of US$ 275. This time she is requesting a loan of US$ 525 in order to buy her wares in bulk. She hopes to retail these for a profit.

Rahabu is a perfect example of why microfinance works and why the large majority of clients repay their loans. A lot of people who hear about microfinance (or Kiva.org) for the first time, ask anxiously, “But how do you make sure people pay back? Won’t they just take the money?” The implication is that the clientele who access microfinance (usually 'the poor’) are less trustworthy, efficient or educated than ‘ordinary’ people.

Whether or not this is true is somewhat irrelevant, for a number of reasons. Firstly, most MFIs have due diligence processes in place to assess client risk, as well as measures such as collateral arrangements and group lending (where a defaulted loan is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk. More important than any of these deterrents, however, is an incentive. The incentive clients have to start a business, build a business, and repay their loan so that they can get another and another and another…The incentive is having on-going access to financial services from which they had previously been excluded.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies in bulk for her stall

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes S., a 58-year-old businesswoman is widowed with five children. Among these children, two are still in senior high school. She is a very resourceful salesperson and mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family.

Agnes provides for the household through the sale of used clothing and shoes. Selling of used clothing is a very big market in Ghana as brand-new clothes are too expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore the selling of used clothing has created a market for many women.

Agnes wants to use this loan to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children's future education and also rent a store to sell her goods out of. She is a member of the group called "Nkwa Nsuo" meaning Living Waters. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and shoes

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en: Teyyub M. is 69 years old, he is married and has five children! Teyyub is a hard-working man who is now on pension. He started his business in 1983 as a source of main income in case of unemployment. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance investing in his business, which has been going well and which he would like to continue to grow. Teyyub is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy four calves. He will reinvest the capital to grow his business as he has been doing. With the profit from this loan, he wants to support his children with their education. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing this business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: Teyyub would like to purchase four calves to resell in order to provide for his children's education.

loans.name: Benkadi (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de soeurs et de cousines, ce groupe s’est spécialisé dans le commerce des condiments alimentaires, du charbon de bois, des céréales, des poissons. En plus de ce commerce, elles font également la production du beurre de karité et la préparation de la bouillie de mil, d’haricots etc. Composé de 8 femmes (toutes mariées et ayant en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants), elles vivent dans des foyers polygames dans le village de Ziékorodougou situé à environ 38 km de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Collaborant avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 6 ans, elles sont à leur 11ème cycle de prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe)et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter,  4 sacs de sel, 10  paquets d’aromes, 10kg de cola, 10kg de poissons fumés, 50kg de noix de karité, 2 sacs d’arachide, 150kg de haricot, 60kg de mil et 25kg de sucre. Les noix de karité après cuisson sont pilés soit à la machine soit traditionnellement pour en faire de beurre de karité et le mil aussi est pilé, vanné, et cuit pour en faire de la bouillie ou du couscous.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement dans la ville de Sikasso, les villages de Heremakono (frontière Mali- Burkina Faso) et Koloko (1er village bukinabé après le Mali).  Les marchandises sont achiminées à Heremakono les jours de foire pour être vendues au comptant, et au détail à une clientèle composée très généralement des femmes et surtout des foraines. Certaines vendent leurs marchandises à Ziékorodougou au bord de la route Mali-Burkina Faso. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce 11ème prêt un bénéfice moyen de 10.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement à renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
This group of sisters and cousins became specialized in the commerce of condiments, charcoal, grain, and fish. In addition to commerce, they also make karité butter and porridge made from millet, beans, etc. The group is composed of eight women (all married and averaging 40 years of age and four children), who live in polygamous households in the village of Ziékorodougou, located about 38 km from the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

Having collaborated with Soro Yiriwaso for six years now, they are on their eleventh cycle (solidarity loans, i.e., group loans), and all the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan they intend to buy: 4 sacks of salt, 10 packets of flavorings, 10 kg of cola nuts, 10 kg of smoked fish, 50 kg of karité nuts, 2 sacks of peanuts, 150 kg of beans, 60 kg of millet, and 25 kg of sugar. The karité nuts are first cooked and then pounded, either with a machine or in the tradition manner, to make karité butter. The millet is also pounded, winnowed, and cooked to make porridge or couscous out of it.

They get their supplies essentially in the city of Sikasso, the villages of Heremakono (bordering Mali and Burkina Faso) and Koloko (first village of Burkina Faso after Mali). The merchandise is taken to Heremakono on market days to be sold in cash at the retail level to customers composed generally of women and especially of market vendors. Some group members sell their merchandise in Ziékorodougou on the side of the road that leads to Mali and Burkina Faso.

With this eleventh loan, they each envision realizing an average profit of 10,000 francs CFA per month, which will essentially be used to boost their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Nobleza (“Nobility”) Village Bank. She is 38 years old and is the single mother of one child. She runs an Internet café from her home, and also owns a car that her cousin uses as a taxi in Lima. She plans to have the car brought to Ayacucho soon so that she can rent it to another relative to use as a taxi. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 1400 soles. Her father was recently diagnosed with cancer, so she plans to use the money to bring her father to Ayacucho to care for him and pay for his medical expenses. She will repay the loan with her income from the Internet café and her taxi. 

Elizabeth has been working with FINCA for three years now. She says that FINCA has been a great help and source of support and has allowed her to expand her Internet café. She especially appreciates FINCA’s obligatory savings program, since other local financial institutions do not have such programs and it is very difficult for her to save money independently.

loans.use: Cover father's medical expenses

loans.name: Estrellas De Belen Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de el alto, en la zona Ballivián  se encuentra en centro focal “Alto Lima”  a éste pertenece la asociación “Estrellas de Belén ”, bajo esta  denominación doce miembros  forman un grupo muy unido y organizado.
Existen diferentes actividades dentro la asociación, siendo la mayoría artesanos, Juana se dedica a la confección de sombreros, María Luisa realiza alfombras tejidas a mano, otras socias confeccionan polleras y mantas con bordados de distintos diseños ; todos estos productos los exponen  en las principales ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Además de necesitar mayores recursos para la compra de maquinaria especial requieren capital para la compra de materia prima, con el objetivo de aumentar su producción  y generar mayores ganancias...
texts.en:
In the Ballivián area of El Alto city you will find the “Alto Lima” center that belongs to the “Estrellas de Belén” association. 12 members form a very organized and united group beneath this name. There are various professions within the association, the majority of which are artisans. Juana makes hats, Maria Luisa makes hand-made carpets, other members make skirts and embroidered blankets of various designs. All these products are sold at the major markets in El Alto city. In addition to needing greater resources to buy special machinery, they need capital to buy raw materials with the objective of increasing their production and generating greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy materials to create products

loans.name: Florifes

texts.en:
Florifes T. is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, living at P5-San Apolinario St, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Florifes is the breadwinner of the family, and a mother of 3 children: a second year student, sixth grader and an infant.

Florifes has an existing business, which is a Sari-Sari store. The capital that she had for putting up the Sari-Sari store was from the funds she got by selling 2 pigs that she raised. As the breadwinner of the family, she must strive to sustain the needs of her family and her children. Florifes needs PHP 5,000.00 and she will be using the funds to buy enough goods to sell from her store, like canned goods, junk foods, school supplies, and others.

Florifes is grateful to those who want to help her in the business.

loans.use: Additional capital for the Sari-Sari store

location.town: Tangub-P5-San Apolinario, Tangub City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Khabib

texts.en:
Khabib Q. is 60 years old. He is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foods such as sweets, preserved foods, soft drinks, sugar, tea, juices, and other items in his grocery store. Khabib is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Khabib has 6 years of experience in this field, his politeness has helped him grow and expand his business. Currently Khabib is requesting a loan $1200 USD with a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 64 años de edad, es casado hace 45 años y padre de 6 hijos; actualmente vive con su esposa y su nieto en su casa. El es un agricultor de mucha trayectoria, junto con su esposa realizan los trabajos agrícolas, y en todo este tiempo ha acumulado muchas agallas y experiencia, conociendo los meses en que se debe cultivar y abonar. Desde entonces a llegado a la conclusión de que la siembra de piña es muy dificultosa, mientras que los platanales le resultan más fáciles. Pero lo que sí es muy  rentable, pero también laborioso es la siembra de café; Daniel no deja de sembrar este producto durante todo el año, invierte mucho, pero también gana, por lo cual se siente muy orgulloso de ser agricultor. Ahora está muy contento porque la chacra de café que había sembrado el año pasado ya está a punto de dar frutos, por ello que quiere realizar el abonado de sus plantas cafetaleras, para que las coseche a tiempo, para de ese modo tener una producción alternada y no le falte dinero para cubrir sus gastos familiares. Daniel y sus demás compañeros han conformado este banco comunal denominado Alto Yapaz, donde él ha sido nombrado tesorero, prometió cumplir con sus responsabilidades delegadas e hizo compromisos de pagar puntualmente a MFP, del cual está agradecido por el crédito facilitado. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para que abone a su chacra de café, y de ese modo trate de adelantar la producción, considera que la cantidad requerida le será suficiente.
texts.en:
Daniel is 64 years old and has been married 45 years. He is the father of 6 children and currently lives in his house with his wife and grandson. He is a farmer with a lot of experience. Together with his wife, they have worked many agricultural jobs. Through this work, they accumulated guts and experience, learning which months are good for cultivating and fertilizing. Since then they've arrived at the conclusion that growing pineapple is very difficult, while growing bananas is easier. However what is really profitable, though also labor-intensive, is the cultivation of coffee. Daniel planted this product non-stop throughout the entire year, investing a lot, but also gaining a lot. This made him feel very proud to be a farmer. Now he is very happy because the coffee farm he planted last year is already about to bear fruit. For that reason he wants to complete fertilization of the coffee plants, so that they will be harvested on time and so that in this way he can have an alternate production and will have money to cover his family's expenses. Daniel and the rest of his coworkers have formed a communal bank called Alto Yapaz, where he has been named treasurer. He has promised to fulfill his responsibilities as an officer. He also made a commitment to pay on time to MFP, to which he is grateful for providing this loan. He is requesting this money to buy fertilizers in order to fertilize his coffee crop, and in this way try to improve production. He expects that the requested amount will be sufficient.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for coffee plants

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys T. is 50 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. According to her, one of her children has completed university. The rest are in senior high and junior high schools. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She says though her husband is employed, she still needs to work hard to help herself and the family.

She sells provisions. Gladys sells in a shop at the market square. She procures products such as milk, sugar, bread, canned foods, etc., from wholesalers in Kumasi. Gladys has been in business for 30 years. She wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk. Gladys aspires to give her last two children the best education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 54 years old and already a widow.  She and her husband had six children. Two of them are already married and living in their own houses while the other two are working as security guards in Macau. Her two younger children are still studying and through her business, she was able to support their studies. They are living in Barangay Andarayan South in Solana, Cagayan. 

Josefina is a vendor in her village. She sells different vegetables and fish in the neighborhood. She is now requesting a loan amount of PHP 15,000.00 in order to purchase more goods that she can sell and for her to maintain and improve her enterprise.  She is thankful that some of her children assist her financially in sending her children to school.  She hopes that they will both earn a college degree.  She is also hoping for the approval of her loan request for it helps her not only in business but also in sustaining her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando I. is a man full of courage in life. At the age of 40, and being the head of the family, he serves as breadwinner for his family. They live simply and happily in Barangay Santiago of Reina Mercedez, Isabela. He is married to Fely, his wife, and they always help each other to improve both their farming and general store in their village. They have been blessed with only one son named Fernando I., Jr. They hope that through their income from farming and through their store, they will be able to provide the basic necessities of daily living, especially the schooling of their son. They hope that their son will make good in his studies in order to become a successful person in the future.

Fernando dreams of expanding his business so that he will be able to continue sending his son to school and have him finish college someday. In hopes of achieving this dream, he mentioned that he will continue to work hard to make his business productive. He wanted to access the benefits of joining the program of ASKI and expects to enjoy his membership.

At present, Fernando is asking to borrow PHP 7,000 as additional capital for the improvement of his general store. He wants to buy additional products in order to increase his profit. The loan will be a big help to make his business more progressive, thus making his dreams possible to achieve.

loans.use: buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Rozi Begum Michael John Masih Group

texts.en:
Rozi begum baji is the wife of M. J. M. who has lived in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband runs a tailoring center in the community where he stitches clothes for people and charges them different rates. He charges US$ 2 for simple stitching and US$ 3 for designer clothes.

Rozi baji also prepares embroidered dresses on orders which she collects from clothing shops. She saves her income in a "committee" and plans to renovate her house when it is her turn to get the full "committee" amount. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her husband’s tailoring center.

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Fozia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Christina Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy medicines to resell. Bable baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rukhsana Rani baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Advertising

loans.name: Luz Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Luz Nélida G. M. tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Luz se dedica a la venta de golosinas y  de comida rápida, inicio su negocio vendiendo fruta, su negocio lo desarrolla en afueras del Centro de Salud Gran Chimú  de su distrito.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de baldes, vasos, cucharas, platos para la venta de comida y desayunos.
Este crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ollas, golosinas y la construcción de su kiosco de material noble.
Luz tiene como sueño tener su cafetín para brindar un mejor servicio al personal de salud y población que acuden a ese centro de salud.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Nelida G. M., 42, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She has an elementary school education. She has 2 children, both still in her care. Luz operates a business selling fast food and snacks. She started out selling fruit. She developed the business at a spot near the Gran Chimu health center in her neighborhood. She received her first loan, for 300 soles, from her community bank, Lideresas en Accion II, and used it to purchase containers, drinking glasses, spoons and plates for her food sales. This loan, for 800 soles, will be used to purchase pots and other supplies and for building a kiosk with top materials. Luz dreams of having a cafe where she can provide a better service to the staff of the health center and others who go there.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for food sales business and construction materials for new kiosk.

loans.name: Мухайё Mukhaiyo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шодиева торгует на базаре Костокоза более 10 лет. У нее много клиентов так как она продает качественные товары. Период кредитование у нее увеличилось товарооборот,а также смогла улучшить свой семейный статус. На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет разнообразить и улучшить ассортимент летней детской одежды.
texts.en:
S. has been selling at the Kostokoz market for more than 10 years. She sells quality goods, so she has a lot of customers. During the lending period sales have increased, and she has also been able to improve her family's living conditions. She is seeking a loan because she would like to diversify and improve her assortment of children's summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's summer clothing

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She has a salon where she styles hair for her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Cossy

texts.en:
Cossy is a 22-year-old married woman with two children aged 11 months and 4 years, one of whom goes to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she lives with three people and also takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day.

Cossy resides and works in a semi-urban area where she deals in cold drinks and refreshments. She works six days a week and has been in this business for the last five years. She sells to an average of ten customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping and her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Cossy has been with MCDT for years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning some rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more  crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Alimatou B. du Banc Villageois de BELFORT a 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants en charge. Elle a une bonne expérience de son activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis son entrée dans Le Banc Villageois en 2005. Elle vend des tissus teintés et des bijoux. Elle participe beaucoup à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alimatou B., from the Belfort Village Bank, is 39 years old, married and mother to 3 dependent children. She is experienced in her business as she has been working in it since she joined the Village Bank in 2005. She sells dyed fabric and jewellery. She plays a large role in improving her family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her business selling fabric and jewellery

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty C. is from the village of Camp Phillips Bukidnon. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns and operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to local community members. Betty has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Betty joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Betty is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es: La señora Karla Vanesa González Martines tiene la edad de 30 años habita el barrio las enramadas, ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera a su cargo tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian , los planes hacia su familia es apoyar siempre a sus hijos ya que en futuro quiere verlos como unos grandes profesionales , ya que se a esforzado mucho para darle lo que hoy ellos tienen , desde hace cuatro años trabaja como archivadora , ella esta contenta con el buena aprobación de su noveno préstamo ya que con este; comprara materiales de construcción para poner el piso de su casa con los créditos anteriores fue para construir su vivienda , agradece a la institución por dar la oportunidad de tener un mejor patrimonio para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar piso para poner en la sala

loans.name: Maria Zola Margarita

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Pablo está en la comunidad de Rumiloma en la zona sur a unos 20 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, aquí la mayor parte la gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería por la fertilidad de la tierra, además podemos disfrutar de un paisaje sin igual de la serrania ecuatoriana mezcla de colores por los diferentes productos que se cultivan atrayendo a turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

La señora María Zola Margarita Fernández Fernández  es  socia activa  del banco comunal San Pablo ella vive en la comunidad de Guariviña, tiene 48 años de edad  es casada concibió seis hijos de 33, 29, 28, 25, 24, 23 años, sus tres  primeros hijos ya son casados, viven en casa es propia fruto de mucho esfuerzo que comparte con su esposo los tres hijos menores y dos nietos a los que quiere mucho, su esposo trabaja como conductor de un taxi de la localidad.

María Zola se dedica a la venta de  chuzos y salchipapas en una vieja carreta en el centro de la ciudad  desde hace 28 años, su horario de trabajo es de 4 de la tarde a 10 de la noche por lo que sus hijos le ayudan en  su negocio.

Este es su segundo ciclo trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación ofrece y con ellos ha podido solventar las necesidades de su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de una nueva carreta  para mejorar la apariencia de su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Su meta es llegar a terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The community bank San Pablo is located in the community of Rumiloma in the southern zone, about 20 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Most people there work in agriculture and livestock because of the fertility of the land. There you can also enjoy a landscape without equal in the Equatorian mountain range, where a mix of colours from the different products they cultivate attracts tourists from Equador and abroad. María Zola Margarita Fernández Fernández is an active member of the community bank San Pablo. She lives in the community of Guariviña, is 48 years old and is married. She has six children of 33, 29, 28, 25, 24 and 23 years of age. Her first three children are already married. She lives in a house which is the fruit of much effort with her husband, three younger children and two grandchildren who she loves very much. Her husband works as a local taxi driver. María Zola has been selling chicken skewers and fried potatoes with sausage from an old cart in the city centre for the last 28 years. Her daily timetable is from four in the afternoon until ten at night, which is why her children help her with her business. This is her second cycle working with the loans that Kiva's field partner foundation offers and with them she has been able to settle all the necessary expenses of her business. She will invest the new loan that FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR (Foundation of Hope) grants her in the purchase of a new cart to improve the appearance of her business and provide a better service for her customers. Her goal is to finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cart to improve her business' appearance and service

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela de ocupación Rentista y comerciante de golosinas vive en casa propia la misma que esta en construcción, ubicada en la zona Huayna Potosí de la Ciudad de El Alto, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de materiales de construcción para las habitaciones que esta construyendo en su domicilio así tener mejor comodidad para ella y sus hijos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, los anteriores créditos fueron cancelados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada  califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Carmela.
texts.en:
Carmela is a landlord and she sells sweets. She lives in her own house, which is under construction. It is located in the Huayna Potosí region of the city of El Alto. She is a widow, and she has five children. This loan will be used to buy construction material for the rooms that she is building in her home. That way she and her children will be more comfortable. This is her third loan from Impro. Her previous loans were paid back punctually. The completed evaluation allows her to be approved for this loan that she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials like sand, cement, stones, and bricks for the rooms she wishes to build

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 33 años, está casada y es madre de 4 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.
Desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, este negocio surge por iniciativa de su esposo y desde ese entonces ya no trabaja en sus cultivos porque todo el tiempo está dedicada a atender a su negocio, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta 10 de la noche diariamente. En todo este tiempo pudo captar y fidelizar clientes, tratándolos amablemente y trayendo todos sus pedidos para una determinada fecha, logrado ser el negocio más concurrido de su pueblo. Su meta es que su bodega esté bien implementada con productos comestibles, golosinas y gaseosas; para ello, los domingos junto a su esposo van de compras a la ciudad.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, durante todo este tiempo no tuvo dificultades de pago y para este préstamo promete seguir con la misma responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el incremento del capital de su negocio. Asimismo, comprará fertilizantes químicos para los cultivos de café de su esposo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 years old, married, and lives in her own house with her 4 children. For 14 years she has sold groceries and basic items. This business originated through the initiative of her husband, and ever since she no longer works in agriculture because she spends all of her time attending to the store each day from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. Over time she managed to capture and retain customers, treating them amicably and filling all of their orders on time and in this way becoming the most popular store in the town. Her goal is to supply her store with food items, candy and soft drinks; to do this she will go with her husband on Sundays to make purchases in the city. This is her third loan with MFP, and during all of this time she has not had any difficulties making her payments. With this loan she promises to continue with the same responsibility. The money that she requests will be invested in increasing the inventory of her business, and she will also buy chemical fertilizers for her husband's coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Ana Lucia durante varios años se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, zapatos, y su costura el cual ha sido su medio de sustento que junto con su esposo esperan formar a sus tres hijos con la educación de los estudios. El trabaja de docente en un colegio lo cual le permite apoyar a sus hijos. Su venta la comenzó con apoyo de su mama que esta en Miami el cual le envío remesa para que sea una mujer independiente con iniciativa de superación a si como dinero que su esposo dio también. Mas tarde nace la idea de crecer en su negocio pero falta capital el cual recurre ala Afodenic para que le apruebe el financiamiento y logra poder hacer sus mejoras a su vivienda le falta repellar las paredes de su casa, desea hacer un bajarete con toda las condiciones pero por el momento solo hará el muro, con este préstamo el cual comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar hacer un muro y poder tener un poco mas de seguridad contra todo peligro como delincuente ya que día a día asechan al robo con intimidación. Y muchas veces por no tener su casa segura se aprovechan. Yo muy contenta por el apoyo de la institución que me ha permitido lograr mi objetivo.
texts.en:
For a number of years, Ana Lucia has been selling clothing, shoes, and hand-sewn items to earn income that she and her husband hope to use to send their three children to school. To support the children, her husband teaches at a school. Ana Lucia started her business with help from her mother in Miami, who sent money for her daughter to use, along with money from her husband, so she can be an independent woman with the will to overcome. Later, when Ana Lucia decided to grow her business, she didn’t have the capital. She turned to Afodenic and asked them to approve a loan, which she used to make improvements on her house, because the walls needed to be plastered. She would like to build an all-purpose shelter, but for now she’ll just put up a wall. She plans to use this loan to buy stone, sand, cement, and iron to start building the wall, so they can be a little safer from all the dangers like crime; they are under the daily threat of armed robbers, who often take advantage of the fact that the house is not secure. Ana Lucia says, “I am very happy for the institution’s support, which has helped me to achieve my goal.”

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, and iron to begin building a wall for greater security.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with two grown children. He lives in Stryi and travels to neighboring villages and towns to sell clothing products there. His business has been successful due to reasonable planning and pricing policies. Ivan has been running this trade for 10 years. Currently, he has over 16,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Ivan is seeking a loan of 17,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise. He is very knowledgeable in this sphere of trade and likes his job. Ivan is using a part of his income to help his elderly parents who are retired. This time Ivan is hoping to invest a portion of generated profit to repair his car. All his previous loans have been repaid without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to increase his turnover capital

loans.name: Mrs. Roun Prak Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Roun P. is a village president of 18 people who all live in the village of Pong Tuek, in Takeo province. She is a grocer in a local market and her husband, Mr. Hing Chhouk, is a farmer who owns a 0.6-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn income for his family. Since her grocery business is going well, she would like to expand her grocery store. Thus, Mrs. Roun P. is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to resell. She hopes to increase her income with this loan. Mrs. Roun P. is a mother of one child who is a student.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Lydie Kanon

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Lydie Kanon vit depuis 22 ans environs au quartier Houinmè, dans le quatrième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. Mariée à GANBIA Waliou un chauffeur, Lydie Kanon est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Lydie Kanon vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Houinmè.
