Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. N'ayant jamais fréquenté l'école, Lydie Kanon vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) à son domicile. Lydie Kanon s'approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. Lydie Kanon a 10 ans d'expérience dans cette activité et a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. La clientèle de Lydie Kanon s’accroît au jour le jour ; mais Lydie Kanon n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose actuellement sont faibles. C’est la raison pour laquelle Lydie Kanon sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. A. Lydie Kanon has been living for about 22 years in the Houinmè quarter, in the 4th district of the city of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to Mr. GANBIA Waliou, a driver, she is the mother of four children, some of whom are in school. She lives together with her children and husband in Houinmè. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. Never having attended school, Lydie Kanon sells food (rice served with sauce) out of her home. She stocks up at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. She has ten years of experience in this business and has already obtained two ALIDé loans, which she has repaid. Her customer base is growing day by day. But she isn't managing to satisfy them because the funds at her disposal are currently low. For these reasons, Lydie Kanon is requesting a third loan for bolstering her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice and sauce condiments (tomaotes, chili peppers, onions, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Albis

texts.es:
Albis M. Z., tiene la edad de 62 años, está casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 26 y 22 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Albis tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Albis M. Z., is 62, married, and has 2 children who are his top priority. They are 26 and 22. He wants this loan to buy some calves and feed for them.He hopes to give them adequate care so he can make the most income possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has and keep them in better conditions. He has a suitable area for caring for and raising the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms they have offered him. Don Albis has raised cattle for several years. In the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to continue growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: As a busy entrepreneur, Rosemarie has been making and selling doormats for almost two years. Her husband, Antonio, is also an entrepreneur in the community. To build her business, Rosemarie would like a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to increase her inventory of goods. She is planning to purchase additional products such as cotton, planel and other supplies. Rosemarie believes that offering a wide assortment of doormat products to customers will increase their daily income and maintain customer loyalty in the community. Rosemarie has been a committed member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2008. She is a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans. Her dreams are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her business, and start a savings account for her children to support them until they finish studies in college. With hard work and determination, Rosemarie is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank approach (GBA) to deliver credit to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models for credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make doormats

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis tiene 36 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos un varón y dos mujeres, se dedica a la venda de zapatos, cuenta con un local en la plaza del mercado local, en ASDIR es el segundo crédito que solicita el anterior lo pago puntualmente, necesita nuevamente el financiamiento para incrementar y surtir mejor su mercadería en zapatos de todo tipo y talla, su esposa le ayuda en atender el negocio y con la ayuda de ella pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Luis is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children, a boy and 2 girls. He sells shoes, and has a location in the plaza of a local market. This is his 2nd loan with ASDIR, and he paid off the first loan on time. Now he needs financing to increase and restock his merchandise with shoes of all types and sizes. His wife helps him to attend to the business, and with her help he will pay off this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes)

loans.name: Otoo Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Margaret is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are between the ages of three and sixteen. She lives with her husband and children in a mission house of a church in the community where the husband is the pastor.

Margaret is a hard-working woman. She works to help her husband to provide for the family. She is into food production business – pastries. Margaret has been producing and supplying pastries for the past six years and is experienced. She buys her raw materials – bags of flour, sugar, vegetable oil and other ingredients from nearby towns. It is her dream to see all her children climb the academic ladder to the university level. She also aspires to produce pastries on a large scale and be able to supply to more retailers.

Margaret is the leader of a five-member trust bank group called ‘O.’, probably her surname. The group is made up of mainly traders and food vendors. According to Margaret, the group members are all sincere and hard-working. The group requests the loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk for baking

loans.name: Saeni

texts.en:
Saeni T. is 60 and widowed with 6 children (ages 21 - 37).  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Saeni has 4 years of experience in this business.  Saeni needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Saeni joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Saeni's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa, de 32 años, vive con su esposo, y sus 3 hijos en la casa de su madre.Desde hace 8 años, se dedica a la crianza y comercio de cerdos, que vende en las principales ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Su madre le ayuda en el comercio, y todos los días  brinda un adecuado cuidado a sus animales. Con el paso de los años, ha ganado experiencia que le ha servido  para conocer las ventajas de su negocio, pues la venta de los animales le ha generado considerables  ganancias. Para más adelante tiene planeado adquirir más cerdos para  su granja.Es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será muy  responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo, pues le servirá  para continuar trabajando.Tomasa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de algunos cerdos, para su granja.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 32 years old and lives at her mother’s house with her husband and three children. For the past eight years, she has been raising pigs to sell at the major livestock fairs in her community. Her mother helps her with the business, and together they provide adequate care to the animals. Over the years, Tomasa has gained experience that has helped her to understand the advantages of her business. As a result, the sale of her animals has generated considerable revenue. To keep moving forward, she plans to acquire more pigs for her farm.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Tomasa promises she will be very responsible with her payments and thanks everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of a few pigs for her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more pigs

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Lean D. G. is from the village of San Ramon. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lean owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Lean has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lean joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase materials needed to proviD. services. Lean is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be the sixth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand the services provided

loans.name: Kanungu Kwetungura Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Henry K. is 47 and the father of five. He is married and, to cater for his family’s needs, he operates a carpentry workshop.

This workshop has been in existence for the last twenty years and the reason why it has existed this long, Henry says, is on the grounds of his perseverance in the face of hardships. He cites financial hardships, intrigue and the high cost of timber as some of the problems that have plagued his business. Without his strong-hearted sense of resilience, he says, he would not have come this far.

Henry makes all kinds of furniture such as chairs and desks that he has been selling to the many mushrooming schools around Kihihi Town. He also has a small milk-selling business that helps him earn some side profits. In a week, he makes 200,000 shillings. With this loan, he wants to buy more timber that he will use to make more furniture to sell.

loans.use: To buy more timber to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Isabel P. es una mujer muy responsable que se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, en estos momentos no tiene muy surtido su negocio.
este negocio esta ubicado en un punto estrategico ya que la afluencia de personas es bastante grande.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas productos y asi tener mas surtido su negocio.
nos comento que las ventas han aumentado pero que no tiene capital suficiente para poder comprar mas productos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel P. is a responsible woman who is dedicated to selling groceries. She has a small store in her house. Currently, her business is not well stocked. This business is located in a strategic place since the influx of people is quite large. She will use the loan to buy more products and better stock her business. She has told us that her sales have grown but she doesn't have enough capital to be able to buy more products. She needs her earnings to cover her house and family bills.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize flour, tortillas, beans, refreshments, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margerine, soap, pastas.

loans.name: Sharifgul

texts.ru: Рачабова Шарифгул проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 57 лет. Замужем, имеет 7 детей. Муж занимается растениеводством. Сын торгует на рынке. Сама Шарифгул имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает крупно - рогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа дойной коровы, чтобы увеличить количество скот и получить молоко.
texts.en:
Sharifgul R. lives in Vahdat. She is 57 years old, married, and has seven children. Her husband farms. Her son works in sales at the market. Sharifgul has a high school education. She has been working in animal husbandry for more than ten years. She fattens and sells cattle. She is taking out a loan to buy a milk cow to increase her herd and to get milk.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase water, soft drinks and ingredients to make french fries

loans.name: Chomimabaj Group

texts.es: Don Oscar Rene C. E. es casado, tiene 5 hijos, es una persona analfabeta, el se dedica al comercio (compra y venta de Cinchos)  tiene 18 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunos vecinos organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo solidario se  denomina Chonimabaj,  el nombré indica la ubicación de cada uno de ellos. El grupo cuenta con cuatro integrantes 3 hombres y una mujer, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales,  y venta de Cacahuates, y ropa americana.   El préstamo el lo utilizará para compra de mercadería y así incrementar el volumen de ventas, para segir adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar René C. E. is married and has five children. He is illiterate and has been a belt merchant for 18 years. With lots of enthusiasm and support from some neighbors they organized a group to request a loan. The group is called Chonimabaj, which is an anagram made up of each of their locations. The group has three men and one woman who are in a variety of activities among which are: animal raising, peanut sales and American clothes sales. He will use the loan to buy merchandise to increase sales volume in order to continue forward with his children’s help. He hopes his business will grow and be productive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy belts.

loans.name: María Roxana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora María tiene 31 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace ya 9 años,  fruto de aquella relación ha tenido tres hijos,  la última es una hermosa bebita de 10 meses la cual es la adoración de la casa. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de lotería.

Nuestra socia es  ama de casa, para ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de ropa y  venta de lotería. Vende ropa de todo tipo, su sistema de ventas es de puerta en puerta y también entrega en su casa, dice que deja a crédito y  hace sus cobros semanalmente, lo cual es una ventaja dice, porque al dejar a crédito incrementa más el precio y le queda más ganancias, además que al hacer sus cobros realiza nuevas ventas. Trabaja tres días a la semana unas cuatro horas ya que tiene que atender su hogar y  a sus hijos. Compra sus mercaderías en Guayaquil, ciudad a la que viaja una o dos veces al mes dependiendo de sus ventas.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar una parte en ropa y otra parte para comprar billetes de lotería. Es su primer ciclo en este Banco  aunque ya lleva varios años como socia de la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa que aun la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The communal bank 30 de Agosto meets in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. It is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint Paul festivals, and for its people's cheerfulness. María is 31 years old and has been in a relationship for 9 years. She has three children from that relationship. The youngest is a beautiful 10 month old baby girl who is the center of attention in the house. Her husband sells lottery tickets. Our member is a housewife. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she decided to start her own business selling clothing and lottery tickets. She sells all types of clothing door to door. She also delivers clothing to people's homes. She says that she sells the clothes on credit and collects every week. This is an advantage, she says, because selling on credit increases the price and she makes more profit. In addition, when she collects, she makes more sales. She works three days a week for about four hours, since she has to attend to her home and her chidlren. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil, where she travels once or twice a month, depending on her sales. She is going to use this loan in part for clothing and in part to buy lottery tickets. This is her first cycle in this bank, although she has been a member of Fundación Espoir for several years. Her dream is to finish her house, which is still under construction.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and lottery tickets

loans.name: Herlin Santana

texts.es:
Don Herlin es un hombre trabajador, dedicado a su familia, casado siendo su esposa ejecutiva de ventas. Gracias al apoyo de ella han logrado hacer su casa.
Su trabajo  es de tipógrafo el cual lleva varios años en el oficio, y está contento por lograr el objetivo de mejorar cada día. Siendo Afodenic la puerta a la mejora de vivienda en su familia.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo podrá terminar de cerrar un muro en la parte de atrás de su solar, el cual está bastante avanzado y que espera terminar, lo que le dará satisfacción ya que podrá tener un poco mas de seguridad contra los delincuente del barrio.
Para esto comprara: piedra, trescientos bloques, veinte bolsas de cemento, hierro, arena, piedrín, clavos entre otros.
texts.en:
Herlin is a hardworking man who is dedicated to his family. He is married and his wife is a sales executive. Thanks to her support, they have been able to build their house. He has had his job as a printer for several years. He is happy to achieve his goal of improving every day. Afodenic has been the door to improving his family's housing. Today, with this new loan, he will be able to finish a wall in the back part of his lot. It is coming along very well and he hopes to finish it. THis will give him the satisfaction of being able to have more security against the crime in the neighborhood. For this he will buy: stone, three hundred blocks, twenty bags of cement, iron, sand, gravel, and nails, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy: stone, three hundred blocks, twenty bags of cement, iron, sand, gravel, and nails among other things to be able to finish building a wall.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma A. is from the village of Bato. She is 43 years old. Wilma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2005, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en:
Achraf is a 30-year-old married man and the father of three children. Since 2008 he has been working in painting wood for living rooms, bedrooms and dining rooms, with 15 years of experience in the field. 

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay school fees, in addition to buying diesel fuel to use for heat in the winter season. His previous loans had a good impact on his business and his family income, and on both his social and financial situations. With the last loan, he bought a Renault Rapid car suitable for his business, to transport his tools and to deliver his finished work in a short period of time. 

He is working on expanding his business, and hoping to invest everything he has in making it happen.

loans.use: To pay school fees and buy diesel fuel for the winter

loans.name: Khaki Association-Jinja Group

texts.en: K. Aisha belongs to Khaki Association-Jinja. The 34 year old has been managing her tailoring business located along the road for the last 13 years. It is a business she began with loads of confidence, after she had acquired tailoring skills at the Elidima factory, a leading garment factory in Jinja. In a week, this mother of 4, who is happily married, says she makes 20,000 shillings.  With this loan she is going to purchase more cloth to make fabrics.

loans.use: The purchase of more cloth for making fabrics.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.en:
Diana is a 29-year-old mother of two who lives with her partner and children in the city of Limón, one of the poorest and most violent cities in Costa Rica, on the Caribbean coast. The loan consultant who has been working with Diana describes her as a humble and hardworking entrepreneur with aspirations to provide a better life for her family. A dedicated mother and entrepreneur, this will be Diana´s 3rd loan with Fundación Mujer. Diana is serious when it comes to her business because it represents a significant amount of the family's income.
 
Diana earns a living by offering laundry services to clients, including local primary schools, high schools, and various members of the community. Diana´s laundromat is located in a central location which is good for business. Diana can rely on the assistance of her mother during busy periods, or when Diana has to go out and run errands. 

In addition to laundry services, Diana also sells clothing from door to door in her community, although this loan will be used as working capital for her laundry business. Specifically, Diana would like to invest in a new washing machine and ironing equipment. 

Diana´s goal is to increase revenues from the laundromat. She wants to expand her business and attract new clients. Her main difficulty is earning enough income during down times; for example, when school is not in session.

loans.use: For the purchase of a washing machine and ironing equipment.

loans.name: Jone

texts.en:
Jone is a 39-year-old man married to Faith who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children who are 15,12 and 13 years old.

Jone has been in the hawking business for six years. He manages to earn Ksh 15,000 per month. He has been in the business long enough to make him identify fast-moving goods and potential clients. He plans to use his profits to educate his children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To purchase hawking items

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 48 years old and is the mother of a child who is 18 years old. She has been engaged in mixed farming – that is, both crop and  dairy farming, for a number of years.  This has given her very good income. 

She was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her first loan from KADET. She has not borrowed from any other financial institutions apart from KADET. Nancy plans to buy a dairy cow for milk production to get more income for her family. This will enable her to give her son a good and comfortable life.

She plans to add more dairy cows in the future so that she can supply more milk to the dairy cooperative in Githunguri.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single woman. She is from Lebanon and lives with her parents and two siblings. She and her father are the sole income providers for the family. Her father works in the agricultural field. She wants to increase her family’s profit. She has been working as a hairdresser for 10 years and, in 2006, she decided to open her own salon. 
 
Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to upgrade her salon tools and purchase vaporization machinery. She wants to offer a comfortable service to her clients and increase her income.

loans.use: To upgrade her salon tools and purchase vaporization machinery

loans.name: Badarch

texts.en:
Badarch is 63 years old and lives with her husband, two children, and a grandchild in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. With her eldest daughter’s help, Badarch operates a retail clothing business out of a stall at the local market. Her youngest daughter currently attends university and her granddaughter attends a local primary school. Her husband is a herder and raises livestock in the countryside. 

Badarch started her business in 2003 with 800,000 MNT in capital. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,200,000 MNT. Badarch’s daughter is responsible for purchasing the products that they sell in their stall and they have started to sell Oriflame cosmetic products to supplement their earnings. 

Badarch is a talkative and hardworking person. She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to pass her business to her daughter and retire.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 45-year-old married man living in Chtoura with his wife. Mahdi has owned an auto repair garage since 1982, and has thirty-five years of experience in this field. He started to work early because he had to help earn his family's income, unlike most of his friends during childhood. Mahdi also owns a van which he uses to transport students from/to school as a second income. 

Mahdi works hard to improve his financial and social situation. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time, in order to buy two Renault Rapid cars, do the necessary maintenance on them, and then sell them. He's trying to move into the car sales field. His previous loan was very impressive and helped a lot in his business, and as he stated, he hopes this one results in a good income, too.

loans.use: To buy two cars to fix and sell them

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo G. , 47, lives in the town of Bunawan with his family. He is married and has five school-aged children. 

Danilo is a farmer and primarily plants and harvests rice crops. He also raises pigs in his backyard. Danilo works hard to build his business and have a stable income. He also aims to have all his children finish college and be successful.

Danilo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Stanley Kariuki

texts.en:
Stanley Kariuki is 50 years old and married to Phidith Wanjiku, who also contributes to the family income. He has four dependent children. He has been running a knitting and wool-selling business for a period of 10 years with an income of about 25,000 KES per month.

He has never borrowed from any other MFI and this is his first loan from KADET Ltd.  He intends to use it to buy more wool and add some savings to buy a motorbike. He hopes to expand his business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more wool

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children; one still attends school while three have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Fatuma has operated a petrol vending business for the past two years, selling from home to "boda boda" (motorcycle) operators. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a petrol station in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase gallons of petrol for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase gallons of petrol for sale.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a married woman who lives in Trinidad, Bohol, with her family. She has had a sari-sari store for 5 years. She sells items like shampoo, canned goods to the people in her community. She usually earns about 5000 PHP per month with her business.

Aurea is requesting a loan of 9000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as shampoo and soft drinks.

In the future, Aurea hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as shampoo and soft drinks

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s laundry business. He will utilize the loan money to buy an iron and clothes-washing material such as Surf, bleach powder, washing soaps, etc., for the improvement of his laundry business. 

Yasmeen comes from Faisalabad which is an industrial city of Pakistan and famous for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Mariam Abad where she moved 10 years ago with her family. She has two sons. Both of them are illiterate and couldn’t get education due to financial constraints. 

Yasmeen is a very good mother and housewife. She takes care of her family very well by fulfilling their needs on time.  Her husband has three years of experience in his business and Yasmeen is hopeful that an investment will prove beneficial for the future growth of his business. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Yasmeen”.

loans.use: To buy an iron and clothes-washing material for laundry business.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials and repair her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Felomina has been in this business for 20 years. Felomina earns more income from fish vending.

Felomina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Philice

texts.en:
Philice is a single woman with two children, a boy and a girl. They all attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity, clothing and school fees. 

For the past 6 years, she has operated a cereals business, selling in a shop and at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also makes natural fruit juice which she earns as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of competition from other cereals operators in the market. She dreams of building her own shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of ground nuts and passion fruits, and to pay for transport charges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of ground nuts and passion fruits, and to pay for transport charges.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 35 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, 3 of them go to school.  Rose sells bread.  She has borrowed aloan to stock more bread to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits earned.

loans.use: stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas y maletas; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: tela, botones, bordados, etc. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de El Rosario en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente ya que pudo aumentar capital de trabajo. Esta es la segunda vez que el crédito es a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo makes backpacks and suitcases.  He needs the loan to buy raw materials like fabric, buttons, and embroidery, etc.

He lives in his parents’ house, which is in the El Rosario area in the city of La Paz.  He is single, and he does not have children.

He is very pleased with the previous loans he was given because he was able to increase his working capital.  This is his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers and embroidery for his business of making backpacks and suitcases.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 27-year-old housewife who has three children to raise with her husband Ibrahim.

Ibrahim has a full-time job working at one of the governmental entities in Jordan, but that was not enough income for the family, so he and Dalal decided to start a trading business, selling birds at home on their roof.

Now, as a way to support her husband Dalal decided to take a loan to buy other kinds of birds and to improve the living area and the environment where the birds are kept. 

Since Dalal is a conservative person, she requested that her husband be in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy other kinds of birds and to improve the living area and the environment where the birds are kept.

loans.name: Ajarbu's Group

texts.en:
Ajarbu is the treasurer of this group. She is 43 years old and married to a builder. She and her husband are raising six children: two sons and four daughters.

Five years ago, Ajarbu’s husband received salary in the amount of 17,000 KGS, which the family used to purchase livestock. Since then, the family has been breeding livestock. By reselling the livestock after fattening, they earn an additional 2,000 KGS per month. Ajarbu hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to purchase a piece of land for cultivating agricultural products. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio en Adim con el grupo  Rayito y Esperanza. En la actualidad ella ha graduado a los créditos individuales con el fin de seguir mejorando su negocio.
Ofelia se dedica al comercio de ropa usada (camisas, pantalones…etc.) y semanal vende aproximadamente 3,000. Esta señora madre de cinco niños con el crédito comprara pacas de ropa para seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who started working with ADIM as a member of the "Rayito and Esperanza" group.  She has now moved on to taking individual loans in order to continue improving her business.

Ofelia sells used clothes (shirts, pants, etc.) and sells approximately 3,000 cordobas worth each week.  This lady is the mother of five children and she will use her loan to buy a bundle of clothes so that she can continue increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes (shirts, jeans, pants, etc.)

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI II sont toutes des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, SANATA deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Benkadi II group are all married, and an average of 37 years old with 4 children.  Most of them live in plural families in the city of Banco, the seat of a rural commune in the Dioïla prefecture, in Mali’s 2nd administrative region, Koulikoro.

They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in hopes of better organizing their business at the start of the rainy season.  The crops they work with are rice and peanuts.  This is the group’s first time working with this MFI.

Sanata, the second person from the right in the row of standing women, plans to use this loan to purchase farm inputs and small equipment, and pay costs of labor involved to maintain about a quarter hectare (0.6 acres) of rice.

After the harvest, the crops are sold from a stall in the Banco market, and also at N’Golobougou, to customers including both men and women.  The group plans on making an average profit of about 20,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to purchase labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es: Nelson Antonio de treinta y un años de edad, reside en casa familiar junto con su compañera de vida y dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Nelson se dedica  a la venta de juegos de video. Su negocio lo tiene en su hogar de residencia y gracias a su amabilidad, creatividad y a la gran variedad de productos que mantiene ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes los cuales lo prefieren por ser un hombre responsable, trabajador y dedicado en su negocio. Ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar mayor variedad de juegos de video y poder surtir su negocio de tal manera que logre atraer a más clientes que le permitan mejorar su nivel de ventas así como su nivel de ingresos para poder accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Es importante recalcar que anteriormente ya había tenido crédito con INTEGRAL y se clasifica como un cliente responsable y agradecido por la ayuda que se le brindó.
texts.en: Nelson Antonio, 31, lives in his family home with his life partner and 2 children who are in school.  Nelson has a business selling video games which is located in his home.  Thanks to his friendliness and creativity, and his large inventory of products, he has managed to gain the trust of many customers.  They prefer his business because he is a responsible and hardworking man who is devoted to his business.  He has decided to use this loan from INTEGRAL to buy a large variety of video games so that he can stock his business in such a way that he will attract more customers.  This will allow him to increase his sales and also his income, enabling him to have a better quality of life.  It is important to emphasize that previously he had taken a loan from INTEGRAL, and they have characterized him as a responsible client who is grateful for the help that was provided.

loans.use: to buy a variety of video games

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 28-year-old married man with one child, aged 4. He has been farming in his hometown of Litein for 5 years, producing and selling tea, vegetables and milk to the local market. He gets additional income from his teaching employment.  He currently employs two farmhands.

Patrick has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to fund the construction of a green house.  He says he will grow tomatoes in the greenhouse and expects to get more income to purchase a pure-bred dairy cows. He adds that more farming income will help him educate his children.   

Patrick laments about the lack of dairy feeds, especially during the dry seasons.  He is greatful to Juhudi.  This is his a second loan request after the first one of 30,000 KES.

loans.use: construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Jose Edilberto

texts.es:
José, se dedica a prestar servicio como motorista de una moto taxi, dando el transporte a las personas del lugar, vive junto a su esposa y una hija de 6 años de edad, él trabaja desde hace dos años en su propio medio de transporte, todos los días de la semana de 6:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente necesita comprar láminas, cemento, ladrillo y demás materiales de construcción, esta compra le ayudara para iniciar la construcción de su pequeña casa, donde pueda tener a su familia, dándoles mayor seguridad y comodidad.
El objetivo de José es que su familia se encuentre bien, que gocen de salud y que hoy cuenten con una casa propia.
texts.en:
José devotes himself to providing services as the driver of a moto-taxi, giving rides to people from the area. He lives with his wife and a six-year-old daughter. He has worked for two years with his own means of transport, every day of the week from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Currently he needs to purchase sheeting, cement, bricks and other construction materials, a purchase which will help him begin construction on the small house where he would have his family, giving them greater safety and comfort. 

José's objective is that his family would be well, in good health, and that now they may have their own home.

loans.use: to purchase sheeting, cement and brick.

loans.name: Verekano

texts.en: Verekano, a married father of six children who lives in his own house in Hoima, Uganda, has been fishing for 10 years, a livelihood that has enabled him to provide the basics for his family. Now requesting a loan to purchase a boat, he faces the challenge of fish depletion due to government negligence in enforcing its fishing policy. Verekano's dream is to acquire a fishing tender at the shore and buy two more boats.

loans.use: to buy a boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store and to make Mexican sandwiches.

loans.name: Essoham

texts.fr:
Essoham est un homme âgé de 29 ans. Il est marié à une couturière et n’ont pas encore d’enfants.
Essoham travaille comme revendeur de cartes de recharges depuis 01an. Il sert ses clients de façon ambulante dans les zones de HEDZRANAWOE, ATTIEGOU et achète chez les grossistes à LOME.
Essoham a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharges.  
Dans les prochaines années, Essoham voudrait avoir une boutique pour vendre des crédits, et ajouter d’autres activités complémentaires.
texts.en:
Essoham is a 29-year-old man. He is married to a clothier, and they have no children. He has been working as a retailer of mobile phone recharge cards for a year. He serves his customers by going door to door in the areas of HEDZRANAWOE and ATTIEGOU. He makes his purchases from wholesalers in Lomé, the capital of Togo. 

Essoham has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy some phone cards. In the next few years, he would like to have a shop for selling [mobile phone minutes] and to add on additional complementary businesses.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards

loans.name: Abdurofe

texts.ru: Абдурофеъ 18 лет занимается бизнесом. Он женат и имеет троих несовершеннолетних детей. Он на рынке занимается торговлей сухофруктов. Его жена домохозяйка. Он закупает оптом сухофрукты летом, в сезон занимается сушкой фруктов, а зимой перепродает их. От полученных доходов построил дом. Хочет получить $3000 США для оптового закупа сухофруктов. Он надеется на получение займа и благодарен вам.
texts.en: Abdurofe has been involved in business for 18 years.  He is married and has three adolescent children.  He sells dried fruits at a market.  Abdurofe's wife is a homemaker.  He buys dried fruits wholesale in the summer, dries fruits during the season and then resells them in the winter.  He used his business profits to build a house.  Abdurofe wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the wholesale purchase of dried fruits.  He hopes to get this loan and is grateful to you.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.es:
El grupo Restauración lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Liliam de Fátima Artola quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y perfumes desde hace 10 años. Ella con el crédito comprara pacas de ropa y mercadería en perfumes aprovechando la temporada. 
Las otras integrantes son Justina de 54 años quien vende granos básicos e Isabel de 33 años tiene una pequeña y modesta pulpería.
texts.en:
Three hard-working and enterprising people make up the Restauración group.  One of them is Liliam de Fátima Artola, who has worked for 10 years  selling clothing and perfume.  With the loan she will buy bales of clothes and perfume merchandise to take advantage of the season.

The other members are Justina, 54, who sells staple foods, and Isabel, 33, who has a small and modest store.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes and perfume.

loans.name: Juan Fernando

texts.es: El señor Juan Fernando es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos, el trabaja como jardinero en una casa particular, con este ingreso y a base de mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su familia. Pero le esta preocupando la seguridad ya que su casa no cuenta con las protecciones en las ventanas y solicita este préstamo para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar y colocar las protecciones y así su familia va estar mas segura cuando estén en casa.
texts.en:
Juan is a family man and has two children. He works as a gardener at a private house, with this income and a thanks to a lot of effort, he has helped his family to succeed. 

But he is worried about safety as his house has no security devices on the windows and he is asking for this loan so he can pay someone to install the necessary protection. His family will then be safer when they are at a home.

loans.use: to buy security devices for the windows and doors of his home.

loans.name: Rabeea

texts.en:
Rabeea, 49 years old and widowed, was left with three sons and one daughter. She is a hardworking mother and a fighter who started a small home-based business 20 years ago on a small scale, selling clothes. 

Four years ago, Rabeea was able to open her own store in the market and fill it with different types of clothes. Her son Firas now helps her in the store. Now, Rabeea has applied for a loan to add more winter clothes to what they sell as we have entered the season.

Because Rabeea is a conservative person, she has requested that her son Firas appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: To add more seasonal winter clothes to what they sell.

loans.name: Paola Katherine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Paola, tiene 28  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 y de 1 año  de edad, el  mayor esta en primero de básica. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días de la semana. Ella lleva cinco años dedicada a este negocio. Por esta ocasión ella también va a utilizar el crédito para comprar material de pesca como son las redes, arpones, combustible y otros materiales para que su esposo ya que él tiene una pequeña embarcación en la que todos los días se dedican  a estas faenas de pesca.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y materiales de pesca. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los bajos intereses que se cobran por los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener otra lancha para el negocio de su esposo ya que la que tiene es muy pequeña.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Mar communal bank meets every two weeks in the pretty beach community of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are well visited year round by native and foreign tourists.  The majority of the residents here work in fishing and maritime jobs.

Here we met Paola.  She is 28 years old and married, and has two children from this relationship, ages 5 and 1.  The oldest child is in the first year of elementary school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  She is a housewife who works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to have her own income.  She sells door-to-door and works three days a week.  She has been doing this work for five years.

This time she is also going to use the loan to buy fishing supplies such as nets, harpoons, fuel, and other materials for her husband, since he has a small boat on which he works maritime jobs every day.  This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and fishing supplies.

She has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because of the low interest rates they charge for the loans.  Her dream is to have a new motorboat for her husband's business since the one he has is very small.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Delia Emerita

texts.es:
Delia  tiene 20 años vive en unión libre, vive con el compañero  y con el hijo de 1 año. Vive en el Recinto San Temistocles en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Delia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  comprar un terreno.
Le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Delia is 20 years old.  She lives with her partner and her one-year-old son in San Temistocles, in Ventanas canton.

The Narcisa de Jesus community bank is located in San Temistocles, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Delia is a farmer who has been growing corn for two years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market in the same place.

Delia will use the loan that she requested to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  The loan will help her to increase her income which means she will be able to help her family and invest.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

In her free time, Delia likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn and rice

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 37-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been running a retail shop for the last two years, and the major hardships are: price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a goal of moving his business to a more permanent location. The purpose of the loan is to buy soap, sugar, and matchboxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Ms Phuong is 19 years old with one small child. She is managing a small wood workshop that makes household furiniture. Her business started two years ago. Through a neighbour, she learned about SEDA's micro credit program. For her first new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 Vietnam dong to buy wood as material.

Ms Hang is 38 years old. She is raising chickens and pigs. She wants to have a loan of 7,840,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy wood as material

loans.name: Wangninan 10 Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAN 10 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sènanmie Viviane (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 34 ans. Sènanmie Viviane est mariée à un certain Daniel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Sènanmie Viviane et son mari. Pour cette raison, Sènanmie Viviane vend des condiments depuis vingt ans. Parallèlement à cela, Sènanmie Viviane vend de façon saisonnière des oignons, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Sènanmie Viviane s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sènanmie Viviane sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANGNINAN 10, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs d'oignons et des condiments.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a hardworking man who lives Masindi district. He does farming whereby he grows maize, beans, groundnuts and sugarcane. He started this business thirty years ago. He begun by using a small portion of land for farming and there after accumulated savings and bought his own land to carry out his farming activity. He is seeking for a loan for weeding and buying fertilizers, and pesticides. His dreams are to enlarge his farm and construct a house but he encounters a problem of unstable prices, weather vagaries and pests and diseases.

loans.use: for weeding and buying fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paualina is a very active person and she is searching for a better quality of life for her family. Her husband is an upholsterer working for a company. His salary is poor and it is not enough to give his children what they need, such as an education. For this reason she contributes and supports her household with the business she started some time ago, the sale of shoes by catalogue. Paulina has struggled a great deal for the sake of her family, moved by the great love she feels for them and always motivated by teh support that they give her.

She now needs a loan of $200 to invest in merchandise and increase her income, that is very much needed in their home. You can help Pualina keep moving forward and and in turn she can help support her family. Your generosirty is of great help to her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina es una persona muy activa y se interesa mucho por mejorar la calidad de vida de familia, ya que su esposo, que es tapicero, trabaja en un negocio que no tiene buen ingreso y no es suficiente para poder darles a sus hijos lo necesario, como educación. Por ello ella colabora y apoya a la casa con la actividad que hace tiempo inició, la venta de zapatos por catálogo. Paulina ha luchado mucho para poder sacar adelante a su familia movida por el gran amor que les tiene e impulsada siempre por el apoyo que ellos le brindan.

Ahora ella necesita de un crédito de $200 DLLS para poder invertir en mercancía e incrementar sus ingresos, ya que los necesitan mucho en su casa. Tu puedes ayudar a Paulina a seguir adelante y a que ella pueda a su vez apoyar a su familia, tu generosidad es de mucha ayuda para ella.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nchose would like to buy a variety of new beads materials.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and a father of six children who are all in primary school. He started his business in 1997 when he realized there was unmet demand in his home village. He operates a retail shop.  His wife is a farmer. He has not undertaken any formal training concerning his business. Because there are very few shops in his village, Peter has access to customers from all-over the place.  He gets his stock from Malaba town centre where he goes once or twice per week according to the needs and demands of his customers. Through his business, Peter has been able to support his wife in farming by buying fertilizer and also hiring manual workers who work hand in hand with her. He has also been able to educate his children and provide for the whole family in general. If granted the loan of $150 from PEMCI, Peter wishes to increase his shop’s stock.

loans.use: To increase the stock in his shop

loans.name: Martina Isabel

texts.en:
Martina is 35 years old and lives with her common-law partner and their children, 11 and 15 years old. Her partner works in construction. Two years ago, Martina started her own business preparing and selling foods to help improve her family's quality of life. She had gained experience in this industry while working with her sister, who ran a similar business. Little by little she has gained many customers and her business has grown significantly.

Martina also does catering for special events and she has been asked to cater a wedding. She is asking for a loan of US $250 to buy the ingredients and supplies she will need to meet this order. She agrees to repay the loan over a period of 4 months and thanks you for providing her with the opportunity to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Martina tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos, de 11 y 15 años de edad. Su pareja se dedica a la construcción y para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Martina decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace dos años con la elaboración y venta de comidas, anteriormente le ayudaba a su hermana que tenía un negocio similar, en donde adquirió experiencia y después decidió independizarse, poco a poco fue dándose a conocer y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado tener muchos clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.,

Martina también elabora banquetes para eventos especiales y en estos momentos tiene un pedido para boda, pero no cuenta con los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos, por este motivo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de los insumos que necesita, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Martina y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de poder mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Siti Maryam

texts.id:
Siti Maryam's family has been living in Bali for five years. She lives with her husband and two children in a traditional woven-bambo walled, asbestos roofed and dirt floored house. The house is near the river bank, so they can take a bath and do laundry in the river. The house also serves as her business place. Together with her husband, she sells fish chips. Siti does the production and her husband sells the chips around the village. Their daily profit can go as high as 60,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR). With a living cost of 30,000 per day they can still save a little. The loan will be used to increase the working capital. They receive an increase of orders during the month of Ramadan. Hence, the loan she receives this month can help her increase her inventory that eventually turns into additional profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Keluarga Siti Maryam sudah hampir 5 tahun tinggal di Bali. Dia tinggal bersama suami dan dua orang anaknya di rumah kontrakkan. Rumah dengan dinding gedhek, atap asbes dan lantai tanah. Rumahnya dekat dengan sungai. Jadi mereka mandi dan mencuci baju di sungai. Rumahnya sekaligus tempat usahanya. Bersama suaminya dia berusaha jualan krupuk. Bu Siti bagian pembuatan, suaminya bagian pemasaran keliling. Keuntungan per hari mereka dapat mencapai Rp 60.000,00. Dengan biaya hidup Rp 30.000,00 per hari, mereka masih bisa menabung. Pinjaman yang dia dapatkan akan digunakan untuk menambah modal usaha. Mereka akan menerima banyak pesanan pada saat bulan puasa. Artinya, modal yang diterimanya bulan ini akan dapat menambah persediaan krupuk yang akan dijualnya. Hal ini tentunya akan menambah keuntungannya.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, cooking oil and cooking fuel

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo S. is 32 years old, married and has one son.

Ever since he was a young man, Eduardo has had many different types of jobs. Today, he makes a living for himself and his family going door-to-door selling cleaning supplies such as detergent, fabric softener, bleach, brooms and other articles.

He had been doing this for three years, and is doing well but would like to expand his business by purchasing additional supplies to sell. To make this possible, he has come to us for a loan to purchase new items such as baking soda, distilled water and chlorine.

loans.use: Purchase of items to sell such as baking soda, distilled water, chlorine, etc.

loans.name: Sukardiono

texts.id:
H. sells fried snacks every day. His snacks are sold in packages. He can sell 125-200 packages per day. Each package is sold for 2,500 IDR (1USD ~9000 IDR). He is being helped by his wife. The business gives him a profit of 50,000 IDR per day. In addition to selling fried snacks, H. sees a business opportunity in buying and selling motorcycles. Since his current business would not be enough to get him to get into the new business, he is looking for loan of 5,000,000 IDR. He estimates that he would earn additional profit of ~100,000 IDR per week.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi MaH., Kiva Volunteer.

Setiap hari H. berjualan gorengan. Jenis gorengan yang dia jual sudah dibungkus. Dia mampu menjual 125 – 200 bungkus per harinya. Per bungkus gorengan seharga Rp 2.500,00. Dia dibantu oleh isterinya. Usaha ini memberikan keuntungan baginya sebesar Rp 50.000,00/hari. Di samping berjualan gorengan, H. melihat peluang di Usaha Jual Beli Sepeda Motor. Karena hasil dari Jual Gorengan tidak mencukupi untuk bisnis barunya, maka dia mencari pinjaman modal Rp 5.00.000,00. Dia memperkirakan akan mendapat keuntungan kira – kira Rp 100.000,00/minggu.

loans.use: capital for buying and selling motorcycles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea P., 35, is a mother of five children. She works as a housewife who cooks for her family. Her husband works as a construction foreman at a construction site, and makes an average of $4 per day. Two of her children work as chefs, and make about $100 per month. Another one of her children is a bus driver, and the remaining two are too young to attend school. Mrs. Chea P. will use her loan to buy construction tools for her husband. In addition, she plans to install protection for her house from flooding during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy construction’s tools for her husband and install her house to prevent flooding during a rainy season.

loans.name: Luis Rubén

texts.es:
It has been 18 years since Mr. Luis Ruben R. began selling shoes and clothing in the municipality of Condega in the beautiful city of Estela in Nicaragua. Mr. R. has dedicated a lot of time and effort to his business, selling merchandise to consumers with the support of his wife who is also a housewife.

One of the needs that Mr. Luis R. has is the urgency of obtaining merchandise. During the last two years Ceprodel has granted him loans which Mr. R. has used to purchase merchandise from his suppliers. Once again he needs funds to acquire merchandise, and this is why he is asking CEPRODEL for another loan, and therefore, continue to develop his business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Luis Ruben R. desde hace 18 años inició su negocio de venta de zapatos y ropa en general en su localidad de habitación en el municipio de Condega de la bella ciudad de Estela en Nicaragua. Se dedica a su negocio con mucho esfuerzo vendiendo su mercadería al publico en general y con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a la labor de ama de casa.

Una de las necesidades que hoy en día atraviesa el señor Luis R. es la urgencia de obtener su mercadería para comercializarla y es por esta razón que Ceprodel desde hace dos años le ha apoyado con créditos que le han permitido adquirir los productos de sus proveedores para comercializarlas a sus clientes. Una vez mas esta necesidad se hace vigente en el señor Luis R. y es por esta razón que acude a CEPRODEL para obtener créditos que le den lugar a la adquisición de sus productos en su localidad.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Abidé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abidé H. was born on June 13, 1978 in Kadja, in the prefecture of Kozah. She is married. She owns a bar called SOURCE d’EAU in Agoè where she has been selling soft drinks since 2004. She has an open, airy place where customers can make themselves comfortable.

She is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$ 975 which will allow her to make repairs on her two freezers and purchase 55 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame H. Abidé est née le 13 juin 1978 à Kadja dans la préfecture de la Kozah. Elle est mariée. Elle est propriétaire du bar « SOURCE d’EAU » à Agoè où elle vend les boissons gazeuses depuis 2004. Elle dispose d’un espace aéré qui permet aux consommateurs de se mettre à l’aise.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’une valeur de 400.000 FCFA lui permettra de réparer deux congélateurs dont elle dispose et d’acheter 55 casiers de bières.

loans.use:
Repairing two freezers and purchasing 55 cases of beer

Réparation de 2 congélateurs et achat de 55 casiers de bières

loans.name: Fatou Manda

texts.fr:
Fatou Manda C., aged 35, and married with three children to take care of, has been a loyal member of the Sinthiang Coundara Village Bank in Vélingara for five years. She wants to buy peanuts, shell them and turn them into peanut butter to then sell. Fatou honors her commitments, and her income allows her to improve the living conditions of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou Manda C., 35 ans, mariée, 03 enfants en charge est une fidèle membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara à Vélingara depuis 5 ans. Elle veut acheter des arachides,les décortiquer, les transformer en pâte d'arachide et vendre. Fatou respecte ses engagements et ses revenus lui permettent de d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Takuru Group

texts.en:
Mariatu B. and Mariatu Sankoh both run small local restaurants in the town of Makeni. Before their first loan from SMT, they could only sell 10-15 plates a day and could not cook a variety of foods. With their previous loans, the members managed to purchase the food items on wholesale. This increased the quality and quantity of the food and also their income. They also replaced the untensils in the restaurants.

Mariatu is the leader and she is 27 years old with 3 children. Her husband works as a driver with a meager income. Both B. and Sankoh would like to expand and diversify their businesses and are thefore requesting a loan of Le.1400,000

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, palm oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in various foodstuffs for a mini-market.

loans.name: Edelmira Jamileth

texts.es:
Edelmira L. is a lady with a great spirit of self-improvement in her small grocery store business which is located in the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega. She is a person that five years ago started selling a few products but over time has managed to improve her conditions and diversify her products.

Today she has requested a loan from Ceprodel for the purpose of buying products to resell. It is necessary to emphasize that her efforts are due to her desire to offer a better standard of living to her two small children, which she has the obligation to maintain and support in all their needs.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Edelmira L. es una dama con un gran espiritu de superacion en su nego cio de pulperia el cual lo tiene ubicado en el municipio de El Viejo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una persona que desde hace cinco años inició vendiendo pocos productos pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado mejorar su condicion y ha diversificado sus productos.

Hoy en dia ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un credito con el proposito de comprar sus productos para comercializarlos. Es necesario destacar que sus esfuerzos se deben a su interes por brindarles un mejor nivel de vida a sus dos pequeños hijos los cuales tiene la obligacion de mantener y apoyarlos en todas sus necesidades.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina baji, the wife of M. A., lives in an area of Lahore, Pakistan called Ismail Nagar. Preferring to do household work and take care of her family, she has resided in her two room brick house for the last 17 years, the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is a tailor by profession while her other son is in 3rd standard and her daughter is in 2nd standard. Rubina baji's husband is a tailor by profession with 35 years of experience. \t Rubina baji fully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institution of Pakistan) and is now applying for a new loan to buy a sewing machine for her husband. She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Parveen baji wants a loan to buy beams and rope for her shuttering business; Suraiya baji wants to purchase seasonal fruits to resell; Ghafooran baji wishes to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle), while Tahira baji wants a loan to buy more meat to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta baji is a wife of Y. M. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived there for the last six years and is the mother of two daughters, both of whom are enrolled in a local school. Shagufta baji's husband is a laborer. She runs a business selling cloth and has been in this line of work for the last five years. She is applying for a loan to expand to her business by buying more clothes to sell.

She is joined in her loan group by a several other people. Elizabeth baji wants a loan to buy spices to sell in a market and various shops. Haseena baji and Elizabeth baji each want a loan to buy scrap (such as plastic bottles and iron) for their scrap business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for several small businesses

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de dos hijos, estudió el segundo año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Lima 115, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. En un inicio, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró fruta para vender en el mercado. A la edad de 12 años empezó a vender frutas en diferentes ferias de Juli. Manifiesta que le era muy difícil aprender en la escuela y por eso se retiró para dedicarse solamente al negocio de venta de frutas. Actualmente en sus tiempos libres trabaja en bordados y continua con el negocio de venta de frutas.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 cajas de mango a S/.120 y 3 cajas de manzanas a S/.180.00.

Su sueño es construir su casa y poner un negocio en ella.
texts.en:
Lucila is 32 years old, is married, a mother of two children, she studied until the second year of high school and lives at Jr. Lima 115, Juli district, province of Chuchito, department of Puno. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank “Niño San Salvador” of Juli. With her first loan of 300 soles (US $100), she bought fruit to sell at the market. At the age of 12 she began selling fruit in different markets in Juli. She said that it was very difficult to learn at school and so she left to dedicate herself solely to the business of selling fruit. Currently, in her free time, she works with embroidery and continues her business selling fruit. With this loan of 500 soles (US $ 175 ) which will be paid off in 4 months, she will purchase 3 boxes of mangoes for 120 soles (US $40) and 3 boxes of apples for 180 soles (US $ 55 ) Her dream is to build her own house and put a business in it.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 boxes of manggoes and 3 boxes of apples

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 43 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Se dedica al cultivo de naranjas, actividad que empezó hace 0 años y ahora le agrada realizar. A Fredy le encanta sembrar plantas de naranja, con el tiempo desea poder  incrementar su producción y poder trasladar sus productos a la sierra  y tener mayores ingresos económicos, pero por ahora está esforzándose trabajando en diversas  haciendas, sin descuidar sus propios terrenos de cultivos. Para Fredy lo rentable de sus cultivos es que no requiere de muchos cuidados como otros  productos, pero lo difícil es poder sembrar las plantas de cítricos, es un proceso que requiere de mucha paciencia. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, no ha tenido problemas hasta el momento en  sus pagos. Fredy  invertirá lo solicitado en nuevas plantaciones de cítricos que le ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fredy is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. He grows oranges, which he started doing 0 years ago and now he enjoys it. Fredy takes pleasure in planting the orange crops and he would like to increase his production and move his products to the mountains to make more money. Right now he is working at various properties while still paying attention to his own fields. For Fredy, the profitability of the citrus plants does not require much care like other crops, but the difficulty is the patience needed when planting the crops. This is his second loan with MFP; he has not yet had problems with his payments. Fredy will invest the money in new citrus fields that will help him increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer
