She works seven days a week at two jobs: selling bananas and cleaning the facilities of the Kampala City Council. She is applying for a loan for 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. Her main business challenges are the high cost of transportation and the seasonal nature of her work. Her goal for the future is to help improve her family's living standards. She lives in her own house but does not have access to electricity or piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and providing food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel es mecánico tiene 20 años dedicándose a este oficio, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Donde su vivienda  es pequeña por lo que empezó a construir mas cuartos en la planta alta, pero le esta haciendo falta la losa de concreto ya que necesitan sus hijos su propio espacio en la casa. 
Desea tener un mejor patrimonio, seguridad y comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is a mechanic who has 20 years of experience in that profession; he is married and has two children.  His house is small, and therefore he started constructing more rooms on the top floor.  However, he lacks concrete slabs for construction, and his children need their own space in the house.
Juan Manuel wants his family to have more wealth, security, and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase concrete slabs for construction.

loans.name: Faiz Elahi's Group

texts.en:
Faiz Elahi is 48 years old, very active and performs her routine tasks very well. She also sews clothes for her neighboring clients to earn income for her family. She started this business long time ago because her husband who is a tailor was not able to fulfill the financial needs of the family alone.
Faiz has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are attached to sewing and tailoring profession.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her finishing the orders on time and increase her profits.
She is confident that an investment will help making her business more profitable and she will be able to buy some dowry for her daughter who is now near to marriage age.
Note: "In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Faiz elahi."

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, Salome has operated a grocery business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with delayed payments from those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, cabbages and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, cabbages and green vegetables.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 23 años, es una mujer buena, amable y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene una hija de tres años, viven en una casa propia en donde comparten la alegría de educar y criar a su hija por quien hacen todos los esfuerzos y sacrificios necesarios para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Elena consiste en la venta de golosinas y productos de consumo de preferencia de los niños, posee un puesto en donde realiza su venta de golosinas. Éste se encuentra ubicada en uno de los parques mas concurridos de su ciudad, su día normalmente comienza a las 8 de la mañana y termina pasadas las 6 de la tarde. Entre todo este tiempo ella aprovecha algunos minutos de poca venta para ir a ver a su hija, quien todavía es muy pequeña y necesita mucha atención. Es una de las cosas que más le complican en su trabajo, pero también es algo que sabe que pronto podrá superar,  ya que su hija crece cada día mas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar otras actividades, a la vez que cuida su puesto de golosinas. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todo el día, espera que con el tiempo pueda poner una tienda donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 7 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidaria. Espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir aumentando su negocio. Esta convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagara sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará más variedad de golosinas para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y así tenerlo mas implementado.
texts.en:
Elena, 23 years old, is a good women, friendly and hardworking. She lives with her partner with whom she has a 3 year old daughter. They live in their own home where they share the happiness of educating and bringing up their daughter and they put forth all their strength and make the necessary sacrifices in order to provide her a good quality of life.

Elena’s work consists of selling sweets and products that children enjoy eating. She has a stand where she sells her sweets. It is located in one of the busiest parks in the city. Her day normally begins at 8:00AM in the morning and finishes at 6:00PM in the afternoon. During this time she takes advantage of any moments when sales are low to go see her daughter who is still very young and needs a lot of attention. It is one of the things that complicate her work, but too it is something that she knows will soon pass, as each day her daughter grows a bit more.

The thing that she like most about her work is the freedom that she has to do other activities at the same time she is at her sweet stand. She has been doing this for three years and what she considers the most difficult thing about her work is having to be under the relentless sun all day. She hopes that with time she will be able to have a store where she can serve her clients better. 

This will be her 7th loan with MFP. She has always been a good member of the communal bank which she likes very much because of the care and unity. She hopes that you can provide the loan that will back her up so she can continue to expand her business. She is convinced that she would continue being a very punctual member and would pay her installments on time as she has done with all her loans so far. With the 1500 soles, she will have a greater variety of sweets to offer her customers and thus, more of it will be sold.

loans.use: to buy more sweets to supply her business

loans.name: Phalen's Group

texts.en:
Phalen is a widow and the 51-year-old mother of six children: five daughters and one son. For a fee, she provides a rice milling service to her village which is in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She uses her profits to support her family. She has been in this business for five years. 

Phalen received her first loan from VisionFund in 2004. The previous loans have helped her with her daily living and also to make some savings. She currently earns about five U.S. dollars per day. She successfully repaid the loans with VisionFund. Now she is applying for another loan with her group member Malin who joined VisionFund for this loan cycle. 

Phalen plans to use this entire loan to repair her car which she uses for her rice milling service. She hopes she can provide full and fast service to the villagers and earn more income so she can set aside some money for house renovation and necessary household comforts.

loans.use: To repair the car which she uses for her rice milling service.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is 52 years old and has three adult children. She is a farmer who grows rice and raises pigs for meat. Tu joined this credit program in 2008 and has used her previous loans effectively to expanding her business and construct a sty. 

Tu is requesting an 8,288,000 VND loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Meshark's Group

texts.en:
Meshark is 44 years old, has 6 children, and lives in Koogo Kochieng village in Ndhiwa sub county Kenya. Meshark works as a subsistence farmer for a living. His community of Koogo Kochieng village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne disease. Meshark is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected promoter by his village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Meshark represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Meshark and two other promoters in his community, namely Lonna and Emily, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Meshark wants to be a promoter because he believes that the dispenser system will help treat water making it safe and preventing water-borne diseases in the community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Meshark’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Raban

texts.en:
Raban is a farmer rearing chicken and goats. He is from Kagadi- Uganda and has been in Poultry farming most of his life. Through farming he has been able to build a house and educate his 4 children. In future, he wants to buy a vehicle to help him in transporting his chicken and goats to the city.
He wants a loan to buy chicken for rearing.

loans.use: To buy chicken for rearing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business of making concrete products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nelly wants to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Beena

texts.en:
Beena K. has two daughters who attend middle school. She lives in joint family with her mother-in-law because her husband is the youngest son. According to Nepalese culture mothers live with their youngest son. 
Beena already owns two cows and she has been selling milk in the area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition.
Beena lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing.
She carries her milk containers and sells door to door daily in the morning and evening.  Because of the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production.  Beena plans to purchase a jersey cow which produces more milk than normal cows.  She has grassland of her own, so she does not have to buy food for her cows.

loans.use: To buy a young milk giving cow

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is originally from Escobedo in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She is a married mother of six children, all of whom are also married. Her husband is retired, and to be able to meet their basic necessities Gloria started her own business eight years ago selling clothes and toys. She has a post at the local markets, and little by little her stock has improved, increasing her sales. With the help of her children she has been able to make her business grow.

Currently, Gloria is requesting a loan of $550, which she will use to purchase supplies in order to offer her clients a wider selection and stay on their good graces. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be a part of Gloria's success. Gloria and her family are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Gloria es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León, es casada y tiene siete hijos, todos ellos ya casados. Su esposo es jubilado y para poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar Gloria inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y juguetes hace ocho años, se instala en los mercados ambulantes y poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor, incrementando sus ventas y con la ayuda de sus hijos ha hecho crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Gloria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y continuar con su preferencia, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Gloria y decídete a apoyarla hoy, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and toys

loans.name: Julio Víctor

texts.es:
Sr. Julio is a 46 year old man who lives in a humble home with his loving wife and two small children. We find him to be a man of a strict personality, industrious, but most of all, loving and kind. His characteristic personality has helped form a very responsible, kind, and loving family.

All members of the family work the fields sowing potatoes, gladiolus, broad beans and corn. The income covers the cost of education and essential needs for the well-being of each member of the family, but sometimes unexpected events happen. A short time ago his little girl fell ill with bronchitis and it was necessary to take her to the hospital. The high cost of doctors and medicine provoked an imbalance in the economy of the family, and again this generated a drop in the crop and sale of products. They still haven´t recovered economically and for that reason they require a loan of $175 in order to buy seeds to increase the crop and recover the family´s economic balance. Let's help this family increase their life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Julio es un hombre de 46 años; habita una humilde morada en compañía de sus dos pequeños hijos y su amorosa esposa. En él podemos percibir una personalidad estricta, trabajadora pero sobre todo amorosa y amable, estos aspectos siempre lo han caracterizado y le han ayudado a formar una familia muy responsable, amigable y afectuosa. Todos los miembros de su familia se dedican a sembrar papa, gladiolos, habas y maíz productos de los que obtienen una suma considerable de dinero que destinan a cubrir los gastos de educación y primeras necesidades para bienestar de todos y cada de los miembros de su hogar. A pesar de que aparentemente todo marcha bien en casa los inconvenientes no dejan de presentarse; hace poco su pequeña niña enfermó de bronquios y para su pronta recuperación tuvieron que internarla en un nosocomio de su ciudad; las exigencias médicas y el alto costo de cada una de las medicinas hicieron que la familia tuviera un gran desequilibrio económico que les generó grandes desniveles en los negocios de cultivo y venta de productos. Aún no se recuperan de manera general y tampoco han alcanzado una estabilidad parcial. A raíz de esta razón hace la solicitud de un préstamo por un monto de 175 dólares que destinará a incrementar la siembra de productos a fin de lograr pronto el equilibrio económico familiar. Hagamos que esta familia en corto tiempo incremente su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to increase crops.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome makes all types of clothes and sells them at the local market. She is married and has three children ages 12, 14, and 18 years old. Her husband works with Salome in her business. Their income is too low to support their family. Salome is very hard-working.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials and expand their business. She proposes to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you. SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases beck the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Buying new sewing machines

loans.name: Nive

texts.en: Nive, 54, has seven children and currently runs a bingo business and farms her plantation. Nive belongs to a group of 19 people who received loans, and only 11 people are currently active in the group. She has helped her group pay off the loans of the inactive members. She makes a good profti from her business and has improved her family's quality of life in many ways. Nive is applying for this loan to build fencing around her plantation and purchase prizes for her bingo games.

loans.use: To buy fencing for her plantation and prizes for her bingo business

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Ruben began his grocery business when his job was eliminated. He and his wife decidd to invest the money he received from his former employer in the business, now called Abarrotes Jethzi ("Jethizi Groceries") after one of their young daughters. Since then, the business has provided for the family.

Ruben is applying for a US$550 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, so that he can finish converting and air-conditioning what used to be a room in his house to a grocery. He's already operating the space as a store but he needs to finish the conversion. With your help, Ruben will be able to make his dream of having his own business come true so that he can help his daughters have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Rubén empezó su negocio de venta de abarrotes cuando lo liquidaron de su trabajo, por consejo de su esposa decidieron invertir el dinero de su liquidación en el negocio de Abarrotes, al cual le pusieron el nombre de una de sus pequeñas hijas Abarrotes Jethzi. Desde entonces este negocio ha sido el sostén de la familia.

Rubén está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con este dinero Rubén podrá terminar la remodelación y acondicionamiento del local, ya que ocupaba uno de los cuartos de su casa para la tienda. Hoy ya tiene su local y necesita terminarlo. Con tu ayuda Rubén podrá hacer su sueño realidad de tener un propio negocio que le ayude a que sus hijas tengan un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Finish shop conversion and remodel.

loans.name: Puch

texts.en: Puch H. is 55, married, and has six children. She works at home cooking and supporting her children, while her husband, works at the Siem Reap province as a commune officer. Together, the family earns about $4 a day from his work. Three of her children earn about $3 a day working in construction, while the other three are still in school. The couple is requesting a total of $400 to renovate and improve their house and living conditions.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to renovate their house

loans.name: Jilma

texts.es:
Jilma has always been a businesswoman. As her family grew, her expenses started increasing and her husband’s salary was insufficient to cover all of their demands. For that reason she decided to increase her income in innumerable ways so that the development of her loving children would not be limited. She currently makes a living selling American clothing, and buying and selling cheese. With these two activities, she tries to cover entirely the necessities in her home and the education of her 4 children. To accomplish this, she acquires her merchandise in bundles in the city of Puno then sells it in the little towns in the outskirts of the city. Because she is constantly traveling, she takes advantage of the delicious cheeses found in the towns and purchases them to sell in the cities of Juliaca and Puno. In doing this, Jilma has noticed the need to increase her capital, for which reason she wishes to obtain a loan with the goal of increasing her sales and her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Jilma, siempre fue una mujer de negocios, conforme llegaban más miembros a su hogar, sus gastos se fueron incrementando y el sueldo de su esposo era insuficiente para cubrir todas las demandas de su familia, es por ello que decidió de innumerables formas mejorar sus ingresos económicos para que así sus queridos hijos no limiten su desarrollo.Ella actualmente está dedicada al negocio de comercialización de ropa americana y de compra y venta de quesos, con estas dos actividades trata de suplir completamente las necesidades de su hogar y la educación de sus 4 hijos.Para este fin adquiere su mercadería por fardos en la ciudad de Puno, y los oferta en los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad, como se encuentra en constante viaje aprovecha en adquirir deliciosos quesos de esos pueblitos para comercializarlos en las ciudades de Juliaca y Puno. En esta oportunidad Jilma ha observado la necesidad de aumentar el capital de su negocio, es por ello que desea obtener un préstamo a fin de incrementar sus ventas y la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase capital to offer her products in greater quantities.

loans.name: Leann

texts.en: Mrs. Leann S., 30, is a farmer who lives in Koh Kok Village, Kampong Cham Province. S. earns about $3.66 per day. Her husband, Mr. Um Narith, is a 35-year-old farmer who also makes about  $3.66 per day. They have three children, all of whom are young. With growing family expenses, they need to increase their income. They request a loan of $1,100 to purchase small pigs to raise and ducklings to lay eggs. By using this loan they will get more income and be able to support their family effectively.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs and ducklings

loans.name: Saly Sagna

texts.fr:
Saly Sagna Sambout, 49 years old, is married with 4 of her brothers' children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Château d'eau in Ziguinchor for 4 years. Her business consists of making traditional African outfits in Bignogna and sending them to France for sale. With her income, she takes part in the support of her family. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Saly Sagna S., 49 ans, mariée 04 enfants de ses frères en charge est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau à Ziguinchor depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste a confectionner des ensembles traditionnels africains à Bignona et de les envoyer en France pour la vente. Avec ses revenus elle participe à l’entretien de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To make traditional African outfits

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia began her business to help her husband with the household expenses. His income was not enough to cover their costs, as he did not have steady work. She began selling home products by catalog. She started 3 years ago, only selling by request and doing small presentations house to house to her neighbors and friends.

Now Patricia is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 5 months, so she can purchase more merchandise and make more demonstrations, and fill her customers requests more quickly.

Patricia inició el negocio para salir adelante por por necesidad dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar, ya que el no tenia un trabajo fijo esto la obligo a salir adelante por si misma y empezo a vender blancos por catalogo. Comenzó hace 3 años solo vendiendo sobre pedidos y pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas, asi como casa por casa

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US$400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y poder realizar demostraciones asi como agilizar los tiempo de pedido para que sea menor para sus clientes.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE TO BETTER MEET HER CUSTOMERS REQUESTS

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala tiene 66 años D. edad, no pudo estudiar, ella vive sola es separada D. su esposo , con quien tuvo cuatro hijos, son independientes y radican tanto en Lima como en Tacna. La casa donD. vive esta ubicada en Barrio Marccajja, tiene luz y letrina el agua es consumida D. un pozo común. Del Distrito D. Unicachi. La señora Pascuala se dedica a la venta D. comida en el comedor popular “Maria Parado D. Bellido” del distrito D. Unicachi a esta actividad se dedica desD. hace 15 años atrás. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “San Pedro D. Unicachi” donD. saco un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 comprando víveres. Con este crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 soles, que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará diversos insumos y víveres para el negocio y dos ovejas. Ella es beneficiaria del vaso D. leche, estando en el banco comunal aprendió a ser solidaria en la atención que brinda es muy amable. Esta agradecida con el crédito, porque le permite trabajar y salir adelante.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Sra. Pascula is 66 years old, separated from her husband and has 4 children who are all living independent in Lima or Tacna; she was unable to study as a child. The house where she lives is located in the Marccajja Neighborhood and has electricity, a latrine and water that comes from a community reservoir. Sra. Pascuala sells food in the market “Maria Parado D. Bellido” in the Unicachi District where she has been working for 15 years. She is also a member of the Banco Comunal “San Pedro D. Unicachi” where she initially took out a loan for 300 soles to buy supplies. With this loan of 1000 soles (which will be paid in 4 payments) she will buy a number of diverse supplies for her business and two sheep. She is also a beneficiary of the organization “Vaso D. Leche” and via this experience has learned that the Communal Bank provides good service and she has also become supportive of them. She is very thankful for this loan because it allows her to work and to get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and livestock (sheep)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hiên tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 1998 sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị mạnh dạn vay vốn về để đi thu mua phế liệu. Với thu nhập  từ việc đi thu mua phế liệu khoảng 100.000 đồng/ ngày, sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương  kinh tế gia đình chị đã dần đi lên anh chị đã làm được nhà mái bằng và mua sắm được một số trang thiết bị trong gia đình. Hiện nay chồng chị đã  không đ ủ  sức  khoẻ  để  tiếp  tục  đi thu mua phế  liệu  nên chị muốn vay vốn về mua 3 con bò cho chồng nuôi còn chị tiếp tục  công việc đi thu mua phế liệu về bán. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 đ.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hiên joined the TYM Fund in 1998. After joining the fund, she worked hard to borrow money to purchase and resell scraps. With the income of about 100,000 VND from reselling scraps, after 10 years of participating in the fund, the family's finanicial situation has gone up. They have been about to make a level roof and purchase some personal things for the family. Currently, her husband doesn't have enough strength to continue their scrap reselling business therefore she wants to borrow a loan to purchase three cows for her husband to care for, while she continues their scrap reselling business. For this loan, she would like to raise 15,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Livestock (cattle)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Pham T. T. is 45 years old. Before she only specialized in raising animals and growing rice. Then she learnt of the experience of other women in her center and decided to borrow loans from TYM to open a grocery. With the assistance of her husband and 2 children, her business has been going on well. Today many kinds of goods can be found in her grocery: cakes, sweets, fertilizer, etc. With an income of  VND 3 million, she wants to borrow VND 18 million to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her little grocery store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay. Yolanda es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Yolanda tiene un puesto ambulatorio en el mercadillo Señor de Arequipa en donde vende abarrotes, cereales, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del día con la ayuda de su hija y por las tardes se encarga de la atención de sus hijos.

Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar. Yolanda sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, comprar un carro para pasear con su familia y viajar a otros países.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Ollantay communal bank. Yolanda is married, 45 years old and has 4 children. Yolanda is a street vendor in the “Señor de Arequipa” market, where she sells groceries and cereals. She works in her business every day from 6 in the morning until 12 in the afternoon, with the help of her daughter. In the afternoon, her sons are in charge of the business. Yolanda needs a 1050 soles loan to purchase rice, oil, and sugar. Yolanda dreams of giving her children a good education and purchasing a car for family trips and trips to other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Yolanda needs a 1050 soles loan to purchase rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Betsabe Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Betsabe C. Gormás tiene 45 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos, vive en la Mz. J lote 6 Barrio 3B distrito El Porvenir D. la ciudad D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo D. Secundaria porque se casó a los 17 años, tiene 7 hijos 6 hombres y una mujer, 3 D. los cuales  son independientes y 4 dependen D. ella.
Betsabe se dedica a la compra venta D. carne, compra carne D. res, carnero, cerdo, pollo D. los camales y venD. en un pequeño puesto del mercado Nuevo Futuro D. su barrio.
Con el primer préstamo D. 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas, invirtió en su negocio comprando un poco más D. carne D. res y D. cerdo.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará carne D. diferentes animales y también menudencia.
Betsabe sueña con tener una carnicería muy granD..
texts.en:
Mrs. Betsabe C. Gormás is 45 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos” (God GuiD. Our Steps). She lives at Mz. J lote 6 Barrio 3B in El Provenir district, Trujillo city, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed second year of secondary school and then married at 17 years of age. She has 7 children, 6 sons and 1 daughter, 3 of whom are independent and 4 still depend on her. Betsabe buys and sells meat. She buys beef, veal, pork, chicken from the slaughterhouses and sells in a small stand in the Nuevo Futuro market in her neighborhood. With the first loan for 300 soles which was repaid in 4 payments, she invested in her business buying a little more beef and pork. With this loan for 500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy different types of meat and also giblets. Betsabe dreams of having a very large butcher shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of meat

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Mrs. Tim T. is 41 years old and makes a living growing rice and vegetables, a business she started in 1982. She lives in Koktlokle Commune in Siem Reap Province, and has three young children who live at home. Her husband, Mr. Lai Thong, age 36, is a rice farmer and works with his wife. The couple can earn approximately $2 per day. Tim requests a loan to buy two oxen to help her plow a field. The loan will allow her to increase her rice yield so that it is higher than the previous year.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Mrs. Samai Nou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of eight people, is located in Khnar Rung Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Samai N. is the village bank president; she was selected by the members. She owns 0.5-hectar (1.3 acres) to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Pen Ra, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough equipment to gather palm juice. In order to re-start this business, Mrs. Samai N. is asking for a loan to buy bamboo to tie with the palm tree to climb up to gather juice. Mrs. Samai N. is 41 years old and the mother of two children who are all attending the local school. 

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to tie with the palm tree to climb up to gather palm juice for the business.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina B. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, Mr. Ram Saran B., and a son. She lives in Balkhu, Kathmandu. Most of the people in this region are engaged in running small businesses like grocery stores. Her husband works in private office. Her son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. B. opened her small tea room 2 years ago to strengthen the economic conditions of her family. She sells different varieties of food items in her shop. Especially, she prepares Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice) to sell in her shop. She also sells tea and coffee. Her tea room is small but very popular in her locality. So Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy necessary food ingredients for her shop.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Mussarat Syed Ali Ahmad Shah Group
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for a food business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. grows rice and bananas. She and her husband are farmers and they have one child. They work on a 1.5 hectare farm which gives them enough food for the family. They enjoy working together under the heat of the sun, plowing the field, and touching the dirty soil so they can give their only child a better future.

Helen is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer to increase their harvest. The loan will help her also to start a new business. 

CEVI is a microfinance organization that helps people start and have a business in the Phillippines. CEVI provides credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to all their clients to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Magnim

texts.fr: Etant une dame très dynamique Madame B. magnim s'est lancé très tôt dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques et de pagnes, le commerce de pagnes est un commerce qui est rentable à Lomé, elle fait son commerce dans le marché locale d’agoè et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, c’est pour cela  qu’elle sollicite de WAGES son premier prêt pour acheter 04 cartons de crèmes, 02 cartons de pommades, 50 mèches et des pagnes. Elle est mariée et  à  01 enfant.
texts.en:
Being a very dynamic woman, Ms. B. Magnim soon got started in the commerce of cosmetics and pagnes (colorful West African cloth). Commerce in pagnes is a profitable one in Lomé. She works at the local marketplace of Agoè and supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé. The stock of merchandise she currently has doesn’t allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers. That’s why she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES, so as to buy four boxes of cream, two boxes of ointment, fifty hair extensions, and some pagnes. She is married and has a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and cloth for resale

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Alimata S. est une veuve de 38 ans, mère de 3 garçons, qui vit avec ses enfants chez son feu père à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est initiée  aux activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers : pagnes wax,  chaussures,  parfums, tissus brodés, tasses “Super” etc  il y a maintenant six ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée  de sa clientèle (composée entre  autres  de militaires et de leurs épouses) pour la qualité de ses produits. Vu sa situation matrimoniale, elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes et son activité marche à merveille.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 4 rouleaux de tissus légers, 4 cartons de “Super tasses”, 3 douzaines de nickel, 5 complets de tissus brodés, 2 cartons parfums, 2 pièces de pagne wax, etc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) ensuite elle les revend dans le camp militaire “CAMP TIEBA” de Sikasso et dans le quartier.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Alimata is a 38 year old widow and mother of 3 sons who lives in the home of her deceased father, in Kaboila II, the city center of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She did not have the chance to attend school for social reasons and 6 years ago, started to buy and sell various articles such as Wax pagne (decorative cloth), shoes, perfumes, embroidered fabric, "Super" basins, etc. She is well sought out by her clientele, made up of military personnel and their wives, among others, for the high quality of her products. The fact that she is a widow aids her in getting many orders and her business is running very well. With this loan she expects to buy, 4 rolls of light fabric, 4 cartons of "Super" basins, 5 complete sets of embroidered fabric, 2 cartons of perfume, 2 lengths of Wax pagne, etc. She buys her supplies in Bobo Dioulasso (at Burkina Faso) and resells them at the Camp Tieba military camp in Sikasso and in her neighborhood. With this loan she hopes to earn a monthly income of 100,000 Francs CFA which would be essentially used to increase her operating capital, contribute to family expenses, meet her loan payments and invest the remainder into her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various articles for resale

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene currently makes a living by operating a general store. She helps her husband with their daily expenditures. She also normally buys chicken meat from a wholesale supplier at a low price and retails it to earn additional income. She is 42-years old and resides in Barangay Alibago Enrile, Cagayan. She is married and has two children who are both attending primary school.

Marlene is very happy that her business is profitable for her family and she wants to improve it. She is asking for additional working capital of 17,000 PHP for her business. She would like to buy additional commodities for her store. She believes that if she has a larger inventory, her business will progress. Her dream is to someday have a permanent stall for her business and a comfortable house. She also hopes that her children will finish their studies. She has patience and knows, through her deep faith in God, that He will help her attain her goals in life.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Arslon

texts.en:
K. Arslon is 35 years old. He has been married for about 10 years. His wife is a housekeeper. Arslon has been running his business for about 7 years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of housewares. His business is their main source of income. Arslon is trying to have a wide range of goods of good quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income.

Today, Arslon requests $1500 USD that will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the range of his goods for sale. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new housewares to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol S. is from the village of Upper Lamac Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Carol runs a "sari-sari" or general store selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, in the local community. Carol has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carol joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Soliyakhon

texts.en:
Soliyakhon K. is a 50 year-old married mother of four children. She has sold children's clothing at her local market for the past ten years. Because of her business, she will be able to pay for her children to finish school. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger quantities of clothes to sell. Soliyakhon would like to use the loan to buy more bales of clothes with greater variety to increase her stock. She hopes to raise enough income to support all of her children to finish school.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy more bale of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Iyiola

texts.en: Iyiola is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells cosmetics. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita D. C. is a 52-year-old mother to three. She is a native of the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She ihusbandzs happily living with some of her children and with her husband Napoleon who is a fisherman and is 52 years of age.
She dreams of getting out from the spiral of poverty. In 2006, she joined ASHI(Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with hope of having access to capital to start a business. Before, she and her husband are partners in their business the bamboo set making. But considering their age, the business is quite tiring and laborious. When she received her first loan from ASHI, she constructed a fish cage in the lake. That was four years ago already. Now her business is getting bigger and brings her good income.
Now on her 4th loan, she proposes a loan of 18,000 pesos as additional capital for her fish cage business. The loan will be used to pay for 2 fish cages, renovation and repair of her other fish cages, 30 pieces of bamboos and labor expenses.
She is looking forward that with the trend of fishing as main source of income in the island is in demand; her business will grow and will bring her enough income for her family. She dreams of sending her younger children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: To pay for 2 fish cages, renovation and repair of her other fish cages, 30 pieces of bamboos and labor expenses.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ESTHER J. S. tiene 62 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Está casada y es socia del Banco comunal Cachanchugo
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to de primaria, porque desde esa edad empezó a dedicarse al campo .
Ella se dedica a hilar lana de las ovejas para hacer chompas, ponchos, guantes, bufandas, etc
Que los vende en los días de plaza en Usquil.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles lo invirtió para comprar mas lana de las  ovejas , tintes, palillos y grochets.
Con este crédito de 500 soles  comprará más productos como: lana, hilos, tintes, palillos, etc 
Maria Esther sueña con ampliar su negocio y unirse al grupo de artesanas de su pueblo para solicitar un mercado en Usquil en donde vender todos los días sus productos.

loans.use: comprará lana, hilos, tintes, palillos, etc

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma D. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 47 years old, married and has four adult children. Wilma makes food, especially snacks known as "biko" made of rice and coconut milk, for sale to the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to their financial services (she successfully repaid her previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC). Wilma is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital and to make an installment payment on her motorcycle.

This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital and a payment on her motorcycle

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es:
Peregrina tiene 49 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. Desde su niña aprendió a realizar las tareas agrícolas y hace varios meses intensificó su actividad de compra y venta de ganado ovino, los cuales cría en su casa y luego los vende a las personas que le solicitan mientras espera la cosecha. Cuando se acerca la poca de siembra y cosecha se requiere de la participación de toda la familia para cumplir con los trabajos del campo. Y aunque en años anteriores Peregrina sufrió pérdidas debido a los cambios climáticos y la devaluación de los precios de los productos, esto no ha sido razón suficiente para renunciar  a la agricultura, pues es su forma de vida y la que le permite seguir sosteniendo su hogar.
Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP, ella es muy puntual con sus pagos y dentro de su banco comunal siempre promueve la unidad de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono por sacos para sus cultivos.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky G. is from the town of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Jinky is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jinky owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transpo services to local community members. Jinky has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jinky joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jinky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Jinky is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used in renovating her house. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jinky from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Awudu

texts.en: Awudu is married and the father of two children, who are currently in senior and junior high school respectively. He is 49 years old and lives with his family in a community in the eastern region of Ghana. He is a supplier of cola nuts, which are mostly used by the Moslems. They are used as a dowry in their marriages and are also used to welcome visitors to the home. They a good taste and its can be chewed at all times. There are two types of cola nuts in Ghana; we have the red (hard) and the white (soft) nuts. He takes delivery of stock from the surrounding villages and sometimes treks to the northern part of Ghana to buy them in bulk. He requests the loan to buy more stock as we approach the Christmas festivities.

loans.use: To buy cola nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en: Kyalo K. operates a motorbike taxi. He provides taxi service to the staff of cooperatives in the local area and other walk-in clients. He has been in this business for the last 3 years.  Besides this he also does subsistence farming.  His business challenges are increasing fuel costs, a poor road network, and brake failures.  He is using the proceeds of KES 30,000 to buy another motorbike.  He is looking forward to opening a new station.  Kyalo is single and describes himself as hardworking and serious man.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Kyeijanga Group, Kihihi

texts.en: M. Benon is 43 years old and married with five children between the ages of 4 months and 13 years old, and he takes care of one dependant. He is a very hardworking and sociable man – the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. Benon is a trader, buying and selling agricultural produce, in addition to farming in Kyeyanga village. He has spent six years in his business and he is able to make 160,000/= profit a month. Benon says that his business is good except for insufficient capital and bad debts that affect his cash flow. At the moment, Benon says that he almost has a monopoly. He would like to have his own vehicle to help him serve his customers as well as a permanent house for his family and a plot in Mbarara town. Benon needs a loan to help increase his stock and increase his customer coverage.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Wilber José

texts.es:
El Sr. Wilber José N. Aragón  es trabajador del Centro de insumos Para la Salud desde el año 2005 lleva 4 años laborando para esa institución, como responsable de bodega numero 3.El  sr. Wilber Jose va a usar el crédito para la compra: de  cemento, piedrín, arena y Cerámica, por lo que me hacia falta poner cerámica en la casa. Por que ahora no tiene piso y así los niños no podrán ensuciarse más.
El Sr. Wilber José es casado y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y este todavía esta a su cargo.
Este el primer crédito que el Sr. Wilber José a tenido con CEPRODEL. 
Los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel me han ayudado en gran parte ya que e podido mejorar mi casa de habitación la cual me hacia falta poner cerámica en la casa.
texts.en:
Wilber Jose has been working with the medical supply business since 2005. He has been in charge of warehouse number 3 for four years. Wilber Jose will use the money from this loan to buy cement, stones, sand and ceramic tiles in order to add tiles to his home so that his children will not get dirty. At this time he does not have a floor in his home. Wilber Jose is married and has one child to care for. This is his first loan through CEPRODEL. Jose states, "The financing I got from ceprodel has helped me very much and I've been able to improve my home, which needed tiles."

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, stones, tiles

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey M., 38, is a hard-working father who makes sure that his family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Irine M., a housewife, they are blessed with one child. He has been managing their variety store for four years.

Joey has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than four years now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he was able to borrow ten times through CCT’s Cooperative.  He is consistent in paying his dues because he used the money he borrowed to buy added stock for his store.   His business lets him earn a profit of about $135 a month.  

Now with your help, he would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for his expanding business by buying additional stock for his store.

His priority in life is that he can raise his child well. He intends for his business to improve so that he can provide more for his family. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his store

loans.name: Khursandmurod

texts.en:
M. Khursandmurod is a hard-working man who actively contributes to the well-being of his family by selling vegetable oil in the market. He is married with three children. Khursandmurod spends many hours at his small stand in the market, waiting on his customers. In traditional Tajik cuisine, the majority of the dishes are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil. Especially our national dish “Pilau” needs a lot of cottonseed oil in order for it to be delicious. So the goods that Khursandmurod sells are of popular demand among the population.

Khursandmurod realizes that with the excellent quality and customer service he gives, he can grow his business. Today Khursandmurod is planning to increase his business. For this reason he requests 4600 Somoni. Khursandmurod is counting on your help and thanks you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cottonseed oil ito add to his inventory

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester I. is from the village of Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Ester is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ester owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as milk (in sachets), milo (in sachets), sardines, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Ester joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ester from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Milton Javier

texts.es:
EL SR. M. ES UN CLIENTE QUE SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA DE AJONJOLI  EN LA ZONA DE EL INGENIO M,ONTE ROSA  EL SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA Y REPARACION DE IMPLEMENTOS AGRICOLA 
ES UN CLIENTE QUE CON ESFUERZO PROPIO A ESTADO SEMBRANDO AREAS PEQUEÑAS SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA TECNIFICAR SUS LABORES AGRICOLAS.
texts.en:
Mr. M. is a client who is a sesame farmer in the Ingenio Monte Rosa area. He is asking for funds to buy and repair farming equipment. He is a client who has been, through his own efforts, planting in small areas and he wants the loan to make technical improvements to his farming tasks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rosibel Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz Rosibel tiene 60 años, ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Por lo que su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Ella tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su actividad y seguir adelante con este medio de vida. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado mejora su condición de vida. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, calcetines. Su deseo es mejorar su condición de vida para seguir proporcionándoles a sus hijos la educación necesaria.
texts.en:
Beatriz Rosibel, 60, has three children in her care. She has been a clothing merchant for over 6 years. She has always enjoyed working and getting ahead in life through this activity. She has always liked to improve her living standard. She is asking for funding to buy pants, shirts, underwear, socks. Her wish is to improve her living standard and to continue to provide her children with the necessary education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Fredick

texts.en: Fredrick is 37 years old, with one child who goes to school. He has been running a tailoring shop for five years to earn a living. He also runs a salon to earn enough money to pay for his family’s expenses and to educate his child. He hopes to buy more sewing machines to expand his business. He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy an overlock machine, fabric, threads, linings and pins.

loans.use: To  buy overlock machine, fabric, threads, cloth linings and pins.

loans.name: Maylen

texts.en:
Maylen P. is a 23-year old married mother of 1 child who lives in Hda Escolastica Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Maylen has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 2 years now and earns a living by running a food vending business. She is purchasing a solar lantern with a PHP 3,100 loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours, while at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.	
	
About NWTF’s Green Loan Products
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. Since many families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes, the solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   
		
About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lantern

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia T. is 31 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Senia has 5 years of experience in this business.  Senia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve and expand the business.

This is Senia's third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Senia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Kosiom Ole

texts.en:
Kosiom Ole T. is 41 years old. He is married to Naropil Tikan and is the father of four children. 

Kosiom is a farmer and he has been farming his own piece of land for the last fifteen years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the loan on cultivating his five acres which he has planted in maize and beans. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize and beans production. 

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and build a better house. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To cultivate his five acres which he has planted in maize and beans

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Djekadi  est un regroupement de femmes de la ville de Tominian qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 55 ans et une moyenne de 6  enfants par femme. 
Elles mènent différentes activités commerciales: vente d’articles divers, beignets et de condiments. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Les femmes du groupe Djekadi  achètent leurs marchandises à San et au Burkina Faso.  Elles vendent au marché de Tominian  et dans les villages environnants de la ville de Tominian.
Fatoumata D. est la vendeuse de beignet du groupe Djekadi, elle exerce au grand marché de Tominian et s’approvisionne en farines, huiles et accessoires au même grand marché de la ville de San. 
Elle compte acheter, 10 sacs de farine, 5 bidons d’huile et une grande quantité en produits accessoires (sucre, levure, sel de cuisine, arômes etc). 
Chaque soir Madame Fatoumata D. prend sa farine et la pétrie avec de l’eau, des œufs, du beurre, du sucre et de la levure. Après avoir bien mélangé ces ingrédients elle ferme bien la pâte jusqu’à 6 heures du matin, heure à laquelle elle commence à frire ses beignets.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17000FCFA par mois tandis que les autres membres comptent sur un profit mensuel de 14500FCFA.  
En dehors des remboursements de prêt elles utilisent une partie de leur revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses de leur famille. 
Dans les jours à venir elles comptent avoir des prêts de montant élevés pour étendre les activités.
texts.en:
Djekadi is a group of women from the city of Tominian who know one another through ties of kinship and community.  All of them are married and average 55 years of age and six children each.  These women run different businesses: selling various goods, beignets, and condiments.   To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle (group loan).  They purchase their merchandise in San and in Burkina Faso. They sell their goods at the Tominian market and in the villages surrounding Tominian.   Fatoumata D. is a beignet seller in the group.  She operates at the big market of Tominian and gets her supplies of flour, oil, and extras, like the others, at the big market of San City.  She plans on buying ten sacks of flour, five containers of oil, and a large quantity of extras (sugar, leavening, kitchen salt, flavorings, etc.)  Each evening, Fatoumata takes her flour and kneads it with some water, eggs, butter, sugar, and leavening.  After mixing these ingredients, she covers the dough until 6:00 AM, at which time she starts frying her beignets.   Fatoumata hopes to make monthly profit of 17,000 francs CFA per month, while the other members are counting on monthly profit of 14,500 francs. Besides repaying the loan, the group members use part of their revenues to meet family expenses.  In the days to come, the women plan on obtaining bigger loans to expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to make beignets

loans.name: Joffre Alberto

texts.es:
Joffre de 29 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento aun no terminada de construir,  solo cuenta con alcantarillado y luz como servicios basicos, el es guardia de seguridad y tiene una niña de tres años.

Joffre  se caso muy joven y tuvo que trabajar y ya no seguir estudiando para darles una mejor viva a su familia, pero como los ingresos de el no superan el presupuesto que tiene para construir su casa el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques y hierros para que su esposa e hija puedan vivir en mejores condiciones. 

El quiere un buen futuro para su familia, y tiene pensado en un futuro independizarse y tener su propio negocio para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Joffre, 29, lives in Las Orquídeas, Guayaquil, in a concrete house that is still unfinished; the only utilities it has are electricity and sewage. He works as a security guard and has a three-year-old daughter. Joffre married very young and had to go to work and drop out of school in order to provide for his family. However, because his income is insufficient to cover home construction costs, he needs a loan to buy cement, concrete blocks and iron so that his wife and daughter can live in better conditions. He wants a good future for his family and is considering becoming independent and having his own business in order to insure his family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es casada y tiene 3 hijos D. los 1 esta estudiando para ingresar a la universidad, Cristina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días, hace 7 años.
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal glorioso y necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz y gaseosas.
Los sueños D. Cristina son terminar D. construir su casa que hace algunos meses termino D. construir y aun le faltan los acabados.
texts.en:
Christina is married with three children. One child is studying in order to go to university. Christina has a grocery store at her house where she sells general grocery items such as drinks and fruit. She has been working in this business everyday for the past seven years. Christina is a member of the Glory Community Bank. She needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she will use to buy sugar, rice and sodas. Christina dreams of finishing the construction of her house that she has stopped working on several months ago because she lacked material.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy sugar, rice and soda.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
M. Gulchehra is 38 year old. She is married and has two children. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Shahrituz region. Gulchehra works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high because the national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and very important items of the dowry of any girl. She is one of the leading fabrics vendors in the market where she works. She is very determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for eight years. Gulchehra is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Gulchehra has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like to continue seeing her venture grow. Today she is requesting a loan of 5200 Somoni to increase her assorted inventory. With your help, Gulchehra will be able to make his business succeed.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda Z. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Daylinda is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Daylinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Daylinda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Daylinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Daylinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
